Description: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. It is used for transforming XML documents into other formats using XSLT stylesheets. Libxslt is based on libxml2, the XML C parser and toolkit.
core features: Transforming XML documents into different formats, XSLT processing, Integration with libxml2, Support for XPath and XSLT standards
tags: XML, XSLT, C Library, Transformation

Description: p11-kit is a library to manage PKCS#11 modules. It enables multiple applications to use the same PKCS#11 module in parallel, ensures that applications get access to the same serialized view of the module's state, and handles sharing access to the module state among applications.
core features: Manages PKCS#11 modules, Enables multiple applications to use the same module, Provides a serialized view of the module's state, Handles sharing access to the module state among applications
tags: library, PKCS#11, module management

Description: GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System) is a free and open-source geographic information system (GIS) software suite used for geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics/maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.
core features: Geospatial data management, Geospatial analysis, Image processing, Spatial modeling, Visualization
tags: GIS, Geospatial Analysis, Image Processing, Spatial Modeling, Visualization

Description: Advntr (Adaptive Variant Detection in NGS data with trained Recurrent Neural Networks) is a software tool that utilizes deep learning techniques to identify genetic variants in next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. It employs trained recurrent neural networks to accurately and efficiently detect variants in DNA sequences.
core features: Utilizes deep learning methods for variant detection, Trained recurrent neural networks for improved accuracy, Works with next-generation sequencing (NGS) data, Efficient and fast variant detection process
tags: NGS, Variant Detection, Deep Learning, DNA Sequencing

Description: libssh is a multiplatform C library implementing the SSHv2 protocol on client and server side. It provides a stable API, high performance, and is designed to be easy to use.
core features:
1. SSH client and server functionality
2. Support for various SSH protocols and key exchange algorithms
3. Integration with OpenSSL and mbedTLS
4. Session multiplexing
5. Portable and cross-platform
6. Easy-to-use API for developers
tags: SSH, library, networking
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Other Computer and Information Sciences

Description: Brass is a circuit design and simulation software that allows users to create, edit, and simulate electronic circuits. It provides a user-friendly interface for designing and testing circuits for various applications.
core features: Circuit design, Simulation, Electronic components library, User-friendly interface
tags: Circuit Design, Electronic Simulation, Electronics

Description: Lowcharts is a Python library for creating basic low-level charts with a simplistic and minimalistic interface. It aims to provide users with an easy-to-use tool for generating simple line charts, bar charts, and scatter plots.
core features:
1. Easy-to-use interface for creating basic charts.
2. Supports line charts, bar charts, and scatter plots.
3. Lightweight and minimalistic design.
4. Open-source and customizable.
tags: Python Library, Data Visualization, Charting Library

Description: AutoDock Vina is a molecular docking software program used for predicting the preferred binding modes of small molecule ligands to target proteins. It is widely used in drug discovery and computational biology to study the interactions between ligands and protein targets.
core features:
1. Predicting preferred binding modes of small molecules to target proteins
2. Optimizing ligand binding affinity
3. High performance and efficiency in docking simulations
4. User-friendly interface
5. Supports various file formats for input and output
tags: molecular docking, drug discovery, computational biology, binding affinity prediction

Description: Wtdbg is a bioinformatics software tool designed for the assembly, comparison, and analysis of long-read sequencing data. It is optimized for dealing with noisy and error-prone reads commonly produced by technologies like PacBio and Oxford Nanopore.
core features: De novo assembly of long-read sequencing data, Error correction and consensus sequence generation, Visualization of assembly graphs and genomes, Comparative analysis of genomic data
tags: Bioinformatics, Long-read sequencing, Assembly, Genomics

Description: The xcb-util-image library provides a number of functions used for manipulating and creating XCB format images, including loading and saving images to disk in various formats.
core features:
1. Load and save XCB format images in various file formats.
2. Manipulate XCB images using different operations.
3. Convert images between different formats supported by XCB.
4. Provides utility functions for working with XCB images.
tags: image processing, XCB, library
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: nlohmann_json is a JSON library for modern C++. It provides a simple and efficient way to work with JSON data in C++ programs.
core features: Parsing and serializing JSON data, Support for various data types including strings, numbers, arrays, and objects, Flexible and intuitive API, Header-only library for easy integration
tags: JSON library, C++

Description: ARM GNU Toolchain is an open-source collection of programming tools for creating software on ARM architecture-based systems. It includes compilers, assemblers, linkers, and other tools necessary for software development.
core features: Compilers for C, C++, and other languages, Assemblers and linkers for ARM architecture, Open-source and freely available, Support for various ARM processors and microcontrollers
tags: software development, ARM architecture, compilers, open-source

Description: Numexpr is a fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy. With it, expressions that operate on arrays (like 3*A+4*B) are accelerated and use less memory than doing the same calculation in Python.
core features:
1. Fast evaluation of array expressions
2. Use of less memory during calculations
3. Built for NumPy arrays
4. Supports multi-threading for parallel computation
5. Integration with other numerical libraries like SciPy
tags: numerical computation, array calculations

Description: Miniconda is a free minimal installer for conda. It is a package management system that simplifies the installation and management of software packages. Miniconda allows users to create environments containing dependencies from a specified list of packages, making it easier to manage different projects with conflicting package requirements.
core features: Package management system, Environment creation and management, Dependency resolution
tags: Package Management, Dependency Management, Software Installation

Description: Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package (VASP) is a package for performing ab initio quantum-mechanical molecular dynamics (MD) using pseudopotentials and a plane wave basis set.
core features: Ab initio quantum-mechanical molecular dynamics simulations, Pseudopotentials, Plane wave basis set
tags: computational chemistry, molecular dynamics, quantum mechanics, materials science

Description: Interpretable Machine Learning
core features: iml is an R package that enables interpretable machine learning for regression and classification models. It provides a suite of tools for understanding the predictions of machine learning models by creating interpretable explanations.
tags: machine learning, interpretability, model explanation

Description: Flit is a simple tool for building and distributing Python packages.
core features: Building Python packages, Distributing Python packages
tags: Python packaging, Package management

Description: Lustre is an open-source parallel distributed file system commonly used for large-scale cluster computing. It is designed for high-performance computing (HPC) environments and is known for its scalability, performance, and reliability.
core features: Parallel distributed file system, Scalable to petabytes of storage, High performance for HPC applications, Support for large numbers of clients
tags: file system, parallel computing, HPC, cluster computing

Description: ModTree is a software tool for the reconstruction of modular trees of mRNA transcripts and alternative splicing events. It is designed to identify and visualize the modular organization of alternative splicing events within a transcriptome.
core features:
1. Reconstruction of modular trees of mRNA transcripts 
2. Identification of alternative splicing events 
3. Visualization of modular organization of alternative splicing events 
4. Analysis of transcriptome data 
5. Modular representation of splicing events
tags: transcriptomics, alternative splicing, modular trees, data analysis

Description: run_dbcan is a computational pipeline for the automatic annotation of carbohydrate-active enzymes (CAZymes) from metagenomic data. It integrates various tools and databases to predict CAZymes and classify them into different families based on sequence homology and conserved protein domains.
core features:
1. Automatic annotation of CAZymes from metagenomic data
2. Integration of multiple tools and databases for prediction and classification of CAZymes
3. Classification of CAZymes into different families based on sequence homology and conserved domains
4. User-friendly interface for running the pipeline and obtaining annotation results
5. Customization options for adjusting parameters and databases for annotation
tags: computational biology, bioinformatics, metagenomics

Description: Rust is a multi-paradigm system programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency.
core features: Memory safety without garbage collection, Concurrency without data races, Minimal runtime, Low-level control like C, Strong type system, Pattern matching, Traits for code reuse, Cargo - the package manager and build system
tags: Programming Language, System Programming, Concurrency

Description: Jmol is an open-source Java viewer for chemical structures in 3D with features for visualization, analysis, and manipulation of molecular structures.
core features: Jmol allows users to view 3D chemical structures, display crystal structures, visualize protein structures, animate molecules, and perform measurements and analysis on molecular structures. It supports a wide range of file formats for input and output, including CIF, PDB, XYZ, and more. Users can customize the display of molecules with various rendering options, color schemes, and labeling.
tags: molecular visualization, molecular analysis, chemistry
research discipline: Physical Chemistry, Inorganic and Nuclear Chemistry

Description: libedit is an open-source library that provides a readline-like interface for line editing in command-line applications. It is a replacement for GNU Readline used in many Unix-like systems, providing similar functionality but with a more permissive open-source license (BSD-style license).
core features:
1. Provides line editing and history capabilities for command-line applications.
2. Offers custom key bindings and configuration options.
3. Supports basic features like command history, line editing, and tab completion.
4. Easily integrated into various Unix-like operating systems and applications.
tags: library, command-line, line editing, history, open-source

Description: Allpaths-LG is a whole-genome shotgun assembly algorithm developed for large genomes, especially for those of diploid organisms. It aims to leverage the increased coverage provided by short reads to achieve high-quality assemblies.
core features:
- Able to handle large genomes efficiently
- Specifically designed for diploid organisms
- Utilizes short reads for increased coverage
- Capable of generating high-quality assemblies
tags: Genome Assembly, Bioinformatics, NGS Analysis

Description: BamKit is a toolkit for analyzing and manipulating BAM files, which are binary sequence alignment/map format files commonly used in bioinformatics for storing mapped sequence data.
core features: BamKit provides functionalities for parsing BAM files, extracting alignment statistics, filtering reads, marking duplicates, sorting reads, and indexing BAM files.
tags: bioinformatics, HPC tools

Description: KISSDE (Kinetic Simulator of Synthetic Degradation and Expression) is a software tool for simulating the kinetics of gene expression and protein degradation in synthetic biological systems. It allows users to model the dynamics of gene expression and protein degradation processes to better understand and optimize synthetic genetic circuits.
core features: Simulation of gene expression dynamics, Modeling protein degradation kinetics, Optimization of synthetic genetic circuits, Analysis of synthetic biological systems
tags: computational biology, bioinformatics

Description: Xvfb (X virtual framebuffer) is an in-memory display server for Unix-like systems that enable running graphical applications without a display.
core features: Run graphical applications without a display, Create virtual displays, Lightweight and easy to use
tags: display server, headless, virtual display

Description: Coverage is a tool used to measure the extent to which the source code of a program has been tested. It is often used in software development to assess the quality and thoroughness of testing by determining which parts of the code have been executed during testing.
core features: Measures code coverage to evaluate the effectiveness of test suites, Identifies parts of the code that have not been tested, Helps developers understand the quality of their testing efforts, Can be used to improve test coverage and identify potential gaps in testing
tags: code coverage, testing, software development, quality assurance
research field: Engineering and Technology, Computer and Information Sciences, Software Engineering, Systems, and Development

Description: Amplicon analysis and metabarcoding toolkit (amptk) is a bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing high-throughput amplicon sequencing data such as 16S rRNA gene sequences and Internal Transcribed Spacer (ITS) sequences. It provides various modules for processing raw sequence data, including demultiplexing, quality filtering, denoising, chimera removal, operational taxonomic unit (OTU) picking, taxonomic assignment, and diversity analysis.
core features:
1. Demultiplexing and quality filtering of raw sequencing data.
2. Denoising and dereplication of sequences to remove errors.
3. Chimera removal to improve the accuracy of data.
4. OTU picking based on clustering at specified sequence similarities.
5. Taxonomic assignment of OTUs using reference databases.
6. Diversity analyses for comparing microbial communities.
tags: bioinformatics, amplicon analysis, metabarcoding, high-throughput sequencing, 16S rRNA gene, ITS sequences

Description: libgpuarray is a library that provides a common, numpy-like array object to represent GPU data for array-oriented algorithms in Python. It is designed to work with various libraries whose primary focus is on GPU acceleration, such as Theano or PyCUDA.
core features:
1. Provides a common array object for representing GPU data.
2. Designed to work seamlessly with GPU acceleration libraries like Theano and PyCUDA.
3. Facilitates array-oriented computations on GPUs in Python.
4. Offers optimized GPU memory management and data transfer operations.
tags: GPU acceleration, array-oriented algorithms, Python library

Description: R-rhtslib is an R package that provides an interface to the HTSlib C library, which enables high-performance file input/output with SAM, BAM, and CRAM file formats.
core features: Interface to HTSlib C library for file input/output, Support for SAM, BAM, and CRAM file formats, High-performance data processing, Integration with R environment
tags: R package, HTSlib interface, Data processing, Bioinformatics

Description: BamTools is a software toolkit for manipulating BAM (Binary Alignment Map) files. It provides both a C++ API for BAM file input and output, and a command-line tool for performing various operations on BAM files.
core features: Efficient BAM file reading and writing, Tools for filtering, sorting, merging, indexing BAM files, Support for extracting regions, statistics, and alignments from BAM files, Integration with other bioinformatics tools
tags: Bioinformatics, BAM files, Sequence alignment, Toolkit

Description: OSU Micro-Benchmarks is a suite of parallel micro-benchmarks written in C with MPI and OpenMP implementations, designed for evaluating the performance of parallel computing systems and HPC networks.
core features: 1. Contains a range of micro-benchmarks to measure various aspects such as latency, bandwidth, and message rate. 2. Supports MPI and OpenMP implementations for evaluating parallel performance. 3. Enables detailed performance analysis for HPC systems and networks. 4. Provides scalability testing capabilities for parallel computing applications.
tags: performance evaluation, HPC, benchmarking

Description: dropest is a statistical software package for carrying out robust power and sample size calculations in two-sample comparisons.
core features: Some core features of dropest include robust power calculations, sample size calculations, adjustment for non-normality in data, and computation of power curves.
tags: statistical software, power calculations, sample size calculations

Description: Tkinter is a standard GUI toolkit for Python. It is included with most Python installations and is widely used for building desktop applications in Python.
core features: Cross-platform GUI toolkit, Simple and easy to use, Supports various widgets like buttons, labels, textboxes, etc., Integration with Python programming language, Extensive documentation and community support
tags: GUI, Python, Toolkit, Desktop Applications
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems, and Development

Description: db is a simple and minimalistic database library for Python, designed to provide a lightweight interface for basic database operations.
core features: 1. Simple and easy-to-use interface for database operations. 2. Support for common database operations like creating tables, inserting data, querying data, updating records, and deleting records. 3. Lightweight and minimalistic design for quick integration into Python projects.
tags: database, Python library
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: JupyterLab is a web-based interactive development environment for Jupyter notebooks, code, and data. It provides a flexible and extensible platform for exploring, analyzing, and visualizing data.
core features: Interactive development environment, Support for Jupyter notebooks and code editing, Data visualization capabilities, Customizable user interface, Extensible through plugins and extensions
tags: IDE, Data Analysis, Visualization, Notebooks, Web-based

Description: CryoSPARC is a comprehensive software platform for cryo-EM data processing that enables high-resolution structure determination of biological macromolecules.
core features: Automated particle picking, 3D heterogeneity analysis, Ab-initio 3D reconstruction, High-resolution refinement, Model building and validation
tags: cryo-EM, biological macromolecules, structural biology, data processing

Description: r-lazyeval is an R package that provides a set of tools for non-standard evaluation in R. It allows for delayed evaluation of expressions and promises, enabling advanced programming techniques in R.
core features:
1. Provides tools for non-standard evaluation in R.
2. Supports delayed evaluation of expressions.
3. Enables advanced programming techniques.
tags: R package, Non-standard evaluation, Programming

Description: TaxonKit is a fast and versatile toolkit for biological taxonomy. It is designed to support the retrieval and formatting of taxonomic information from popular data sources, such as NCBI and GTDB. TaxonKit aims to provide efficient ways to extract and manipulate taxonomic data for downstream analysis.
core features:
1. Retrieval of taxonomic information from NCBI and GTDB databases
2. Batch processing of taxonomic data
3. Formatting and standardization of taxonomic data
4. Integration with other bioinformatics tools and pipelines
tags: bioinformatics, taxonomy, data retrieval, data manipulation

RP Name: aces, anvil, expanse, faster, kyric, ookami
Description: curl is a command-line tool and library for transferring data with URLs. It supports various protocols including HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, FTPS, SCP, SFTP, and more. It is widely used in scripting and automation tasks, as well as for debugging network issues.
core features: Supports various protocols like HTTP, FTP, SCP, SFTP, etc., Allows for easy transfer of data with URLs, Command-line tool for scripting and automation tasks, Highly customizable with many options and configurations
tags: networking, data transfer, command-line, scripting
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Other Computer and Information Sciences

Description: Exonerate is a versatile tool for sequence alignment and homology search. It is widely used for comparison of protein and nucleotide sequences against a wide range of genomic databases.
core features: Flexible sequence alignment and homology search algorithms, Support for protein-protein, DNA-DNA, protein-DNA, and EST-genome alignments, Ability to handle large genomic datasets efficiently, Customizable scoring parameters for alignment, Output in various formats for downstream analysis
tags: sequence alignment, homology search, bioinformatics, genomics

Description: libnotify is a library that provides a way to display desktop notifications to users. It is typically used by desktop environments such as GNOME to show notifications for various events and applications.
core features:
1. Display desktop notifications
2. Customizable notification content
3. Support for actions within notifications
4. Integration with desktop environments
5. Cross-platform compatibility
tags: notifications, desktop, library

Description: glibc, the GNU C Library, is an essential part of most systems running the Linux kernel. It provides the necessary functionality for programs written in the C programming language to interact with the operating system and hardware.
core features: Implementation of the standard C library functions, System calls and low-level interfaces, Dynamic memory allocation and management, Thread support and synchronization, Localization support
tags: C Library, Operating System, System Programming

Description: methylpy is a Python package designed for the analysis of DNA methylation data obtained from bisulfite sequencing. It provides various tools for processing, analyzing, visualizing, and interpreting DNA methylation data.
core features: Preprocessing of bisulfite sequencing data, Identification of differentially methylated regions (DMRs), Annotation of DMRs with genomic features, Visualization of methylation patterns
tags: DNA methylation, Bisulfite sequencing, Epigenetics, Bioinformatics, Python package

Description: CCDB (Cell Cycle Database) is a freely accessible, comprehensive resource for the cell cycle community. It provides information and tools to study cell cycle regulation and its role in cancer and other diseases.
core features: Access to curated cell cycle-related data, Tools for analyzing cell cycle regulation, Links to relevant literature and resources
tags: Cell Cycle, Cell Biology, Database

Description: multichoose is a Python library that implements the concept of multichoose, which calculates the number of ways to choose a certain number of items from a set where each item can be chosen multiple times.
core features: Calculates the number of combinations for choosing items with repetition from a set, Handles scenarios where each item can be chosen multiple times, Supports efficient computation for large numbers of items and repetitions
tags: Python Library, Combinatorics, Mathematics

RP Name: aces, anvil, darwin, delta, expanse, faster
Description: ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and visualization application. It is designed to handle large data sets and offers a wide range of visualization techniques to analyze and interact with the data.
core features: Supports various data formats including VTK, XML, HDF5, and several others, Render large data sets with interactive exploration capabilities, Offers advanced visualization techniques like volume rendering, contouring, and vector field visualization, Support for scripting with Python, Parallel processing capabilities for faster computation
tags: visualization, data analysis, open-source, multi-platform
research field: Physical Sciences, Engineering and Technology, Natural Sciences, Computer and Information Sciences, Other Natural Sciences

Description: RevBayes is a probabilistic programming framework for Bayesian inference of phylogenetic trees and evolutionary parameters.
core features: RevBayes provides a flexible and customizable environment for specifying complex phylogenetic models, performing Bayesian inference using Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms, and incorporating various evolutionary models and priors.
tags: phylogenetics, Bayesian inference, evolutionary biology

Description: drep (Dereplicator) is a tool for fast and accurate dereplication of genomes in microbial datasets. It helps to identify and remove duplicate sequences to ensure that downstream analyses are not biased by redundant data.
core features: Dereplication of microbial genomes, Identification and removal of duplicate sequences, Improving efficiency and accuracy of downstream analyses
tags: microbiome, genome analysis, bioinformatics

Description: Khmer is a set of tools for working with DNA sequence data that is extremely efficient both in terms of speed and memory consumption. It is designed to pre-process sequencing data to reduce the memory requirements of de Bruijn graph based assemblers for metagenome data. The tools can be used for counting k-mers and finding k-mers that occur many times, trimming and error-trimming data, digital normalization of reads, and partitioning large data sets.
core features: K-mer counting, Data trimming and error-trimming, Digital normalization of reads, Partitioning large data sets
tags: Bioinformatics, HPC tools, Computational software

Description: r-rngtools is an R package for random number generation which provides tools to efficiently create pseudorandom and non-uniform random numbers. It includes random number generators with additional functionalities for specifying distributions and independent streams.
core features:
1. Pseudorandom number generation
2. Non-uniform random number generation
3. Additional functionalities for specifying distributions
4. Support for independent streams
tags: R package, Random Number Generation

Description: The Matlab Engine API for Python provides a Python interface to the MATLAB engine. It enables you to call MATLAB functions and evaluate MATLAB expressions from within your Python environment.
core features: Allows calling MATLAB functions and evaluating expressions from Python, Enables integration of MATLAB algorithms into Python scripts and applications, Facilitates data sharing between MATLAB and Python environments
tags: Matlab, Python, Integration, Data sharing
research field: Engineering and Technology, Computer and Information Sciences, Other Computer and Information Sciences

Description: Matplotlib is a plotting library for the Python programming language and its numerical mathematics extension NumPy. It provides an object-oriented API for embedding plots into applications using general-purpose GUI toolkits like Tkinter, wxPython, Qt, or GTK.
core features: Matplotlib can generate various types of plots, such as line plots, histogram, bar charts, error charts, scatter plots, etc. It supports customizing plot styles, labels, colors, and markers. Matplotlib can create figures, subplots, and axes for advanced plot layouts. It also allows saving plots in different file formats like PNG, PDF, SVG, etc.
tags: plotting, data visualization, Python library

Description: r-later is a command-line tool that enables users to delay the execution of a command until a specified time in the future.
core features: Delay the execution of commands, Schedule commands to run at a specific time, Easy to use command-line interface
tags: command-line tool, scheduler, task automation

Description: Prodigal is a microbial gene finding program that identifies protein-coding regions in microbial genomes. It uses a combination of intrinsic and extrinsic signals to accurately predict genes in bacterial and archaeal genomes.
core features: Gene prediction in microbial genomes, Utilizes a combination of intrinsic and extrinsic signals for accuracy, Supports prediction of both start and stop codons, Handles overlapping genes and fragmented assemblies
tags: gene prediction, microbial genomes

Description: bamsurgeon is a toolkit for adding mutations to a .bam file for use in testing variant calling pipelines. It can be used to spike in synthetic SNVs, indels, and/or denovo SVs to specific genomic coordinates.
core features:
1. Spike in synthetic single nucleotide variants (SNVs)
2. Introduce insertions and deletions (indels) at specified genomic locations
3. Add de novo structural variants (SVs) to a given genomic position
4. Allow for customization of mutation rate, allele frequency, and mutation type
5. Test variant calling pipelines by simulating mutations in a controlled manner
tags: genomic data, mutation simulation, variant calling, bioinformatics

Description: SPICE (Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments) is a remote display system that provides a way for virtualized guests to interact with a host. The SPICE server facilitates the sharing of USB devices, audio, video, and more between a guest and a host system. It enables high-quality interactive remote desktop experiences for virtual machines.
core features: Remote display system, Allows sharing of USB devices, audio, and video, Facilitates high-quality interactive remote desktop experiences, Enhances virtual machine interaction with the host system
tags: remote display, virtualization, USB sharing, audio-video sharing

Description: GStreamer is a multimedia framework that allows the construction of graphs of media-handling components, ranging from simple Ogg/Vorbis playback to complex audio (mixing) and video (non-linear editing) processing. It is designed to be easily extended with new plugins that provide new functionality.
core features: 1. Support for a wide range of media formats and protocols. 2. Modular architecture that allows flexible construction of multimedia pipelines. 3. Extensive plugin architecture for additional features and format support. 4. Cross-platform compatibility. 5. Open-source and actively developed community.
tags: multimedia, framework, media processing, audio, video

Description: pybind11 is a lightweight header-only library that enables seamless interoperability between C++11 or later and Python. It provides a simple and concise way to expose C++ functions and classes to Python, making it easy to write Python bindings for existing C++ code.
core features: Header-only library, Seamless interoperability between C++ and Python, Minimal boilerplate code required, Supports Python 2 and 3 as well as CPython and PyPy interpreters, Flexible and efficient conversion of data types
tags: C++, Python, Interoperability, Bindings
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: AmberTools is a suite of software for molecular dynamics simulations, energy minimization, and trajectory analysis in the field of computational chemistry. It provides tools for the refinement and analysis of biomolecular structures.
core features: AmberTools offers a wide range of functionality for molecular dynamics simulations, including energy minimization, molecular dynamics simulation, structure analysis, and visualization. It supports various force fields and parameters for simulating biomolecules.
tags: molecular dynamics, computational chemistry, biomolecular structure, energy minimization

Description: pigz, which stands for parallel implementation of gzip, is a compression utility that uses multiple processors and cores to compress files quickly and efficiently. It is compatible with gzip and gunzip, allowing for seamless integration with existing gzip workflows.
core features: Parallel compression using multiple processors/cores, High compression/decompression speed, Integration with gzip and gunzip utilities, Multi-threading support
tags: Compression, Parallel Processing, Utility, Command-line tool

Description: Parasail is a SIMD C library for global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments. It is optimized for typical x86 and x86-64 architectures, automatically detecting and using AVX, AVX2, and/or SSE4.1 vectorization as well as the KNC instruction set when available. Parasail includes the Smith-Waterman-Gotoh algorithm for local alignments and the Needleman-Wunsch algorithm for global alignments.
core features:
1. Efficiently performs global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments.
2. Utilizes SIMD optimizations for optimized performance.
3. Supports various sequence alignment algorithms like Smith-Waterman-Gotoh and Needleman-Wunsch.
4. Written in C for easy integration into existing codebases.
tags: bioinformatics, computational software, HPC tools

Description: SingleM is a standalone toolkit for microbial population genomics that enables the assembly, annotation, and variant calling of individual microbial genomes from metagenomes.
core features: Assembly of individual microbial genomes from metagenomic data, Annotation of microbial genomes, Variant calling within microbial populations
tags: microbial genomics, metagenomics, genome assembly, variant calling

Description: PAML (Phylogenetic Analysis by Maximum Likelihood) is a package of programs for phylogenetic analysis of DNA or protein sequences using maximum likelihood. It provides a wide range of tools for evolutionary analysis and inference in a phylogenetic context.
core features: Key features of PAML include phylogeny inference, evolutionary rate estimation, branch-site and branch-specific models, selection analysis, divergence time estimation, and codon models. It allows users to perform various tests and analyses to understand the evolutionary mechanisms underlying sequence data.
tags: phylogenetics, evolutionary analysis, maximum likelihood, phylogenetic inference

Description: readr is a R package used for reading flat/tabular text files into R easily and efficiently. It provides a high-performance and user-friendly way to import structured data from files.
core features: Efficient reading of delimited files, Support for various file formats like CSV, TSV, FWF, Consistent and predictable behavior for column types, Easy handling of file encoding and column specification
tags: data import, data processing, data manipulation

Description: R package for the analysis of luminescence data in archaeology and geosciences. It provides functions for reading luminescence data, data processing, statistical analysis, and visualization.
core features:
1. Reading and processing of luminescence data files
2. Statistical analysis of luminescence data
3. Visualization tools for luminescence data
4. Integration with other R packages for comprehensive analysis
tags: Luminescence Data, Data Analysis, R Package

Description: Maturin is a Rust-native build system for Python packages that allows users to create wheels for their Python packages written in Rust. It aims to simplify the process of packaging and distributing Python extensions written in Rust, providing a seamless integration between Rust and Python ecosystems.
core features: Facilitates building Python packages with Rust extensions, Enables creation of Python wheels for packages with Rust code, Simplifies distribution and packaging process for hybrid Rust-Python projects
tags: Python packaging, Rust programming language, Build system, Python extensions, Package distribution

Description: BioPerl is a collection of Perl modules that provide a toolkit for bioinformatics programming. It aims to facilitate the development of bioinformatics applications by providing reusable components and utilities.
core features: Access to biological databases, Sequence analysis tools, Phylogenetic analysis, Structural biology support, Data manipulation and conversion functions
tags: Bioinformatics, Perl, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis, Structural Biology

Description: R package for detecting breakpoints in DNA methylation data
core features:
1. Identifying differentially methylated regions (DMRs) in DNA methylation data
2. Utilizes a bump hunting approach to detect differences in methylation levels
3. Provides statistical methods for assessing significance of detected DMRs
tags: bioinformatics, statistical analysis, DNA methylation

Description: IDL (Interactive Data Language) is a programming language used for data analysis, visualization, and application development. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for scientific research and data processing.
core features: IDL offers a wide range of mathematical functions, statistical analysis tools, image processing capabilities, and interactive graphics for data visualization. It supports data input/output operations, array handling, and extensive libraries for various scientific and engineering applications.
tags: software, data analysis, data visualization, scientific research

Description: Cluster is a software package for physically based clustering and cluster analysis of numerical datasets. It provides tools for identifying groups of similar data points based on defined similarity metrics.
core features: Physically based clustering algorithms, Cluster analysis of numerical datasets, Definition of similarity metrics for data point grouping, Visualization tools for clustered data analysis
tags: Clustering, Data Analysis, Visualization

Description: TorchANI is a PyTorch implementation of the ANI (Anisotropic Network Model) neural network potential for predicting molecular interactions and properties in chemical systems.
core features: PyTorch implementation of ANI neural network potential, Predicts molecular interactions and properties in chemical systems, Support for various chemical tasks such as energy predictions, force predictions, and molecular geometry optimizations, Option for multi-GPU training and inference

Description: Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of open-source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. Description: libarchive is a programming library that can create and read several different streaming archive formats, including most popular tar variants, cpio, and zip. Description: Libseccomp is an open-source library that provides an easy-to-use, platform-independent interface for working with the Linux Kernel's syscall filtering mechanism. Description: Autoconf Archive is a collection of more than 500 macros for GNU Autoconf that have been contributed as free software by friendly supporters of the cause from all over the Internet. These macros have been tentatively designed to work with any free software package that uses GNU Autoconf; they should work with Autoconf-2.50 (1999) through Autoconf-2.70 (2010-now).
core features: 1. Extensive library of more than 500 macros for GNU Autoconf. 2. Allows easy testing for the availability of features, functions, or system characteristics. 3. Continuously updated and maintained by contributors from the community.

Description: Z3 is a high-performance theorem prover being developed at Microsoft Research. Z3 is a state-of-the-art SMT (Satisfiability Modulo Theories) solver used in various applications including software and hardware verification, security, AI and ML, and more. It provides a programming interface for both C and Python.
core features: Z3 provides efficient decision procedures for theories such as linear and nonlinear arithmetics, arrays, bit-vectors, and more. It supports a wide range of theories and is known for its high performance and reliability. Z3 can be used for solving logical formulas over integers and real numbers, as well as bitvector and Boolean operations.

Description: The r-backports package provides features and enhanced functionality for the R programming language by backporting new features found in recent versions of R to older versions of R. Description: HDBSCAN (Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise) is a clustering algorithm that is based on density rather than distance, and in contrast to many other clustering algorithms, HDBSCAN has a parameterless approach that automatically determines the number of clusters in the data.

1. Vector and matrix classes
2. Random number generators
3. Physical constants and units

Description: KMA (K-mer Matching Alignment) is a tool for mapping sequencing reads to reference sequences. It utilizes k-mer based alignment to efficiently and accurately map reads in both nucleotide and amino acid sequence data.

Description: DAL is a library for collision avoidance in robotics applications.

3. Identifying regions of similarity at the nucleotide level
4. Support for genome mapping and finding gene structures

Description: FreeType is a software font engine that is designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images). Description: Py-kiwisolver is a fast and efficient C library for solving linear programming problems. It provides an interface to the Kiwi library, which is a constraint solver that can be used for various optimization tasks.

3. Supports various optimization tasks.

Description: R-munsell is a package that provides easy access to Munsell colours in R. The Munsell system is a widely used color classification system that categorizes colors based on three color dimensions: hue, value, and chroma.
