core features: Detection and annotation of gene clusters involved in secondary metabolite production, Prediction of putative functions of biosynthetic enzymes, Identification of potential bioactive compounds and natural products, Visualization of gene clusters and biosynthetic pathways, Integration of multiple bioinformatics tools and databases
tags: bioinformatics, genome mining, biosynthetic gene clusters, secondary metabolites

Description: EasyBuild-ACES is a collection of EasyBuild framework recipes for building commonly used software packages within the Army Combat Capabilities Development Command Army Research Laboratory (CCDC-ARL) Computational and Information Sciences Directorate (CISD) Advanced Computing, Engineering and Software (ACES) research group.
core features: EasyBuild-ACES provides recipes for building software packages often used by the CCDC-ARL CISD ACES research group, allowing for easy deployment and management of these tools.
tags: software development, tools, packages

Description: cellrank-Krylov is a Python library designed to provide cell fate prediction and lineage analysis for single-cell RNA sequencing data using Krylov subspace methods. It offers tools for exploring cell differentiation trajectories and uncovering crucial cell states in the data.
core features: Cell fate prediction, Lineage analysis, Single-cell RNA sequencing data analysis, Cell differentiation trajectories, Identification of key cell states
tags: Single-cell analysis, Lineage analysis, RNA sequencing, Cell fate prediction

Description: pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and libraries. It helps in specifying compilation options by providing the compiler options needed to use a library. It also provides information about installed libraries.
core features: Facilitates specifying compilation options, Provides compiler options needed to use a library, Offers information about installed libraries
tags: compilation, library management, software development

Description: go-bootstrap is a Go programming language template project that provides a starting point for building Go applications with a predefined project structure, configuration, and best practices.
core features: 1. Predefined project structure for Go applications. 2. Built-in configuration setup. 3. Integration with popular Go libraries. 4. Simplifies starting a new Go project.
tags: Go, Template, Project Structure, Best Practices

Description: Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences. It is particularly well-suited for aligning sequencing reads of DNA sequences, such as those generated by high-throughput sequencing technologies.
core features: Ultrafast alignment of sequencing reads to long reference sequences, Memory-efficient indexing and alignment process, Support for gapped, local, and end-to-end alignment modes, Alignment and mapping of DNA sequencing reads, High accuracy in finding alignments, Scalability for large genomes and datasets
tags: alignment, sequencing reads, DNA sequences, high-throughput sequencing, bioinformatics, genomics

Description: Local is a development environment that allows for the creation of WordPress websites on a local machine. It provides a simplified setup process for WordPress development, allowing users to work on website projects without needing an internet connection.
core features: Local WordPress development environment setup, Simplified website project creation, Offline development capabilities, Easy site cloning and deployment
tags: WordPress, Development Environment, Website Development

Description: R-s4vectors is an R package that provides an efficient implementation of vectors with support for various data types and structures to represent data as vectors in R programming language. It offers enhanced performance and functionality for vector operations and manipulation.
core features: Efficient implementation of vectors in R, Support for different data types and structures, Enhanced performance for vector operations, Flexible and versatile data representation
tags: R package, Vector operations, Data manipulation, Programming in R

Description: r-formula is a software package designed for statistical computing and graphics in R. It provides a simple and intuitive formula interface for specifying statistical models in R programming language.
core features:
1. Easy-to-use formula interface for specifying regression models and other statistical analyses
2. Supports a wide range of statistical models including linear regression, logistic regression, ANOVA, and more
3. Allows users to easily manipulate and transform variables within the formula
4. Provides intuitive syntax for specifying interactions and nested effects in statistical models
5. Enables visualization of model formulae and mathematical expressions
tags: Statistical Computing, Formula Interface, Regression Analysis

Description: PyTensor is a Python library for tensor operations and computations. It provides a high-level interface for handling multi-dimensional arrays and performing various tensor manipulations.
core features: Efficient tensor operations, Support for multi-dimensional arrays, Tensor decomposition and factorization methods, Integration with other Python scientific computing libraries
tags: Python library, Tensor operations, Scientific computing

Description: The r-rhdf5 package is an R interface to the HDF5 data format. HDF5 is a versatile data model for storing and managing large and complex data. This package allows R users to read and write data in HDF5 files, providing efficient storage and high-performance access to data.
core features: Read and write HDF5 data files in R, Efficient storage and retrieval of complex data structures, High-performance access to large datasets, Integration with R's data manipulation and visualization tools
tags: R package, HDF5 data format, Data storage, Data management

Description: Lumpy is a structural variant caller that can detect various types of genomic variations using paired-end short reads, such as deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications. It provides insights into the structural organization of a genome.
core features:
1. Detects structural variants from paired-end short reads
2. Identifies deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications
3. Provides information on the structural organization of the genome
4. Can be used for variant discovery and genotyping
tags: genomic analysis, structural variant detection

Description: RcppArmadillo provides an interface for seamless integration of Armadillo C++ library with R, allowing for high-performance linear algebra operations within R environment.
core features:
1. Integration of Armadillo C++ library with R for efficient linear algebra computations.
2. Enables easy and fast manipulation of matrices, vectors, and arrays within R.
3. Provides a simple and clean syntax for expressing complex algebraic operations.
4. Supports various linear algebra functions and operations, such as matrix multiplication, decompositions, and solvers.
tags: linear algebra, matrix computation, R integration

Description: Anvi'o is an analysis and visualization platform for omics data. It is designed to help researchers explore complex microbial datasets and perform various tasks such as binning, genome assembly, metagenomic analysis, and visualization.
core features: Some core features of Anvi'o include metagenomic binning, interactive data exploration, genome assembly visualization, multi-omics integration, and phylogenetic profiling.
tags: omics data analysis, microbiome, metagenomics, bioinformatics

Description: HicExplorer is a software package designed for the analysis, visualization, and interpretation of Hi-C data, which is used to study the 3D organization of the genome.
core features: Processing and normalization of Hi-C data, Identification of topologically associated domains (TADs), Visualization of Hi-C contact matrices, Detection of chromatin loops, Analysis of interaction frequencies between genomic regions
tags: Hi-C data analysis, Genome 3D organization, Genomics

Description: R-mclust is an R package that provides tools for model-based clustering, classification, and density estimation based on finite normal mixture modeling. It offers a variety of models, including the diagonal, ellipsoidal, and full-covariance parameterizations of the Gaussian mixture model.
core features:
1. Model-based clustering
2. Model-based classification
3. Density estimation
4. Finite normal mixture modeling
5. Support for various Gaussian mixture models parameterizations
tags: model-based clustering, classification, density estimation, Gaussian mixture model

Description: AMD uProf is a performance analysis tool suite for AMD processors that provides detailed insights into application performance and power usage. It allows developers to analyze code performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize applications for AMD platforms.
core features:
1. Performance analysis tools for AMD processors.
2. Detailed insights into application performance.
3. Power usage analysis.
4. Code optimization capabilities.
5. Identify performance bottlenecks.
tags: performance analysis, application optimization, AMD processors

Description: Abinit is a first-principles simulation software for materials science, condensed matter physics, and related fields. It performs electronic structure calculations based on density functional theory (DFT) and many-body perturbation theory.
core features: Abinit offers a wide range of functionalities for modeling materials properties, such as electronic band structures, total energies, forces, dielectric properties, and more. It supports parallel computing for scalability and efficiency.
tags: materials science, condensed matter physics, electronic structure calculations

Description: ProHint is a protein-protein interaction prediction software that uses a hybrid model combining deep learning and traditional machine learning techniques to predict protein interactions.
core features:
1. Hybrid model combining deep learning and traditional machine learning techniques
2. Predicts protein-protein interactions
3. Can handle large-scale protein interaction prediction tasks
tags: protein-protein interaction, interaction prediction, machine learning

Description: AMD LIBFLAME is an open-source software library that provides a high-performance implementation of the dense linear algebra routines on CPUs. It aims to offer efficient and robust algebraic computations for numerical linear algebra applications.
core features: High-performance implementation of dense linear algebra routines on CPUs, Open-source nature for accessibility and customization, Efficient and robust algebraic computations for numerical linear algebra applications
tags: linear algebra, numerical computations, performance optimization

Description: The readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The default editing mode is Emacs, but this can be changed when the application is run. In Emacs mode, the command line can be edited using the standard Emacs keystrokes.
core features: 1. Provides command line editing capabilities for applications. 2. Supports both Emacs and vi editing modes. 3. Allows users to edit command lines as they are typed in using standard keystrokes.
tags: software development, library, command line editing

Description: CFITSIO is a library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data format.
core features: CFITSIO provides a comprehensive set of interfaces for reading, writing, and manipulating FITS files. It supports various data types, compression methods, and image formats commonly used in astronomical and scientific data.
tags: astronomy, data processing, file format, FITS

Description: Modulefiles are a system for managing and loading software packages and their dependencies on computing clusters and HPC systems. They allow users to easily switch between different versions of software and environments.
core features: Managing software packages, Loading software and dependencies, Enabling multiple versions of software, Managing environments
tags: Software Management, Dependency Management, Environment Management

Description: Loopy is a software tool for array-oriented programming with multiple inputs and outputs, offering automatic differentiation and GPU support. It enables users to express and solve linear equations in a highly optimized manner.
core features: Array-oriented programming, Automatic differentiation, GPU support, Linear equation solving
tags: programming, optimization, linear algebra, automatic differentiation

Description: R-BioMart is an R interface to the BioMart database that provides access to a wide range of biological databases. It allows users to query and retrieve data from various biological resources, such as Ensembl and UniProt, through a unified API.
core features: Querying and retrieving data from biological databases, Access to diverse biological resources like Ensembl and UniProt, Unified API for seamless data access
tags: Bioinformatics, Data Retrieval, Biological Databases, Data Query

Description: GPy is a Gaussian process framework in Python for implementing Gaussian processes. It offers tools for Gaussian process regression, classification, optimization, and more.
core features: Gaussian process regression, Gaussian process classification, Gaussian process optimization, Implementation in Python
tags: machine learning, data analysis, Python, Gaussian processes

Description: VarDict-java is a variant discovery and genotyping tool that can analyze variants from DNA/RNA sequencing. It identifies, filters, annotates somatic and germline variants, and can be used for both targeted and whole-genome sequencing data.
core features:
1. Variant discovery and genotyping
2. Analysis of somatic and germline variants
3. Annotation of variants
4. Suitable for targeted and whole-genome sequencing data
tags: Variant Discovery, Genotyping, DNA Sequencing, RNA Sequencing, Bioinformatics

Description: Intel Trace Analyzer and Collector (ITAC) is a performance analysis tool designed for parallel applications. It provides in-depth performance data to help developers optimize the performance of their parallel code.
core features: ITAC offers features such as tracing and profiling of parallel applications, identifying performance bottlenecks, visualizing application performance data, analyzing communication patterns, and providing detailed reports on the performance metrics.
tags: performance analysis, parallel applications, optimization

Description: MrBayes is a program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. It employs Markov chain Monte Carlo methods to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters.
core features: 1. Bayesian inference for phylogenetics and evolutionary biology. 2. Markov chain Monte Carlo methods for estimating model parameters. 3. Support for various nucleotide and protein models. 4. Visualizations of phylogenetic trees and model parameter distributions.
tags: Bayesian inference, Phylogenetics, Evolutionary biology

Description: PLINK (whole-genome association analysis toolset) is an open-source whole genome association analysis toolset designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner. It enables users to carry out a variety of tasks, such as quality control, data management, and statistical analysis of genotypic data.
core features: Quality control of genotypic data, Data management and manipulation, Statistical analysis for association studies, Batch processing capabilities
tags: Genetic Analysis, Genomic Data Analysis, GWAS, Genetic Epidemiology

Description: ndiff is a command-line tool for comparing two Nmap XML output files. It parses the XML files and identifies the differences in the scan results, including changes in host status, open ports, service versions, and other scan details.
core features: Compare two Nmap XML output files, Identify the differences in host status, open ports, service versions, and scan details, Generate a report highlighting the variances between the scans
tags: Network Security, Network Monitoring, Penetration Testing, Cybersecurity

Description: GlimmerHMM is a software system for gene prediction in microbial genomes. It uses hidden Markov models to represent various aspects of a gene (e.g., start codons, stop codons, and exons) to accurately predict the locations of genes.
core features: Gene prediction in microbial genomes, Utilizes hidden Markov models, Predicts start and stop codons, and exons, Accurate gene location prediction
tags: Gene Prediction, Microbial Genomes, Hidden Markov Models, Bioinformatics

Description: The r-delayedarray package in R provides classes and methods for large-scale array-oriented calculations, particularly for array-like objects that are too large to fit into memory at once. It allows for efficient array storage and manipulation through delayed operations and memory-mapping to minimize memory usage and optimize performance.
core features:
1. Support for large-scale array-oriented calculations
2. Delayed operations for efficient memory usage
3. Memory-mapping for optimized performance
4. Integration with other R packages for data analysis and visualization
tags: array processing, large-scale data analysis, memory optimization

Description: PHAST (PHylogenetic Analysis with Space/Time models) is a software package for comparative and evolutionary genomics. It is designed for analyzing patterns of evolutionary conservation and acceleration in multiple alignments of genomic sequences.
core features: Phylogenetic comparative genomics, Evolutionary conservation analysis, Detection of accelerated evolution, Spatial and temporal models, Multiple sequence alignment analysis
tags: Genomics, Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Biology, Bioinformatics

Description: VLC media player is a free and open-source portable cross-platform media player software and streaming media server developed by the VideoLAN project. VLC supports a wide range of multimedia formats, streaming protocols, and graphical user interface elements.
core features:
1. Playback of various multimedia formats including MPEG-1, MPEG-2, MPEG-4, H.264, MKV, WebM, WMV, MP3, etc. 
2. Streaming support for various network protocols including UDP, HTTP, FTP, RTP, RTSP, etc. 
3. Ability to play encrypted DVDs, Blu-Ray discs, and VCDs. 
4. Advanced playback features like audio equalizer, video effects, and filters. 
5. Customizable skins and themes for the player interface. 
6. Media conversion and streaming capabilities. 
7. Support for subtitles and closed captions.
tags: media player, streaming, multimedia

Description: xcb-util-wm is a set of utility functions for interfacing with the X Window Manager (WM) extension of the XCB library. It provides a number of functions that are useful to XCB WM clients.
core features: Interfacing with X Window Manager (WM) extension, Utility functions for XCB WM clients
tags: X Window System, Window Manager, XCB library, Utility functions

Description: Intel Dynamic Application Loader (DAL) is a framework that enables applications to dynamically load and execute small code modules. It provides a secure environment for executing trusted applications on Intel platforms.
core features:
1. Secure environment for executing trusted applications
2. Ability to dynamically load and execute small code modules
3. Provides isolation and protection mechanisms
4. Streamlines the process of developing and deploying applications
5. Supports multiple platforms and languages
tags: Security, Intel Platform, Dynamic Code Loading, Trusted Applications

Description: Lastz is a program for aligning DNA sequences, a key step in comparative genomics analysis. It efficiently finds local alignments between sequences, identifying areas of similarity and potential evolutionary relationships.
core features:
1. High performance and speed in DNA sequence alignment.
2. Ability to handle large genomes and datasets.
3. Supports various output formats for alignments and visualization.
4. Offers flexibility in specifying alignment parameters and scoring.
tags: bioinformatics, DNA sequencing, alignment, comparative genomics

Description: SRA-tools is a set of software tools developed by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) to assist with the download and analysis of high-throughput sequencing data from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA).
core features: Download and extract sequencing data from the SRA database, Convert SRA data to a more usable format such as FASTQ, Perform quality control and filtering of sequencing data, Align and map sequencing reads to a reference genome, Analyze and visualize sequencing data for various bioinformatics applications
tags: Bioinformatics, HPC tools, Sequence analysis, Data processing, High-throughput sequencing

Description: Magic-BLAST is a tool for mapping large next-generation RNA or DNA sequencing runs against a whole genome or transcriptome. It uses the BLAST algorithm to map reads quickly and accurately and produce output in a standard SAM format.
core features: Mapping next-generation sequencing runs, Using BLAST algorithm for read mapping, Producing output in SAM format, High-speed and accuracy
tags: Bioinformatics, NGS Analysis, Sequence Alignment, Read Mapping

Description: Theano is an open-source symbolic mathematical library, used for deep learning and numerical computation, that allows you to define, optimize, and evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays efficiently.
core features: Theano provides modules for defining and manipulating mathematical expressions, supports GPU computation, enables automatic differentiation, optimizes symbolic graph execution, and integrates seamlessly with NumPy. It is commonly used for building and training deep learning models.
tags: mathematical library, deep learning, numerical computation

Description: Guppy is a basecaller developed by Oxford Nanopore Technologies for processing raw electrical signal data generated by their nanopore sequencing devices. It is designed to convert the raw signal data into nucleotide sequences, providing a platform for downstream analysis in genomics research.
core features: Basecalling of raw electrical signal data from nanopore sequencing devices, Conversion of raw signal data into nucleotide sequences, Support for real-time basecalling during sequencing runs, Integration with Oxford Nanopore Technologies' sequencing platforms, Compatibility with various sequencing protocols
tags: bioinformatics, sequencing, nanopore sequencing, genomics, DNA sequencing

Description: Mothur is a software package for bioinformatics analysis of microbial communities. It provides a suite of tools for processing high-throughput sequencing data, including quality control, alignment, taxonomy assignment, and diversity analysis.
core features:
1. Quality control of sequencing data
2. OTU (operational taxonomic unit) clustering
3. Taxonomy assignment
4. Diversity analysis
5. Phylogenetic tree construction
tags: bioinformatics, microbial communities, high-throughput sequencing

Description: Samplot is a Python package for creating publication-quality plots of structural variants identified from short- and long-read sequencing data. It provides a flexible and customizable framework for visualizing structural variations in genomic data.
core features: Visualization of structural variants, Support for short- and long-read sequencing data, Publication-quality plots, Customizable plots
tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Structural Variants, Data Visualization

Description: Python is a high-level, versatile, and interpreted programming language known for its readability and syntax simplicity, making it an excellent choice for both beginners and experienced developers. Python 3.7 is a specific version of Python that introduced several new features, optimizations, and security enhancements.
core features: Easy-to-read syntax, Extensive standard library, Support for multiple programming paradigms (procedural, object-oriented, functional), Dynamic typing and automatic memory management, Cross-platform compatibility, Large community and ecosystem of libraries and frameworks, Regularly updated with new features and improvements
tags: programming language, interpreted language, high-level language

Description: help2man is a tool that can generate simple man pages from the '--help' and '--version' output of other commands.
core features: help2man automates the generation of manual pages for programs that lack a man page but provide a '--help' or '--version' option. It extracts the necessary information from these options and formats them into a manual page.
tags: documentation, man pages, automation

Description: py-cftime is a Python library that provides functions to manipulate dates and times in various calendars, including the Gregorian, Julian, proleptic Gregorian, and 360-day calendars. It is designed to work with the time scales used in climate and weather sciences.
core features:
1. Conversion of dates and times between different calendars
2. Arithmetic operations on dates and times
3. Handling time intervals and durations
4. Support for common date and time formats
5. Timestamp manipulation and formatting
tags: Python library, Date and Time manipulation, Calendar conversion

Description: Samblaster is a tool designed to mark duplicates and obtain discordant and split read alignments from SAM, BAM, or CRAM files, leveraging information from the SAM flags to accurately categorize the alignment information.
core features:
1. Mark duplicates in SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
2. Extract discordant and split read alignments.
3. Utilizes information from SAM flags for accurate alignment categorization.
tags: bioinformatics, HPC tools

Description: R package for working with genome alignments, providing functionality for reading, manipulating, and writing genome alignment data in the form of BAM, BED, and GAlignments objects.
core features:
1. Reading and writing genome alignment data in BAM, BED, and GAlignments formats.
2. Manipulating and analyzing genome alignment data.
3. Visualization tools for genome alignment data.
4. Integration with other R packages for genomics analysis.
tags: genomics, genome alignments, R package

Description: MEGAN (MEtaGenome ANalyzer) is a comprehensive software package for analyzing large metagenomic data sets. It is designed to facilitate the exploration and taxonomic analysis of complex microbiomes.
core features: 1. Taxonomic analysis and visualization of metagenomic data. 2. Functional analysis of microbial communities. 3. Comparative analysis of multiple samples. 4. Supports integration of various sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, Ion Torrent, and PacBio. 5. User-friendly interface for interactive exploration of results.
tags: metagenomics, microbiome, bioinformatics

Description: Velvet is a de novo genomic assembler specially designed for short read sequencing technologies, such as those produced by the Illumina platform. It is efficient in handling large volumes of data and is widely used for assembling genomes, transcriptomes, and metagenomes.
core features: De novo genome assembly, Designed for short read sequencing data, Efficient handling of large datasets, Suitable for assembling genomes, transcriptomes, and metagenomes
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Sequencing, Assembly

Description: Liftoff is a powerful build system for iOS and macOS projects. It is designed to be faster and more reliable than the built-in Xcode build system, providing a more efficient development experience for Apple platform developers.
core features: Faster build times compared to Xcode, Improved reliability and consistency in building projects, Automatic parallelization of tasks for maximizing performance, Integrated dependency management for efficient project builds, Support for defining custom build rules and configurations
tags: Build System, iOS Development, macOS Development, Software Development, Apple Platforms

Description: Tombo is a software package developed by Oxford Nanopore Technologies for the analysis of raw signal data produced by Oxford Nanopore sequencers. It is designed to process raw electric current signals produced during DNA or RNA sequencing to detect modifications, such as base modifications or DNA or RNA secondary structures.
core features: Analysis of raw signal data from Oxford Nanopore sequencers, Detection of modifications in DNA or RNA sequences, Identification of base modifications and secondary structures
tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, DNA Sequencing, RNA Sequencing, Signal Analysis

Description: nghttp3 is an implementation of HTTP/3 and QUIC protocol in C programming language. It provides a low-level API for developers to interact with HTTP/3 and QUIC connections.
core features:
1. Implementation of HTTP/3 and QUIC protocols
2. Low-level API for interacting with HTTP/3 and QUIC connections
3. Written in C programming language
tags: HTTP/3, QUIC, Networking, Protocol

Description: Mashtree is a tool for constructing phylogenetic trees directly from pairwise Mash distances. It builds hierarchical trees from Mash distance matrices in Newick tree format. Mashtree provides a fast and memory-efficient method for creating phylogenetic trees based on genomic similarity.
core features:
1. Constructs phylogenetic trees directly from pairwise Mash distances.
2. Builds hierarchical trees from Mash distance matrices in Newick tree format.
3. Fast and memory-efficient method for creating phylogenetic trees based on genomic similarity.
tags: phylogenetic trees, genomic similarity, Mash distances

Description: The default-environment is a basic system setup that provides essential tools and configurations for software development and computational work. It serves as a starting point for creating custom environments tailored to specific requirements and preferences.
core features: Includes popular programming languages such as Python, C++, Java, and others, Common utilities like text editors, version control systems, and package managers are pre-installed, Support for compiling code, managing dependencies, and running basic scripts, Can be easily extended and customized with additional software packages and libraries
tags: development-environment, computational-tools, software-utilities

Description: The libnsl library provides an interface for applications to make use of the services provided by the Network Services Layer (NSL). It offers functions that allow applications to communicate over the network using a variety of protocols.
core features:
1. Provides network communication services.
2. Supports multiple network protocols.
3. Facilitates network-aware applications.
tags: network services, communication, protocols

Description: Parliament2 is a fork of the Parliament tool that provides a toolkit for developing scalable symbolic model checking algorithms.
core features: Key features include symbolic model checking, support for developing scalable algorithms, bug checking, and verification of complex systems.
tags: symbolic model checking, scalable algorithms, bug checking, system verification

Description: CIRI2 (CircRNA Identifier 2) is a comprehensive computational tool designed to efficiently and accurately identify circular RNAs (circRNAs) from high-throughput sequencing data. CircRNAs are a type of non-coding RNA with crucial functions in gene regulation and various biological processes.
core features:
1. Detection of circRNAs: CIRI2 employs an algorithm that utilizes back-spliced reads to detect circRNAs within RNA-Seq data.
2. High accuracy: The tool integrates multiple strategies to enhance the accuracy of circRNA identification.
3. Multiple-file input: CIRI2 supports the analysis of multiple RNA-Seq samples simultaneously.
4. Visualization capabilities: Users can visualize the identified circRNAs and their characteristics through graphical outputs.
5. Customizable parameters: The tool offers flexibility in adjusting parameters based on user requirements.
tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, RNA-Seq, Circular RNA

Description: Gambit is an open-source software package for carrying out computational game theory analysis. It provides tools for the representation, numerical solution, and strategic analysis of games, including extensive support for the computation of Nash equilibria.
core features:
1. Representation of games in extensive and strategic form
2. Computation of Nash equilibria and other solution concepts
3. Analysis of strategic interaction and decision-making
4. Visualization of game theoretic solutions
5. Support for various game types and player settings
tags: Game Theory, Computational Analysis, Nash Equilibria

Description: CM is a compiler designed to optimize C programs for machines with cache memories. It tries to rearrange loops to reduce the number of cache misses and the amount of execution time.
core features: 1. Loop reordering to improve cache performance. 2. Reduces cache misses. 3. Optimizes C programs for machines with cache memories.
tags: compiler, optimization

Description: Intel Data Parallel C++ (DPC++) Compatibility Tool (dpct) is a tool developed by Intel to facilitate migration of CUDA kernels to Data Parallel C++ (DPC++) for seamless porting to heterogeneous platforms.
core features: 1. Automatic translation of CUDA source code to DPC++ source code. 2. Support for CUDA kernels defined in separate files. 3. Generation of DPC++ offload syntax for given CUDA kernel code. 4. Integration with Intel Advisor & Inspector tools for analysis and optimization of the code. 5. Compatible with Intel oneAPI toolkits for cross-architecture development.
tags: Intel, Data Migration, CUDA, DPC++, Heterogeneous Computing

Description: Spack is a flexible package manager for supercomputers, HPC systems, and other large-scale computing environments. It is designed to support multiple versions and configurations of software on a wide range of platforms.
core features: Spack allows users to easily install, configure, and manage a wide variety of software packages. It supports custom builds, dependencies, and compilers, and offers a simple command-line interface for package management. Spack is highly customizable and can be used with a wide range of HPC systems and architectures.
tags: package manager, HPC, supercomputers

Description: at-spi2-atk is the Assistive Technology Service Provider Interface (AT-SPI) for the ATK toolkit, which allows assistive technologies to interact with graphical user interfaces.
core features: Provides an interface for assistive technologies to access and interact with the ATK accessibility library, supports the creation and manipulation of accessible components in graphical user interfaces, enables assistive technologies to receive and respond to events from ATK objects.
tags: assistive technology, accessibility, user interface

Description: Intel Advisor is a design and analysis tool used to optimize vectorization, threading, and memory usage in your code. It helps identify hotspots in the code, provides recommendations for optimizations, and estimates performance improvements.
core features: Identifying hotspots in code, Recommendations for vectorization and threading, Estimating performance improvements, Analyzing memory usage
tags: Code optimization, Performance analysis, Parallel computing, Compiler tool

Description: Xit is a powerful version control tool designed for Git with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It provides a graphical user interface to facilitate the management and tracking of code changes, branches, and repositories.
core features: Graphical user interface for Git, Code change management, Branch management, Repository tracking, Simplicity and productivity
tags: Version Control, Git, Graphical User Interface

Description: Miniasm is a minimal-contig assembler that generates long noisy read assemblies using the Overlap-Layout-Consensus (OLC) paradigm.
core features:
1. Assembles long noisy reads
2. Corrects reads errors and identifies overlaps between reads
3. Generates contigs using the OLC paradigm
4. Handles high error rates efficiently
tags: assembly, genome, sequence analysis

Description: PySCF is an open-source Python library for quantum chemistry computations. It provides a wide range of quantum chemistry methods to solve the electronic structure of molecules and solids.
core features:
1. Implements various quantum chemistry methods such as Hartree-Fock, DFT, CCSD(T), MP2, etc.
2. Allows for efficient calculations of molecular properties like energies, gradients, and frequencies.
3. Offers interfaces to popular quantum chemistry packages like NWChem, Gaussian, and Molpro.
4. Supports parallel computation for large systems using MPI.
tags: quantum chemistry, computational chemistry, quantum mechanics

Description: GitPython is a python library used to interact with Git repositories. It provides a high-level API that allows for interfacing with Git commands and repositories directly from Python scripts.
core features:
1. Ability to interface with Git repositories within Python scripts
2. Supports common Git operations like cloning, committing, pushing, and pulling
3. Provides access to Git's objects (commits, trees, blobs) and references (branches, tags)
4. Offers options for working with submodules and managing repository information
tags: version control, source code management, python library

Description: p4est (parallel framework for dynamic load balancing and adaptive mesh refinement) is a software library that provides support for dynamic load balancing and adaptive mesh refinement in parallel numerical simulations. It is particularly useful for solving partial differential equations on unstructured grids efficiently.
core features:
1. Parallel framework for dynamic load balancing
2. Adaptive mesh refinement capabilities
3. Support for solving partial differential equations on unstructured grids
4. Enables efficient parallel numerical simulations
tags: computational software, library

Description: Star-Fusion is a computational tool developed to identify fusion transcripts from RNA-Seq data. It utilizes the STAR aligner to map reads and searches for evidence of chimeric transcripts, providing insight into gene fusions in cancer and other diseases.
core features:
1. Detection of fusion transcripts from RNA-Seq data
2. Utilizes the STAR aligner for read mapping
3. Identifies chimeric transcripts for downstream analysis
4. Useful for studying gene fusions in cancer and related diseases
tags: RNA-Seq, fusion transcripts, gene fusions, computational tool

Description: Scikit-learn is a machine learning library for the Python programming language. It features various classification, regression, and clustering algorithms including support vector machines, random forests, gradient boosting, k-means, and DBSCAN, among others. Scikit-learn is designed to interoperate with the Python numerical and scientific libraries NumPy and SciPy.
core features: Supervised learning, Unsupervised learning, Dimensionality reduction, Model selection, Preprocessing data
tags: machine learning, Python library
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems

Description: pyfaidx is a Python library that enables efficient random access to genome FASTA files in both uncompressed and gzipped formats. It provides a simple interface for indexing and querying sequences from FASTA files.

Description: SMRT Link is a software suite designed for the analysis of Single-Molecule Real-Time (SMRT) sequencing data obtained from PacBio sequencers. It serves as a central hub for data processing, analysis, visualization, and storage in bioinformatics applications.

tags: Bioinformatics, High-Throughput Sequencing, Data Analysis, Genomics

Description: LibROM is a library for Reduced Order Models (ROMs) that provides tools for model reduction of complex systems in engineering and computational science applications. It offers a range of algorithms and methods to reduce the computational cost of high-fidelity simulations.
core features: Implementation of various model reduction algorithms, Support for reduction of large-scale systems, Integration with common computational frameworks, Efficient handling of high-dimensional data
tags: Software Library, Model Reduction, Computational Science

Description: Git Large File Storage (LFS) is a Git extension that reduces the impact of large files in your repository by replacing them with text pointers while storing the actual file content on a remote server. It seamlessly integrates with Git and provides efficient handling of large files, making it easier to work with version-controlled repositories containing large assets.
core features: Efficient handling of large files, Reduced impact of large files in repositories, Text pointers for large files while storing in remote server, Seamless integration with Git
tags: version control, file storage, Git extension

Description: FreeGLUT is a free-software/open-source alternative to the OpenGL Utility Toolkit (GLUT) library. It provides a simple, platform-independent API for creating windows, sub-windows, and menus, as well as handling input from keyboard, mouse, and joystick devices. FreeGLUT aims to be as close to the original GLUT functionality as possible while also improving and extending it.
core features: Cross-platform support, Window management, User input handling, Event-driven programming, OpenGL integration
tags: Graphics Programming, OpenGL, Cross-Platform Development, Free Software

Description: py-pyparsing is a Python module that helps in creating lexical parsers for processing textual data. It is a versatile parser generator that can be used for a wide range of parsing tasks, from simple text pattern matching to complex syntactic analysis.
core features: Parsing textual data using user-defined grammar rules, Supports parsing of complex expressions and sentence structures, Ability to handle recursive grammars and backtracking, Integration with Python code for processing parsed data
tags: parser generator, text processing, lexical analysis, Python module

Description: r-affy is an R package for the pre-processing and analysis of high-throughput gene expression data generated from microarray technology. It provides functions for background correction, normalization, summarization, and quality assessment of microarray data.
core features:
1. Background correction for microarray data.
2. Normalization of gene expression values.
3. Summarization of probe intensity values.
4. Quality assessment tools for evaluating microarray data.
tags: microarray, gene expression, data pre-processing, bioinformatics

Description: Alfred is a productivity application for macOS that boosts your efficiency with hotkeys, keywords, text expansion, and more. It allows users to perform various tasks quickly using customizable keyboard shortcuts.
core features: Customizable hotkeys for various actions, Keyword-based search for files, contacts, and web searches, Text expansion for frequently used phrases, Clipboard history and management, Integration with various apps and workflows
tags: productivity, macOS, keyboard shortcuts, automation

Description: python-dateutil is a Python library that provides powerful extensions to the standard datetime module. It aims to help perform complex date and time calculations with ease and simplicity.
core features: Parsing and formatting date and time strings, Calculating time differences and dealing with timezones, Support for advanced date and time operations, such as recurring events
tags: Python, Date and Time, Library

Description: r-annotate is an R package designed for functional annotation of bisulfite sequencing data. It provides tools for annotating differentially methylated regions (DMRs) and CpG sites with genomic features such as promoters, enhancers, CpG islands, and more.
core features: Functional annotation of bisulfite sequencing data, Annotation of DMRs and CpG sites, Identification of genomic features like promoters, enhancers, and CpG islands, Integration with R environment for statistical analysis
tags: R package, Functional annotation, Bisulfite sequencing, Genomic features

Description: Intel CUDA is a software development kit for accelerating applications using GPUs, particularly NVIDIA GPUs, by utilizing parallel computing features.
core features: 1. GPU acceleration for computationally intensive applications. 2. Utilizes parallel processing for increased performance. 3. Supports NVIDIA GPUs for high-speed computing tasks. 4. Integration with popular programming languages like C, C++, and Fortran.
tags: GPU acceleration, Parallel computing, High-performance computing, Programming languages

Description: The compiler-rt32 project is a runtime library that provides functionality for compilers in the 32-bit architecture. It includes various runtime components such as sanitizers, builtins, and support libraries for handling memory operations and error detection.
core features:
1. Memory error detection using sanitizers
2. Built-in functions for optimized operations
3. Support libraries for compiler runtime functions
4. Designed for 32-bit architecture compilers
5. Integration with compiler toolchains
tags: compiler, runtime library, 32-bit architecture

Description: Newick Utils is a collection of command-line tools for processing Newick tree files used in phylogenetics and computational biology. It provides various utilities for manipulating, analyzing, and visualizing phylogenetic trees represented in the Newick format.
core features: Parsing and converting Newick tree files, Tree traversal and manipulation, Phylogenetic tree comparison and analysis, Visualization of phylogenetic trees, Support for various tree formats
tags: Phylogenetics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Phylogenetic Trees, Command-line Tools

Description: PICRUSt2 (Phylogenetic Investigation of Communities by Reconstruction of Unobserved States 2) is a software package designed for predicting metagenome functional content from marker gene surveys of microbial communities. It leverages evolutionary modeling to predict the gene content of microbial taxa in a community and their metabolic potentials.
core features: Metagenome functional content prediction, Marker gene surveys analysis, Evolutionary modeling for gene content prediction, Metabolic potential inference for microbial communities
tags: bioinformatics, metagenomics, microbiome analysis, functional gene prediction

Description: Spglib-python is a Python wrapper for the C library Spglib, which is a library for finding and manipulating spacegroup symmetry. It provides a wide range of functionalities for crystallography and solid-state physics calculations.
core features: Determination of space group of a crystal structure, Find symmetry elements and operations, Generate k-point grids for Brillouin zone integration, Crystallographic operations like primitive cell determination and symmetry reduction
tags: Crystallography, Solid State Physics

Description: OneAPI is a unified programming model that aims to simplify development across diverse architectures such as CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and other accelerators. It provides a single programming interface for developers to efficiently target and deploy applications in heterogeneous computing environments.
core features: Unified programming model for heterogeneous computing, Support for CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and accelerators, Optimized performance and productivity, Cross-architecture development and deployment
tags: Heterogeneous Computing, Unified Programming Model, Accelerated Computing, Performance Optimization

Description: Edlib is an open-source library for sequence alignment using edit (Levenshtein) distance and pairwise alignment. It includes several alignment algorithms and methods for comparing sequences.
core features:
1. Supports various alignment algorithms such as Edit distance, Hamming distance, and NW (Needleman-Wunsch) global alignment.
2. Provides functions for pairwise alignment of sequences and computing their similarity.
3. Includes methods for approximate string matching and searching.
4. Allows users to set custom parameters for alignment and scoring.
5. Written in C language with bindings available for Python and other programming languages.
tags: sequence alignment, edit distance, pairwise alignment

Description: RE2 is a fast, safe, thread-friendly, and efficient regular expression library. It provides better performance than many widely used regular expression libraries by using automata theory, generating linear-time matching algorithms.
core features: High-performance regular expression library, Thread-friendly and safe, Efficient and scalable, Optimized using automata theory for linear-time matching algorithms
tags: Regular Expression, Library, Performance, Thread-Safe

Description: Intel oneAPI compilers are a set of high-performance C++ and Fortran compilers that support OpenMP and SYCL programming models. These compilers are designed to accelerate performance and power efficiency across a wide range of hardware platforms.
core features: Support for C++ and Fortran programming languages, Optimized for high performance and power efficiency, Support for OpenMP and SYCL programming models, Cross-platform compatibility, Integration with Intel oneAPI base toolkit
tags: Compilers, Software Development, High Performance Computing, Parallel Programming
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: Meryl is a software tool for k-mer counting and analysis in bioinformatics applications. It efficiently handles large-scale genomic data to provide insights into genome characteristics.
core features:
1. Efficient k-mer counting
2. Analysis of genomic data
3. Scalable for large datasets
4. Insight generation for genome characteristics
tags: bioinformatics, genomics, k-mer counting

Description: PhyloSuite is a comprehensive and user-friendly phylogenetic analysis toolkit that integrates multiple bioinformatics tools for data preparation, alignment, model selection, phylogeny estimation, tree visualization, and more. It aims to streamline the phylogenomic workflow and provide a one-stop solution for researchers working in the field of evolutionary biology and phylogenetics.
core features: Data preparation and processing for phylogenetic analysis, Sequence alignment and trimming, Model selection and identification, Phylogeny estimation using multiple methods, Visualization of phylogenetic trees, Automated workflow for efficient analysis
tags: phylogenetic analysis, bioinformatics, evolutionary biology, phylogenomics, sequence alignment

Description: htop is an interactive system-monitor process-viewer for Unix systems. It provides a detailed overview of system performance and resource usage in a visually appealing and user-friendly interface.
core features: Real-time monitoring of system processes, Interactive process viewer with easy navigation, Color-coded display for CPU, memory, and swap usage, Ability to search for processes and filter based on various criteria, Customizable display options and settings, Support for mouse interaction
tags: System Monitoring, Process Viewer, Resource Usage

Description: HighWay is an open-source statistical software tool designed for the identification of driver genes and pathways in cancer based on the analysis of somatic mutations across a cohort of tumor samples.
core features: Identification of driver genes and pathways in cancer, Analysis of somatic mutations, Processing of tumor samples
tags: bioinformatics, computational biology, statistical analysis

Description: Mercurial is a free, distributed source control management tool. It efficiently handles projects of any size and offers an intuitive interface.
core features: Mercurial provides distributed revision control, fast operations, built-in merge algorithms, efficient handling of binary files, extensibility via Python scripts, and support for multiple workflows.
tags: version control, software development

Description: torchtext is a library used for natural language processing (NLP) tasks in PyTorch. It provides utilities and datasets for processing text data, such as tokenization, vocabulary building, word embeddings, and data loading for NLP models.
core features: Tokenization of text data, Building vocabularies for text processing, Word embeddings for NLP models, Data loading utilities for NLP tasks
tags: NLP, Natural Language Processing, PyTorch, Text Processing

Description: WinnowMap is a software tool for mapping and alignment of long nanopore and PacBio sequencing reads to large reference genomes.
core features: Core features of WinnowMap include efficient mapping of long sequencing reads to large genomes, support for nanopore and PacBio sequencing data, ability to handle large datasets, customizable parameter settings, and output of alignment in SAM format.
tags: mapping, alignment, nanopore, PacBio, sequencing

Description: rocm-smi is a command-line program that allows users to monitor and manage AMD Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) System Management Interface (SMI) enabled GPUs. It provides detailed information about the current state of the GPUs and enables users to manage various aspects of the GPUs such as power management, fan speed control, temperature monitoring, and more.
core features: Monitoring GPU parameters such as temperature, power usage, fan speed, and clock speeds, Managing power profiles for optimized performance, Controlling fan speed to maintain optimal cooling, Adjusting frequency and voltage settings for power efficiency, Viewing detailed GPU information and metrics
tags: GPU management, Performance monitoring, System Management Interface, AMD Radeon, ROCm

Description: maeparser is a Python library for reading and writing molecular data stored in Maestro files. It provides a simple interface for extracting structural information from Maestro files commonly used in molecular modeling and computational chemistry.
core features:
1. Read and write Maestro files efficiently.
2. Extract molecular structures and properties from Maestro files.
3. Compatible with various molecular modeling tools and software.
4. Facilitates data extraction and manipulation for further analysis.
tags: Python library, Molecular data, Maestro files

Description: Pytest is a testing framework that makes it easy to write simple and scalable tests in Python. It is a popular testing framework used for testing Python programs and libraries.
core features: Support for fixtures, Parameterized testing, Support for test discovery, Detailed test reports, Plugin architecture for extensibility
tags: testing, Python, framework

Description: Netlib Scalapack is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for distributed memory computers. It is built on top of BLAS and provides a parallel programming model using the Scalable Linear Algebra Core (ScaLAPACK) for distributed memory systems.
core features:
1. Parallel linear algebra routines optimized for distributed memory computers.
2. Implements algorithms for dense and banded matrices.
3. Supports various matrix operations such as matrix multiplication, factorization, and solvers.
4. Designed for high performance and scalability on parallel architectures.
tags: Linear Algebra, Distributed Computing, High Performance Computing

Description: DeepVariant is a deep learning-based variant caller developed by Google Brain that accurately identifies genetic variants from next-generation DNA sequencing data.
core features:
1. Utilizes deep neural networks for variant calling
2. Provides accurate and reliable variant identification
3. Supports germline and somatic variant calling
4. Optimized for identifying small variants like single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and insertions/deletions (indels)
5. Employs a peer-reviewed, open-source methodology for variant calling
tags: variant calling, genetic variants, deep learning, DNA sequencing

Description: FFTW is a comprehensive collection of fast C routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various generalizations, used in a wide range of applications in computational mathematics, physics, and engineering.
core features: The mpi version of FFTW provides parallel computing capabilities using the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard, enabling high-performance computations of Fourier transforms across distributed computing resources. This allows for efficient processing of large datasets and complex simulations in parallel.
tags: computational software, HPC tools

Description: UDUNITS supports conversion of unit specifications between formatted, human-readable strings and machine-friendly structures. In addition, UDUNITS defines functions that can be used to identify whether pairs of units are conformable for mathematical operations, to convert numerical values from one unit to another, and to generate strings representing the units of quantities.
core features: 1. Conversion of unit specifications between human-readable strings and machine-friendly structures. 2. Identification of conformable pairs of units for mathematical operations. 3. Conversion of numerical values from one unit to another. 4. Generation of strings representing the units of quantities.
tags: units, unit conversion, UDUNITS

Description: parsnp is a software tool used for rapid core-genome alignment and SNP detection in whole-genome sequencing data. It is particularly designed for comparative genomics studies to identify genetic variations and evolutionary relationships among bacterial genomes.
core features: Core-genome alignment, SNP detection, Whole-genome sequencing data analysis, Comparative genomics studies, Evolutionary relationship analysis
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Sequencing, Evolutionary Biology

Description: py-jupyter-core is a Python library that provides core functionality for Jupyter applications. It includes APIs for managing Jupyter kernels, messaging protocols, configuration handling, and more.
core features: Management of Jupyter kernels, Messaging protocols, Configuration handling
tags: Python library, Jupyter applications, Core functionality

Description: ABACAS is a tool for rapid bacterial genome contig assembly. It takes contigs produced by an assemblrer and scaffolds them to generate a pseudo-chromosome. It can handle multiple contigs and uses reference genomes for scaffolding.
core features: Contig assembly, scaffolding, reference genome utilization
tags: bacterial genome, genome assembly

Description: ICU (International Components for Unicode) is a mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications. ICU is utilized in a vast array of applications, operating systems, and devices to provide multilingual support.
core features:
1. Comprehensive Unicode support for wide character and locale data.
2. String handling, collation, parsing, formatting, and transliteration capabilities.
3. Time zone and calendar functionality.
4. Text layout and bi-directional text support.
5. Language-specific support for various functionalities.
6. ICU data includes support for over 300 languages.
tags: Unicode support, Globalization, Localization, Internationalization, Unicode libraries

Description: The SRA Toolkit is a collection of tools and libraries for accessing data in the Sequence Read Archive (SRA), a large repository of next-generation sequencing data. It provides command-line utilities and APIs to download, transform, and analyze high-throughput sequencing data.
core features: Downloading sequencing data from the SRA database, Converting data formats (e.g., SRA to FASTQ), Quality control and filtering of sequencing data, Basic analysis of sequencing reads, Integration with bioinformatics pipelines
tags: bioinformatics, NGS data analysis, data transformation, sequence data management

Description: PyQt5 is a comprehensive set of Python bindings for the Qt application framework developed by Riverbank Computing. It allows Python programmers to create desktop applications with rich graphical user interfaces (GUIs) using Qt tools and libraries.
core features: Integration with Qt Designer for drag-and-drop GUI design, Extensive support for GUI development with widgets, layouts, and events, Cross-platform compatibility with Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile platforms, Access to a wide range of Qt functionalities including multimedia, networking, and databases, Ability to create standalone executables from Python code
tags: Python, GUI, Qt, Desktop Applications

Description: JupyterHub brings the power of Jupyter Notebooks to groups of users. It allows multiple users to access Jupyter Notebooks through a browser, providing a collaborative and interactive environment for data science, scientific computing, and other computational tasks.
core features: Multi-user Jupyter Notebook server, Browser-based interface, Support for multiple languages including Python, R, and Julia, Scalability for large groups of users, Customizable user environments, Integration with authentication services like OAuth and LDAP
tags: data science, collaborative computing, notebook environment, interactive computing

Description: Intel Dev-Utilities is a collection of software tools provided by Intel to assist developers in optimizing and enhancing the performance of their applications for Intel processors.
core features: Includes tools for performance analysis, debuggers, compilers, and libraries optimized for Intel processors. Helps developers improve code performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize for parallel processing. Supports various programming languages and development environments.
tags: optimization, performance analysis, debugging, compilers, libraries

Description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics that aims to become a full-featured computer algebra system. It provides capabilities for symbolic computation, algebraic manipulation, calculus, equation solving, and more.
core features:
1. Symbolic mathematics
2. Algebraic manipulation
3. Calculus
4. Equation solving
5. Linear algebra
6. Discrete mathematics
7. Simplification of expressions
8. Differentiation and integration
9. Equation manipulation
10. Arbitrary precision arithmetic
tags: symbolic mathematics, computer algebra system, mathematics, Python library

Description: libsndfile is a C library for reading and writing files containing sampled sound (such as WAV, AIFF, and AU) through one standard interface.
core features: Supports reading and writing a variety of audio file formats, Provides a simple and consistent API for audio file I/O operations, Offers support for a wide range of sample formats and data types, Cross-platform compatibility for use in different operating systems
tags: Audio Processing, File Input/Output, C Library, Audio File Formats

Description: ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from other build systems in that it is designed to have its input files generated by a higher-level build system (like CMake) and will not execute commands in parallel by default.
core features:
1. Speed optimization for build processes.
2. Integration with higher-level build systems like CMake.
3. Limited parallel execution of commands for better performance.
tags: build system, software development, automation

RP Name: aces, darwin, delta, faster, ookami, stampede3
Description: NetCDF (Network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data.
core features: Supports array-oriented scientific data, Self-describing and machine-independent data formats, Efficient data storage and access, Can store multiple data variables in a single file, Supports data subsetting and data compression, Tools for data manipulation and visualization
tags: scientific data, data storage, data access, data formats, data manipulation, data visualization

Description: GPflow is a Gaussian process library that uses TensorFlow for its core computational backend. It is a scalable, flexible, and modular Gaussian process framework for building probabilistic models.
core features:
1. Supports Gaussian Processes (GPs) and Bayesian Neural Networks (BNNs)
2. High-level abstractions for creating complex models
3. Scalable inference methods for efficient computation
4. Integration with TensorFlow for automatic differentiation
5. Modular design for easy customization and extension
tags: Machine Learning, Probabilistic Programming, Gaussian Processes
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems

Description: PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library used for numerical computations and building deep learning models.
core features: Dynamic computation graph, GPU acceleration, Automatic differentiation, Support for complex neural networks
tags: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Numerical Computation, Neural Networks

Description: R-genomeinfodb is an R package that provides utilities and helper functions for interacting with different genome annotation databases, such as UCSC, Ensembl, and NCBI. It allows users to easily access and retrieve genomic information for various organisms.
core features: Access and retrieve genomic information from different annotation databases, Integration with popular genome browsers like UCSC, Ensembl, and NCBI, Query specific genomic regions and features, Retrieve gene annotations, sequence information, and regulatory elements
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, R package, Genome Annotation

Description: Genomepy is a Python package for downloading reference genomes and associated annotation files from various sources. It simplifies the process of obtaining genomic data required for bioinformatics analysis.
core features: Automatic download of reference genomes, Support for multiple genome sources such as NCBI, Ensembl, UCSC, Integration with popular bioinformatics tools, Ability to update and manage local genome databases
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Python, Reference genomes, Sequence analysis

Description: scikit-cuda is a Python library that provides a Python interface to Nvidia's CUDA parallel computation API. It aims to make GPU programming more accessible to Python developers by providing GPU-accelerated linear algebra operations and other numerical algorithms.
core features: Provides Python interface to Nvidia's CUDA API for GPU programming, Supports GPU-accelerated linear algebra operations and numerical algorithms, Allows for seamless integration of CUDA code within Python programs, Enables faster computation for large-scale numerical tasks
tags: Python library, GPU programming, Numerical algorithms, Linear algebra, CUDA API

Description: Open Babel is a chemical toolbox designed to speak the many languages of chemical data. It is an open-source, freely available chemical software package designed to handle molecular data. It allows conversion of chemical file formats, visualization of molecular structures, and provides various tools for molecular descriptor calculations and 2D depiction.
core features: Conversion of chemical file formats, Visualization of molecular structures, Molecular descriptor calculations, 2D depiction of molecules
tags: Chemical Informatics, Chemical Data Processing, Chemical File Format Conversion, Molecular Visualization

Description: ResFinder is a web-based tool developed by the Center for Genomic Epidemiology for identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in whole-genome sequencing data of bacterial isolates. It helps in predicting acquired antimicrobial resistance by comparing the input genome sequences to a set of known resistance genes.
core features: Identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes, Analysis of whole-genome sequencing data, Comparison of input genome sequences to a database of known resistance genes, Prediction of antimicrobial resistance
tags: bioinformatics

Description: perl-bundle2-cpan is a Perl module that allows for the installation of multiple CPAN modules in one go, making it easier to manage dependencies and streamline the process of installing Perl modules.
core features: Installs multiple CPAN modules at once, Manages dependencies efficiently, Streamlines the installation process
tags: Perl, CPAN, Dependency management, Module installation

Description: Graphite is a system that can be used to create 'smart fonts' capable of displaying writing systems with various complex behaviors. Graphite fonts are capable of providing contextual forms, reordering, ligatures, and other advanced typographic behavior.
core features:
1. Support for creating 'smart fonts' with advanced typographic behavior
2. Capable of displaying writing systems with complex behaviors
3. Provides features such as contextual forms, ligatures, and reordering
4. Enables the creation of fonts for languages/scripts that require special typographic handling
tags: font rendering, typography, smart fonts

Description: EDTA (Enhanced De Novo Transcriptome Assembler) is a software tool designed for transcriptome assembly from RNA-Seq data. It aims to accurately reconstruct full-length transcripts and improve gene annotation.
core features:
1. De novo transcriptome assembly from RNA-Seq data
2. Reconstruction of full-length transcripts
3. Improvement of gene annotation
4. Identification of alternatively spliced isoforms
5. Estimation of expression levels
tags: transcriptome assembly, RNA-Seq, gene annotation

Description: UPC++ is a high-performance communication system designed for implementing scalable applications in partitioned global address space (PGAS). It extends the C++ programming language with a variety of features to enable efficient shared memory parallel programming.
core features: Supports PGAS programming model, Extends C++ with new features for distributed memory systems, High-performance communication system, Scalable for large parallel applications
tags: Programming Language Extension, High Performance Computing, Parallel Programming, PGAS Model

Description: matio is a library for reading and writing MATLAB MAT files in C and Fortran. The library supports reading and writing Level 5 MAT files and supports most of the features of MAT 4 and MAT 5 MAT files.
core features:
1. Reading and writing MATLAB MAT files in C and Fortran.
2. Supports Level 5 MAT files.
3. Supports most features of MAT 4 and MAT 5 MAT files.
tags: MATLAB MAT files, C, Fortran

Description: Stat is a statistical software package designed for data analysis, statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and visualization.
core features: Data analysis, Statistical modeling, Hypothesis testing, Visualization
tags: statistics, data analysis, statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, visualization

Description: r-jpeg is an R package that provides a simple and powerful interface to read and write JPEG images. It allows users to manipulate and analyze JPEG images within the R environment.
core features:
1. Read and write JPEG images in R
2. Manipulate and analyze JPEG images
3. Simple and powerful interface
4. Integration with R environment
tags: Image Processing, Data Analysis, Visualization

Description: xprop is a utility for retrieving the properties of a window in a X server system. It allows users to query and display properties of a given X server window, which can be useful for debugging and troubleshooting GUI-related issues.
core features: Retrieves properties of X server windows, Queries and displays window properties, Useful for debugging and troubleshooting GUI-related problems
tags: X server, Window properties, GUI debugging

Description: r-htmltable is an R package that provides functionality to easily create HTML tables from R objects, allowing users to customize the appearance and style of tables for publication-ready output.
core features:
1. Creation of HTML tables from R objects.
2. Customization of table appearance and style.
3. Options for adding headers, footers, and other table elements.
4. Support for formatting and styling content within cells.
5. Ability to export tables in HTML format for use in reports, websites, and presentations.

Description: Intel Compiler Runtime (rt32) is a runtime library for applications compiled with Intel Compiler. It provides necessary runtime support for applications compiled with Intel Compiler, including math functions, memory management, and threading support.
core features: Optimized math functions for Intel hardware, Memory management support, Threading support for parallel execution
tags: Runtime Library, Intel Compiler, Optimized Math Functions, Threading Support
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Other Computer and Information Sciences

Description: RDFLib is a Python library for working with RDF (Resource Description Framework) data. It allows users to create, parse, modify, serialize, and query RDF graphs.
core features: Creating RDF graphs, Parsing RDF data, Modifying RDF graphs, Serializing RDF data, Querying RDF graphs
tags: RDF, Python library

Description: AMD ROCm (Radeon Open Compute platform) is an open software platform designed for heterogenous computing among CPUs and GPUs. It allows developers to leverage the power of AMD GPUs for a wide range of applications, from deep learning to scientific computing.
core features:
1. Heterogeneous computing support
2. Deep learning frameworks integration
3. Scientific computing capabilities
4. Open-source platform
5. GPU accelerated applications
6. Support for AMD GPUs
tags: Heterogeneous Computing, Deep Learning, Scientific Computing

Description: nvtop is an NVIDIA GPU system monitoring tool with a user-friendly CLI interface. It provides real-time monitoring of GPU utilization, memory usage, temperature, power consumption, and other important metrics.
core features: Real-time monitoring of NVIDIA GPU metrics, User-friendly command-line interface (CLI), Display of GPU utilization, memory usage, temperature, power consumption, and more, Support for multiple GPUs on a single system, Color-coded display for easy visualization of GPU performance
tags: System Monitoring, GPU Monitoring, NVIDIA GPU, Command-line Interface, Performance Optimization

Description: jupyterlmod is an extension for Jupyter Notebooks that allows users to interact with Lmod, the Environment Modules System, directly within the Jupyter environment. It enables users to manage software environments, load and unload modules, and handle environment variables conveniently within Jupyter Notebook.
core features: Integration of Lmod with Jupyter Notebooks, Software environment management, Module loading and unloading, Environment variable handling
tags: Jupyter Notebook, Environment Modules, Software Environment Management

Description: RagTag is a software tool designed to scaffold, polish, and evaluate assemblies by aligning them to reference genomes. It is particularly useful for improving the quality of genome assemblies and identifying misassemblies.
core features: Scaffolding assemblies to a reference genome, Polishing assemblies using reference genomes, Detecting and correcting misassemblies in genome assemblies, Evaluating the quality of genome assemblies
tags: assembly improvement, genome alignment, assembly evaluation

Description: Py3Dmol is a Python library that provides a simple way to use the 3Dmol.js molecular viewer in Jupyter notebooks or Python scripts. It enables interactive visualization of molecular structures and is particularly useful for educational purposes and research in chemistry, biochemistry, and structural biology.
core features: Interactive molecular visualization, Support for various molecular file formats, Customizable styles and representations, Integration with Jupyter notebooks, Ability to embed 3D molecular visualizations in web applications
tags: Molecular Visualization, Python Library

Description: Tigmint is a software tool that aids in the rearrangement and duplication error correction in genomes assembled with linked-read sequencing technologies such as 10X Genomics.
core features: Corrects errors in genome assemblies from linked-read sequencing technologies, Identifies misassemblies, corrects genome misassemblies, and fills gaps in assemblies, Efficiently handles large and complex genomes, Improves the accuracy and contiguity of genome assemblies
tags: Genome assembly, Genomics, DNA sequencing, Linked-read sequencing

Description: Apache Spark is an open-source distributed computing system that provides an interface for programming entire clusters with implicit data parallelism and fault tolerance.
core features:
1. In-memory computation for increased speed
2. Support for various data processing tasks like batch processing, ETL, streaming analytics, machine learning, and graph processing
3. Fault tolerance through lineage graph and RDDs (Resilient Distributed Datasets)
4. Compatibility with Hadoop's Distributed File System (HDFS)
5. APIs in Java, Scala, Python, and R
tags: distributed computing, big data, data processing

Description: Snappy is a fast compressor/decompressor for big data. It aims for very high speeds and reasonable compression levels. Snappy is widely used in many large-scale data processing frameworks.
core features: 1. High-speed compression and decompression. 2. Reasonable compression ratios. 3. Designed for efficiency with big data processing frameworks.
tags: compression, big data, data processing

Description: R package for producing beanplots, a unique way to visualize data distribution, similar to a boxplot or violin plot but showing individual data points as well.
core features:
1. Provides beanplots to visualize data distribution with individual data points.
2. Offers customization options for colors, shapes, and appearance.
3. Allows for overlaying multiple beanplots for comparison.
4. Supports grouping and faceting to display multiple groups of data.
tags: visualization, data analysis, statistics

Description: Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data. It provides a wide range of functionalities for quality control, preprocessing, visualization, clustering, trajectory inference, differential expression testing, and integration with other omics data.

Description: Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing, with syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments. core features: Julia combines the high-level ease of use and flexibility of languages like Python and Matlab with the speed and performance of lower-level languages like C and Fortran. Julia supports multiple dispatch, which allows functions to be defined with multiple methods with different argument types or numbers. It also has built-in package manager and a vast ecosystem of packages for various domains such as data science, machine learning, optimization, and more.
