Description: mesa-gl is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification, a system for rendering interactive 3D graphics, and a widely used and versatile graphics library. mesa-glu is the OpenGL Utility Library (GLU) component of Mesa, providing useful functions for building OpenGL applications.

Description: QCA (Qualitative Comparative Analysis) is a comparative analytical method primarily used in the social sciences to analyze data sets involving categorical variables. It is a method for studying the relationships between the presence and absence of conditions and an outcome of interest.

3. Consistency and coverage analysis: QCA evaluates the consistency and coverage of configurations of conditions related to outcomes.
4. Calibration and fuzzy set analysis: It allows for fuzzy set analysis to account for cases where conditions are not strictly present or absent.
5. Interpretation and visualization: QCA provides tools for interpreting results and visualizing complex relationships between variables.
tags: qualitative data analysis, comparative analysis, social sciences

Description: Popscle is a computational tool for inferring population-scaled copy number variants and somatic single nucleotide variants from bulk DNA sequencing data. It offers capabilities to analyze data from diverse tumor types and platforms, providing insights into tumor heterogeneity and clonal evolution.

1. Inferring population-scaled copy number variants
2. Detecting somatic single nucleotide variants

Description: PySpoa is a Python library for partial-order alignment (POA) that provides tools for performing accurate sequence alignment. Based on a divide-and-conquer strategy, PySpoa efficiently aligns sequences without global constraint and is especially useful for long read sequences in bioinformatics applications.
core features:
1. Partial-order alignment (POA) for accurate sequence alignment.
2. Divide-and-conquer strategy for efficient alignment.
3. Compatible with long read sequences.
4. Python library for ease of integration and usage in bioinformatics workflows.
tags: bioinformatics, sequence alignment, partial-order alignment, Python library

Description: Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer (LZO) is a data compression algorithm that focuses on high-speed compression and decompression. It offers fast compression and decompression speeds with moderate compression ratios. LZO is commonly used in applications where speed is more critical than achieving the highest compression ratios.
core features: High-speed compression and decompression, Moderate compression ratios, Suitable for applications prioritizing speed over high compression ratios

Description: NCBI-vdb is a collection of software tools for managing data from the NCBI Sequence Read Archive, the GenBank flatfile sequence databases, as well as a framework for loading data into third-party caller software. Description: Dill is a serialization library for Python datastructures. It provides the ability to serialize all standard Python data types without needing to be pre-informed about their existence, offering extended functionality beyond what is available in the standard `pickle` library.
core features:
1. Supports the serialization of almost all Python data types.

Support for various types of collective operations such as all-reduce, all-gather, broadcast, reduce, reduce-scatter, etc. 4. Multi-GPU and multi-node communication support. 5. Integration with NVIDIA GPU hardware to leverage optimized communication paths.

Description: PyFR is an open-source Python-based framework for solving fluid dynamics problems on many-core architectures.

Description: PASTA (Practical Alignment using SAT and TrAnsitivity) is a multiple sequence alignment program that uses a divide-and-conquer strategy to improve the scalability and accuracy of alignment.
core features: PASTA incorporates the SAT (SAT-I and SAT-II) algorithm and transitivity to align sequences by breaking the alignment problem into smaller subproblems, which are then joined together to build the final alignment. It allows for the alignment of large datasets and can handle a wide range of sequence types.
tags: bioinformatics, computational biology, sequence alignment

Description: Pilon is a software package that automates the improvement of draft assemblies of microbial genomes, using information from multiple sources to correct draft assemblies.
core features: Error correction in draft assemblies, Utilizes multiple sources of information (e.g. read mapping, alignments, and a reference genome), Automatic implementation of corrections, Support for various file formats such as SAM/BAM, VCF, and FASTA
tags: Genome Assembly, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology

Description: Natural Bond Orbital (NBO) analysis is a popular method for understanding chemical bonding in molecules. It provides insight into the nature of chemical bonds, bond strengths, and electron delocalization.
core features: Provides quantitative analysis of molecular electronic structure based on Natural Bond Orbitals, facilitates interpretation of molecular properties, aids in understanding chemical reactivity and stability, supports visualization of electron density distributions, allows for analysis of intermolecular interactions.
tags: Chemistry, Molecular Biology, Computational Chemistry

Description: libcerf is a C library that provides efficient and accurate implementations of complex error functions, along with Dawson, Fresnel, and Voigt functions. The library is designed to facilitate the computation of complex error functions for a wide range of applications in scientific computing.
core features: Efficient and accurate implementations of complex error functions, Support for Dawson, Fresnel, and Voigt functions, Optimized for scientific computing applications
tags: error functions, scientific computing, C library

Description: MUMPS (MUltifrontal Massively Parallel sparse direct Solver) is a software package for the parallel solution of large sparse systems of linear equations arising from computational science and engineering applications.
core features:
1. Direct solver for large sparse linear systems.
2. Parallel processing for efficient computation.
3. Scalable for high-performance computing environments.
4. Suitable for a wide range of scientific and engineering applications.

Description: Banner is a comprehensive administrative software solution designed for higher education institutions to manage student information, academic records, financial aid, human resources, and other key administrative functions.

Description: TPMCalculator is a computational tool that enables the quantification of gene expression levels from RNA-Seq data based on the transcripts per million (TPM) method. TPM calculations normalize read counts by the length of the transcripts and the total number of mapped reads, providing a more accurate representation of gene expression levels.

Description: Geocube is a Python library for generating interactive 3D visualizations of geospatial data. It is designed to facilitate the creation of immersive and dynamic representations of geospatial information for research, analysis, and presentation purposes.

2. Allows for interactive exploration of spatial datasets.
3. Enables customization of visual elements such as colors, textures, and annotations.
4. Provides tools for adding interactive controls and user interactions.

Description: ACCESS is a tool used for performance evaluation and benchmarking in the field of science and engineering.

Description: nspr (Netscape Portable Runtime) provides a platform-neutral API for system level and libc-like functions. nspr is a platform abstraction library for C/C++. It provides many useful APIs for cross-platform development.

2. Extensive support for cross-platform development.
3. Platform-independent interfaces for common functions.

Description: Cubewriter is a software tool that enables researchers to organize, write, and format scientific papers efficiently.

Description: OpenMM is a widely-used open-source toolkit for molecular dynamics simulation. It provides a high-performance, flexible, and easy-to-use platform for the development of computationally intensive simulations of biomolecular systems.

Description: PISCES (Practical Instructor for SCience Education Simulations) is a suite of interactive computer simulations for introductory college physics. It provides a platform for students to engage in virtual experiments and explore basic concepts in physics.

Description: IQ-TREE is a fast and effective software for phylogenomic inference. It implements a variety of models for DNA and protein sequences, including substitution models, rate heterogeneity, and mixture models. IQ-TREE uses maximum likelihood estimation to construct phylogenetic trees, and offers ultrafast bootstrap approximation to assess the tree accuracy.

tags: phylogenetics, bioinformatics, computational biology, phylogenomic analysis

Description: A lightweight C++ library for parsing command line arguments, inspired by Python's argparse library.
core features: Provides a simple API for defining and parsing command line arguments in C++ applications. Supports a wide range of argument types, such as bool, string, integer, floating-point numbers, and custom data types. Allows specifying required arguments, default values, and help text. Enables grouping of options, subcommands, and handling positional arguments.
tags: C++, Command Line Arguments, Parsing, Library

Description: The Knowledgebase for Interatomic Models (KIM) Application Programming Interface (API) is an open framework for the development of interoperable atomistic and multiscale simulation codes. It provides a common interface for atomistic simulations and facilitates the incorporation and sharing of interatomic models.

1. Standardizes the interface between atomistic simulation codes and interatomic potential models.
2. Enables the seamless integration of new potential models into existing simulation codes.
3. Facilitates the sharing and dissemination of interatomic models within the materials science community.
4. Supports multiple programming languages, including C/C++, Fortran, Python, and MATLAB.

Description: r-minfi is an R package for the analysis and quality control of Illumina DNA methylation arrays. It provides a suite of functions for preprocessing raw data, normalization, and comprehensive quality assessment of DNA methylation data.

It is designed to efficiently analyze large datasets with thousands of taxa and can handle diverse types of evolutionary models.
core features:
1. Fast and efficient maximum likelihood phylogenetic tree estimation.
2. Supports multiple substitution models, rate heterogeneity, and partitioned models.
3. Parallel processing capabilities for high-performance computing.
4. Handles large datasets with thousands of sequences.
5. Incorporates advanced algorithms for rapid tree search and bootstrapping.

Description: fasta3 is a suite of tools for searching nucleotide or protein databases with a query sequence, as well as for conducting multiple sequence alignment.
core features: fasta3 includes tools for database searching, sequence alignment, and motif finding. It provides efficient methods for comparing DNA or protein sequences.

Description: cutadapt removes adapter sequences from high-throughput sequencing reads. It finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing reads.
core features: Removes adapter sequences from high-throughput sequencing reads, Identifies and trims various types of unwanted sequences, Flexibility in specifying adapter sequences and error rates, Support for various sequencing platforms

Description: CRISPRitz is a web-based software tool for designing and analyzing CRISPR/Cas9 guide RNAs. It allows users to design guide RNAs for gene knockout, gene editing, and transcriptional activation with high specificity and efficiency.

Description: R-NMF is an R package for performing Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF), a dimensionality reduction technique widely used in various fields, including bioinformatics, image processing, and natural language processing. It allows users to decompose a given data matrix into two lower-dimensional matrices, representing the underlying patterns and features in the data.
core features: Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF), Dimensionality Reduction, Clustering and Pattern Discovery, Sparse Coding, Topic Modeling

Description: The Amsterdam Modeling Suite (AMS) offers a comprehensive set of programs for computational chemistry. One of the key components is the Atomistix ToolKit (ATK) for quantum mechanical and classical atomistic simulations of materials.
core features: ATK enables simulations based on density functional theory (DFT) for electronic structure calculations, molecular dynamics (MD) simulations for atomistic modeling, and a combination of both in quantum mechanics/molecular mechanics (QM/MM) approaches. It supports a wide range of materials properties and advanced analysis tools.

Description: GMAP (Genomic Mapping and Alignment Program) is a highly efficient and accurate software for mapping and aligning cDNA sequences to a genome, particularly useful in the analysis of RNA-seq data. It is designed to identify and map exon junctions in large genomes.

Description: gzip is a file compression and decompression tool used to reduce the size of files for storage or transfer purposes. It is a widely used compression utility in Unix-like operating systems.

Description: Libspatialindex is an open-source library for spatial indexing methods, designed to provide various spatial index structures which can be used for spatial queries in databases or applications.

2. Supports efficient storage and retrieval of spatial data for use in database systems.

4. Integrated development environment for language design and compiler construction

Description: OTF2 is a trace format for event traces. It is mainly used for the scalable and efficient storage, transfer, and analysis of trace data generated by HPC applications.
core features:
1. Scalable storage and analysis of trace data
2. Support for event traces
3. Efficient transfer and processing of trace data
4. Accessibility for HPC applications

Description: InterProScan is a software tool that allows the functional analysis of protein sequences by classifying them into families and predicting domains and important sites. It combines different protein signature recognition methods in one resource.

Description: The fastai library simplifies training fast and accurate neural networks using modern best practices. It is built on top of PyTorch and provides many high-level abstractions to make it easy to train state-of-the-art models with little code.
core features: 1. High-level API for training deep learning models. 2. Implements cutting-edge techniques in an accessible way. 3. Provides pre-trained models for transfer learning. 4. Includes tools for interpretability and visualization.

Description: lddt (Local Dynamic Data race Tester) is a tool for testing and debugging data races in parallel programs.
core features: lddt is designed to pinpoint the exact locations in the source code where data races occur in parallel programs. It provides detailed information on the variables being accessed and the threads involved in the race.

Description: Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of open-source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials. The software package aims to provide a range of tools for quantum mechanical modeling of materials and nanostructures.
core features: Electronic-structure calculations, Density-functional theory, Plane-wave basis sets, Pseudopotentials, Materials modeling, Nanoscale simulations
tags: Electronic-structure calculations, Materials modeling, Nanoscale simulations, Quantum mechanics

Description: Kaiju is a program for the taxonomic classification of high-throughput sequencing reads. It assigns taxonomic labels to short DNA sequences with near-perfect accuracy. Kaiju is based on the Burrows-Wheeler transform (BWT) and the FM-index. It has been designed to analyze sequencing reads generated by high-throughput sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, Pacific Biosciences, and Ion Torrent.
core features: Taxonomic classification of DNA sequences, High accuracy in assigning taxonomic labels, Utilizes Burrows-Wheeler transform and FM-index, Designed for high-throughput sequencing reads
tags: bioinformatics, computational biology, genomics, sequencing data

Description: OpenSHMEMX is a portable implementation of the OpenSHMEM API designed to provide a high-performance, flexible, and scalable parallel programming model for symmetric multiprocessing (SMP) and massively parallel processing systems. It extends the original OpenSHMEM and aims to simplify the development of parallel applications.
core features:
1. Enhanced support for symmetrical multiprocessing (SMP) systems.
2. Provides a set of standard symmetric memory operations that enable efficient remote memory access.
3. Supports various symmetric memory regions and communication capabilities.
4. Offers flexible programming interface and communication synchronization mechanisms.
5. Compatible with widely-used programming languages and compilers.
tags: parallel programming, high-performance computing, distributed memory programming

Description: Arrow is a cross-language development platform for in-memory data that specifies a standardized language-independent columnar memory format for flat and hierarchical data, organized for efficient analytic operations on modern hardware like CPUs and GPUs.

Description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytic computing. It provides advanced parallelism for analytics, enabling performance at scale for the tools you love. Dask natively scales Python and can leverage a wide variety of existing Python libraries. It operates well on small clusters and individual machines while scale up to massive clusters.
core features:
1. Dask provides advanced parallelism for analytic computing.
2. It scales Python and can leverage a wide range of existing Python libraries.
3. Dask operates efficiently on small clusters, single machines, and scales up to massive clusters.

Description: The prgenv-gnu is a programming environment module that provides the GNU compiler collection (GCC) for compiling and running codes. It sets up the environment variables needed to compile and run programs using the GNU compilers.

Description: SuperLU_DIST is a parallel, distributed-memory sparse direct solver for large linear systems with multiple right-hand sides. This software package provides a highly parallel sparse direct solver that performs matrix factorization and triangular solution stages efficiently on large-scale parallel machines.

Description: cmjob is a Python-based tool for computational materials science that aids in automating the submission of multiple jobs on high-performance computing clusters. It simplifies the process of handling multiple job submissions, tracking job statuses, and organizing job outputs.

Description: Trans-ABySS is a software package for de novo transcriptome assembly from RNA-Seq data. It aims to reconstruct full-length isoforms and to accurately capture gene expression levels.

Description: PhyloFishEr is a software tool designed for the computational inference of evolutionarily conserved elements in non-coding RNA sequences. It employs a phylogenetic approach to identify conserved regions that are likely to have functional importance.

Description: MATLAB is a high-level language and interactive environment that enables you to perform computationally intensive tasks faster than with traditional programming languages such as C, C++, and Fortran. Description: gklib is a C++ library for geometric kernels that provides efficient and accurate geometric algorithms for computational geometry and related fields.

Description: Keras is an open-source neural network library written in Python. It is capable of running on top of TensorFlow, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit, Theano, or PlaidML. Description: libHaru is a free, open-source software library for generating PDF files. It supports a wide range of features for creating PDF documents programmatically, including text, images, vector graphics, and more.
core features: Generate PDF files programmatically, Support for text, images, and vector graphics, Ability to add annotations and bookmarks, Support for encryption and compression, Cross-platform compatibility
tags: PDF generation, Open-source software, Programming library

Description: NanoPlot is a plotting tool specifically designed for visualization of long read sequencing data generated by Nanopore sequencers like MinION. It can create quality control plots to help users assess the quality and characteristics of the sequencing data.
core features: Plotting tool for long read sequencing data, Quality control plot generation, Visualization of sequencing data characteristics, Support for Nanopore sequencers like MinION
tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Sequencing Data, Quality Control, Visualization

Description: ArviZ is a Python package for exploratory analysis of Bayesian models. It provides a common data structure and functions for visualizing and summarizing outputs from Bayesian inference.
core features:
1. Visualization of posterior distributions, traces, and diagnostics
2. Summary statistics for posterior samples
3. Probability density plots and pair plots for correlations
4. Comparison of multiple models
5. Goodness-of-fit checks and convergence diagnostics
tags: Python library, Bayesian inference, Data visualization

Description: ROOT is an open-source data analysis framework used by high-energy physics (HEP) experiments. It provides a range of tools for data manipulation, visualization, statistical analysis, and storage. ROOT is written in C++ and offers a scripting language called ROOT/CINT that allows for quick prototyping and interactive analysis.
core features:
1. Data manipulation and analysis tools
2. Visualization capabilities for 2D and 3D plots
3. Statistical analysis functions
4. Storage solutions for large datasets
5. Support for parallel processing and distributed computing
tags: data analysis, visualization, high-energy physics, data manipulation, statistical analysis

Description: The r-utf8 package in R provides support for handling UTF-8 character strings, enabling users to efficiently manipulate and process Unicode text data. It offers functions for encoding, decoding, and working with UTF-8 encoded strings, making it easier to work with multilingual text.
core features: UTF-8 character string manipulation, Encoding and decoding functions, Support for Unicode text data, Facilitates handling of multilingual text
tags: R package, Text processing, Unicode support, Character encoding

Description: Kmer-Jellyfish is a software tool for counting k-mers using the Jellyfish k-mer counter. K-mers are substrings of length k in a DNA or RNA sequence and are commonly used in various bioinformatics applications.
core features:
1. Counting k-mers in DNA or RNA sequences
2. Utilizes the Jellyfish k-mer counter for efficient processing
3. Can handle large-scale genomic data sets
4. Supports multiple k-mer sizes and input formats
5. Provides options for customizing k-mer counting parameters
tags: bioinformatics, computational biology, sequence analysis

Description: Helen is a software tool for analyzing genomic and epigenomic annotations from large-scale sequencing data. It is designed to extract biological insights from high-throughput sequencing data related to DNA modifications and chromatin structure.
core features: Helen offers various features including the ability to perform differential analysis of epigenetic marks, identify enriched regions of histone modifications, visualize genomic annotations, and integrate multiple types of epigenomic data for comprehensive analysis.
tags: genomic analysis, epigenomics, high-throughput sequencing, DNA modifications, chromatin structure

Description: R6 is an object-oriented programming system in R that allows for the creation of reference classes. It provides a way to define classes with reference semantics, similar to traditional object-oriented programming languages such as Java or C++. Reference classes allow for mutable objects and methods that can modify object state.
core features: Creation of reference classes in R, Implementation of classical object-oriented programming concepts, Support for mutable objects, Methods that can modify object state
tags: programming, object-oriented programming, reference classes, R language

Description: Mako is a template library written in Python. It provides a familiar, non-XML syntax that compiles into Python modules for maximum performance.
core features:
1. Familiar syntax similar to Python
2. High performance through Python module compilation
3. Customizable template inheritance and variable substitutions
4. Supports embedding Python code directly in templates
5. Integration with various web frameworks like Flask and Django
tags: template library, Python, web development

Description: EnergyPlus is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption and water use in buildings. It allows users to evaluate the combined performance of building energy and environmental control systems.
core features: Detailed building energy and environmental simulation, Support for various HVAC systems and control strategies, Advanced fenestration modeling capabilities, Weather data integration for accurate simulations, Parametric analysis and optimization features
tags: energy simulation, building performance, environmental control, parametric analysis, building energy consumption

Description: Eigen is a C++ template library for linear algebra: matrices, vectors, numerical solvers, and related algorithms.
core features:
1. Straightforward API for matrix operations
2. Support for dense and sparse matrices
3. Various linear algebra and numerical solvers
4. Eigenvalues and eigenvectors computations

tags: linear algebra, numerical computation, C++ library

Description: IMPUTE2 is a tool for imputing ungenotyped markers in large-scale genome-wide association studies.
core features: IMPUTE2 uses a combination of reference haplotypes and the study genotypes to infer genotypes at ungenotyped SNPs. It also provides a quality score to assess the imputation accuracy. The software supports a variety of input formats and allows for parallel computing to speed up the imputation process.
tags: genotype imputation, genome-wide association studies, bioinformatics

Description: easysfs is a software tool designed for population genomics analysis, specifically focusing on Site Frequency Spectrum (SFS) data.
core features: The software allows users to estimate basic population genetic parameters such as theta and Tajima's D, perform neutrality tests, and visualize and analyze the SFS data.
tags: population genomics, genetic analysis, SFS data analysis

Description: iccifort is a software tool that provides the Intel C++ and Fortran compilers for high-performance computing applications. These compilers are designed to optimize code performance for Intel processors.
core features: Features include advanced optimization capabilities, support for the latest C++ and Fortran language standards, debugging and profiling tools, parallel computing support, vectorization, and compatibility with various operating systems.
tags: compiler, high-performance computing, optimization

Description: stringdecomposer is a tool designed to break down a given string into its individual components, such as characters or words, and provide detailed analysis on each component.
core features: 1. String decomposition into characters or words. 2. Detailed analysis of each component, including frequency, length, position, etc. 3. Customizable settings for decomposition and analysis parameters.
tags: string manipulation, text analysis

Description: R Shiny is a web application framework for R that allows users to create interactive web applications directly from R. It enables data scientists to develop interactive, web-based dashboards, visualizations, and applications without needing to know HTML, CSS, or JavaScript.
core features: Interactive web applications, Integration with R code and packages, Responsive design for multiple devices, Support for various input controls and reactive output elements, Customizable and dynamic user interfaces
tags: web application framework, data visualization, interactive dashboards, R integration

Description: MC is a popular C compiler and interpreter that is widely used for developing efficient and portable software.
core features: Optimized code generation, Support for various platforms and operating systems, Compilation and execution of C code, Interactive interpreter mode, Extensive standard libraries, Debugging capabilities
tags: compiler, interpreter, C, software development

Description: Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and MXNet. It significantly improves the speed and scale of distributed deep learning training.
core features: Horovod supports training deep learning models on multiple GPUs across multiple nodes, providing fast and efficient distributed training. It is designed to be easy to use and integrates seamlessly with popular deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and MXNet. Horovod incorporates optimizations for reducing communication overhead and achieving high performance on large-scale distributed systems.
tags: deep learning, distributed training, machine learning, GPU acceleration, high performance computing

Description: r-png is an R package that provides an interface to read and write PNG images.
core features: Reading and writing PNG images in R environment, flexible and easy-to-use functions for handling PNG files.
tags: R package, Image Processing

Description: libv8 is an open-source C++ library that provides a fast and efficient JavaScript engine for embedding in various applications and tools.
core features:
1. High-performance JavaScript execution
2. Embeddable in C++ applications
3. Support for ECMAScript 5.1 standard
4. Lightweight and portable
5. Easily integrated into projects
6. Extensive documentation and community support
tags: JavaScript engine, C++ library

Description: Cramino is a software tool designed for computational chemistry simulations and molecular dynamics studies.
core features: Molecular dynamics simulations, Quantum chemistry calculations, Energy minimization, Molecular visualization, Trajectory analysis
tags: Computational Chemistry, Molecular Dynamics, Quantum Chemistry

Description: Pindel is a comprehensive tool for the detection of structural variants (SVs) in mapped sequencing data.
core features:
1. Detects various types of structural variants such as insertions, deletions, duplications, inversions, and translocations.
2. Utilizes split-read and paired-end mapping information for accurate SV detection.
3. Supports various sequencing platforms including Illumina, SOLiD, 454, and Ion Torrent.
4. Provides visualization options for reported variants and breakpoints.
5. Allows customization for specific analysis requirements through various parameters.
tags: Structural Variant Detection, Sequencing Data Analysis

Description: libglvnd is the open-source implementation of the vendor-neutral dispatch layer for arbitrating OpenGL API calls between multiple vendors' graphics drivers and the X server.
core features: The core functionality of libglvnd includes managing OpenGL libraries from multiple vendors, enabling applications to dynamically load the appropriate vendor libraries at runtime, and facilitating communication between the X server and OpenGL libraries.
tags: Graphics, OpenGL, Vendor-neutral dispatch

Description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C. It is a fast and lightweight library that is designed for high-performance applications.
core features:
1. Supports parsing of XML documents
2. Provides API for developers to implement XML parsing in their applications
3. Fast and efficient parsing of XML
4. Easy to integrate with various programming languages
tags: XML parser, Library

Description: CUDF is part of the RAPIDS suite of open-source software libraries and APIs built on CUDA. It provides a DataFrame manipulation library leveraging GPU acceleration for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and otherwise manipulating tabular data.
core features:
1. Distributed DataFrames for larger-than-memory datasets
2. GPU-accelerated DataFrame operations such as sorting, filtering, joining, and aggregating
3. Easily integrates with other RAPIDS components like cuML for machine learning tasks
4. Can handle complex data operations on large datasets efficiently and effectively
5. Supports a wide variety of file formats for data ingestion and export
tags: DataFrame, GPU acceleration, Data manipulation
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems

Description: The roct-thunk-interface is a component of the ROCm project that provides a thin abstraction layer for various ROCm tools and libraries to interact with the ROCr driver.
core features: 1. Abstraction layer for ROCm tools and libraries to communicate with the ROCr driver. 2. Facilitates communication and coordination between different components in the ROCm ecosystem. 3. Helps in managing memory, kernel execution, context, and other GPU operations. 4. Enhances the portability and compatibility of ROCm software across different hardware platforms.
tags: ROCm, GPU, Abstraction Layer, Compatibility

Description: The r-rsamtools package provides an interface to the 'samtools' library, allowing users to interact with SAM (Sequence Alignment/Map) files. It enables the reading, writing, and manipulation of sequence data from next-generation sequencing experiments.
core features: Accessing and parsing SAM files, Generating alignments and sequence data, Quality control and manipulation of NGS data
tags: NGS data analysis, Bioinformatics

Description: TenPy is a Python library for the simulation of strongly correlated quantum lattice models. It includes algorithms for finding ground states and low-energy excitations, as well as for time evolution and thermal equilibrium states. The library is designed to work efficiently with tensor networks in one and two dimensions, such as matrix product states and projected entangled pair states.
core features: Simulation of strongly correlated quantum lattice models, Ground state and low-energy excitation calculations, Time evolution and thermal equilibrium state simulations, Efficient tensor network algorithms for 1D and 2D systems, Support for matrix product states and projected entangled pair states
tags: Quantum Physics, Python Library, Tensor Networks, Quantum Simulation, Computational Physics

Description: Nanofilt is a tool for filtering and trimming Oxford Nanopore sequencing data. It is specifically designed to process raw Nanopore reads and perform quality control operations to improve the accuracy and reliability of downstream analyses.
core features:
1. Quality filtering and trimming of Nanopore sequencing data
2. Adapter removal
3. Length filtering to remove short reads
4. Basecall quality filtering
5. Dynamic trimming based on quality scores
6. Support for both single-end and paired-end reads
tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence analysis, Nanopore sequencing

Description: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) is a widely used file format for storing raster graphics images and other data. It supports various types of data like images, photographs, and scanned documents. The format is versatile and can store multiple layers, color spaces, and metadata.
core features:
1. Support for multiple layers
2. Versatile color space support
3. Metadata storage capabilities
4. Preservation of image quality
5. Wide compatibility with imaging software
tags: image format, graphics, data storage

Description: Trax is a deep learning library that focuses on clear code and speed. It is designed to deliver scalable and efficient machine learning with emphasis on flexibility and speed of experimentation.
core features: Trax offers a modular deep learning framework that enables rapid prototyping with high performance. It provides a library of layers, models, optimizers, and supports automatic differentiation. Trax also includes JAX backend for accelerated numerical computing and high-performance machine learning.
tags: deep learning, machine learning, scalable, efficient

Description: The Generic Mapping Tools (GMT) is an open-source collection of command-line tools for manipulating geographic and Cartesian data sets (including filtering, trend fitting, gridding, projecting, etc.) and producing PostScript illustrations ranging from simple x-y plots through contour maps to artificially illuminated surfaces and 3-D perspective views. GMT supports over 40 map projections and transformations and comes with support data such as coastlines, rivers, and political boundaries.
core features: Manipulating geographic and Cartesian data sets, Producing PostScript illustrations, Supports over 40 map projections and transformations, Includes coastlines, rivers, and political boundaries data
tags: mapping, geographic data, cartesian data, illustration, PostScript, map projections

Description: SEPP (Satz per Partial Parsimony) is a software tool for aligning short DNA reads to a reference alignment in phylogenetic studies. It employs a phylogenetic placement strategy to assign reads to the reference tree in a computationally efficient manner.
core features: Phylogenetic placement of short DNA reads, Reference alignment-based alignment method, Efficient and accurate placement algorithm
tags: phylogenetics, DNA alignment, phylogenetic placement

Description: hprc_utils is a collection of utility tools for managing and analyzing High Performance Computing (HPC) environments and workflows.
core features: Some of the core features of hprc_utils include job submission, monitoring, resource management, data transfer, job scheduling, workflow optimization, and HPC environment setup.
tags: HPC, High Performance Computing, Utility Tools

Description: cuda-quantum is a CUDA-accelerated quantum computing simulator designed to efficiently simulate quantum circuits on NVIDIA GPUs. It provides a high-performance platform for simulating large-scale quantum computations with a focus on speed and scalability.
core features: CUDA-accelerated quantum computing simulator, Efficiently simulates quantum circuits on NVIDIA GPUs, High-performance platform for simulating large-scale quantum computations, Emphasis on speed and scalability
tags: quantum computing, CUDA-accelerated, quantum simulator, NVIDIA GPU, high-performance computing

Description: byo is a software tool for building your own bioinformatics pipelines and workflows. It provides a flexible and customizable framework for creating and running analysis pipelines tailored to specific research needs.
core features: Custom pipeline creation, Workflow management, Integration of bioinformatics tools, Flexibility in pipeline design, Scalability
tags: Bioinformatics, Workflow Management, Pipeline Design

Description: Gaussian is a computational chemistry software suite used for electronic structure modeling. It is widely utilized in research and industry for predicting molecular properties and simulating chemical processes.
core features: Key features of Gaussian include ab initio and density functional theory calculations, molecular dynamics simulations, electronic and vibrational spectroscopy, reaction mechanism analysis, and transition state optimization. It supports a wide range of methods and basis sets for accurate quantum chemical calculations.
tags: computational chemistry, quantum chemistry, molecular modeling

Description: r_flexiblas is a software package for solving linear systems with block-angular structures. It is based on the pre-conditioned flexible GMRES iterative solver combined with a block-ILU(0) pre-conditioner. The software is written in R and primarily designed for efficient solution of large, sparse linear systems arising from computational simulations in various scientific and engineering disciplines.
core features: Efficient solution of large, sparse linear systems, Pre-conditioned flexible GMRES iterative solver, Block-ILU(0) pre-conditioner, Solving linear systems with block-angular structures
tags: Linear Systems Solver, Computational Mathematics, Iterative Methods, Sparse Linear Systems

Description: OpenACC is a directive-based programming model designed to simplify parallel programming of heterogeneous CPU/GPU systems. It allows developers to accelerate applications through directives without the need for low-level programming of accelerators.
core features: Directive-based programming model, Heterogeneous CPU/GPU systems support, Accelerates applications without low-level programming of accelerators, Portable across different platforms and compilers
tags: Parallel Programming, Heterogeneous Systems, Accelerated Computing
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering and Technology

Description: The General Atomic and Molecular Electronic Structure System (GAMESS) is a suite of ab initio quantum chemistry programs designed for electronic structure calculations of molecules and molecular reactions. It provides a wide range of methods for both molecules and periodic solids.
core features: GAMESS offers an extensive variety of quantum chemistry methods, including Hartree-Fock, density functional theory (DFT), Moller-Plesset perturbation theory, configuration interaction, coupled cluster, and more. It also supports a variety of basis sets, including Gaussian basis functions and Slater-type basis sets. GAMESS is highly configurable and enables users to perform geometry optimizations, vibrational frequency calculations, transition state searches, and other advanced electronic structure calculations.
tags: quantum chemistry, electronic structure calculations, ab initio calculations

Description: The r-httr package is an R package that provides a friendly interface to work with web APIs by building on top of the curl package and simplifying HTTP requests.
core features: Simplified HTTP request handling, Support for working with web APIs, Integration with the curl package
tags: R package, HTTP requests, Web APIs, Data retrieval, Data communication

Description: Graphviz is open source graph visualization software. It is used for creating structured diagrams such as flowcharts, network diagrams, and more.
core features: Automatic layout algorithms for visualization, Support for various input formats including DOT language, Customizable node shapes, colors, and styles, Ability to render graphs in various output formats such as PNG, PDF, SVG
tags: Graph Visualization, Diagramming, Open Source Software

Description: SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine. SQLite is the most widely deployed SQL database engine in the world. The source code for SQLite is in the public domain.
core features: Small and self-contained, Serverless database engine, Supports standard SQL syntax, Transaction support, Cross-platform compatibility
tags: Relational Database, SQL, Database Management
Tutorials: https://www.sqlite.org/quickstart.html , https://www.sqlitetutorial.net/ , https://www.tutorialspoint.com/sqlite/ , https://www.sqlite.org/quirks.html , https://www.sqlite.org/faq.html , https://sqlite.org/fiddle/index.html

Description: Torchinfo is a PyTorch library that provides detailed layer-by-layer model information, such as shapes, number of parameters, and memory usage. It helps in debugging neural network architectures and understanding the flow of data through the network.
core features:
1. Layer-by-layer model information
2. Insights into shapes, parameters, and memory usage
3. Debugging neural network architectures
4. Understanding data flow in the network
tags: deep learning, neural networks, PyTorch, model debugging

Description: Toolkit is a versatile software package designed to provide a wide range of tools and functionalities for various purposes.
core features: Toolkit includes tools for data analysis, visualization, simulation, machine learning, optimization, and more. It offers a user-friendly interface and supports integration with popular programming languages.
tags: toolkit, software package, data analysis, visualization, simulation, machine learning, optimization

Description: pyGenomeTracks is a Python package for plotting high quality and highly customizable visualizations of genomic data. It allows users to create complex, publication-ready figures to explore and represent genomics data effectively.
core features: Creation of customizable and high-quality genomic data visualizations, Support for various types of genomics data, including gene annotations, ChIP-seq peaks, and interaction matrices, Highly configurable layout options for precise control over track placement, sizing, and styling, Integration with popular genomics data formats such as BED, BAM, BigWig, and VCF files, Ability to add custom tracks, labels, legends, and annotations to the plots, Interactive plotting capabilities for zooming, panning, and exploring genomic regions
tags: Genomics, Data Visualization, Python, Genomic Data Analysis

Description: Libgd is an open-source graphics library. It allows your code to quickly draw images complete with lines, arcs, text, multiple colors, cut and paste from other images, and flood fills. It can generate WBMP files on the fly. It is also compatible with PHP.
core features: Drawing images with various shapes and colors, Support for text rendering, Manipulation of images including cut, paste, and flood fill operations, Generates WBMP files dynamically, PHP compatibility for web applications
tags: graphics library, image manipulation, PHP library

Description: NumPy is a fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. It contains functionality for multidimensional arrays, high-level mathematical functions such as linear algebra operations, Fourier transformations, and random number generation. NumPy can be utilized to solve linear algebraic equations, perform statistical analysis, create software simulations, and much more.
core features: Multidimensional array operations, Mathematical functions, Linear algebra operations, Random number generation, Statistical analysis
tags: scientific computing, numerical computing, data analysis, mathematics

Description: R-scrnaseq is an R package designed for preprocessing and analyzing single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data. It offers a comprehensive suite of tools for quality control, normalization, dimensionality reduction, clustering, differential expression analysis, and visualization of scRNA-seq data.
core features: Quality control of scRNA-seq data, Normalization and pre-processing of single-cell gene expression data, Dimensionality reduction techniques such as PCA and t-SNE, Cluster analysis to identify cell populations, Differential expression analysis to identify marker genes, Visualization tools for expression patterns and cluster assignments
tags: Single-cell RNA sequencing, Bioinformatics, Data analysis, Data visualization, R package

Description: Open MPI (Message Passing Interface) is an open-source software implementation of the Message Passing Interface standard. It is designed for high-performance computing (HPC) and is used to parallelize and optimize applications across distributed computing systems.
core features:
1. Support for parallel computing across distributed memory systems
2. Scalability for large computing clusters
3. High performance and efficiency in message passing
4. Flexibility in configuration and customization
5. Fault tolerance and resilience in distributed computing environments
tags: HPC, Parallel Computing, Message Passing Interface

Description: Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) library for interacting with kernel mode-setting (KMS) drivers, particularly the Direct Rendering Infrastructure (DRI) modules in the Linux kernel.
core features:
1. Provides the basic interface for accessing the kernel's graphics subsystem.
2. Supports various functionalities such as mode-setting, buffer sharing, and direct rendering.
3. Facilitates communication between user space programs and the Linux kernel's graphics subsystem.
4. Essential for enabling hardware acceleration and managing graphics devices on Linux systems.
tags: graphics, linux, kernel, driver

Description: ccache is a compiler cache tool designed to speed up C and C++ compilation by caching previous compilations. It acts as a caching proxy for compilers, storing compiled object files in a cache directory, which can be reused when the same compilation is done again. This reduces compilation times significantly, especially during iterative development processes.
core features: Caching compiled object files for faster compilation times, Transparently intercepting compiler calls, Support for various compilers and build systems, Customizable cache size and behavior, Tracking dependencies to invalidate outdated cache entries
tags: Compiler Cache, C/C++ Compilation, Build Optimization

Description: A set of libraries which provide a convenient API for rendering text with XCB.
core features:
1. Provides a high-level XCB API for rendering text.
2. Supports client-side caching of text extents.
3. Renders text using the XCB Render extension.
4. Offers utilities for working with X core fonts.
tags: XCB, rendering, text, API

Description: Gfbf is a compiler for Boolean functions, implemented as an SMT/SAT translation tool. It takes a Boolean function expressed as an algebraic normal form (ANF) as input and produces output in various formats including Conjunctive Normal Form (CNF), Decision Diagrams, and Truth Tables. The tool is designed to efficiently manipulate and analyze Boolean functions for various applications in logic synthesis, verification, and optimization.
core features: Boolean function compilation, ANF to CNF conversion, SMT/SAT translation, Decision Diagram generation, Truth Table export
tags: Compiler, Boolean Functions, Logic Synthesis, Verification, Optimization

Description: das_tool is a versatile software tool used for analyzing and visualizing large-scale genomic data in the context of chromatin interactions and 3D genome organization. It provides researchers with a range of functions to explore spatial genome architecture and identify regulatory elements.
core features: Analyze large-scale genomic datasets, Visualize chromatin interactions, Study 3D genome organization, Identify regulatory elements, Explore spatial genome architecture
tags: Genomics, Chromatin Interactions, Spatial Genome Architecture, Regulatory Elements, Bioinformatics, Data Visualization

Description: OpenHPC is a collaborative, community-driven effort to provide a comprehensive and cohesive open-source HPC stack to the community. Through close collaboration with key stakeholders across the industry, OpenHPC aims to provide a reference collection of open-source HPC software components and best practices to enable the development, testing, and deployment of HPC systems. Ultimately, building on the resecarch outputs from various related fields.
core features: Comprehensive collection of open-source HPC software components, Best practices for HPC system development, testing, and deployment, Community-driven effort, Collaboration with key stakeholders in the industry
tags: HPC, High Performance Computing, Open-source, Collaborative, Community-driven

Description: Ragel is a domain-specific language and state machine compiler used for creating efficient state machine code in various programming languages. It can be employed for parsing, scanning, and code generation tasks.
core features: Ragel allows users to define state machines using a concise and readable syntax, supports various output formats such as C, C++, and Java, offers features for specifying actions associated with state transitions, and provides optimization options for generating high-performance code.
tags: state machine compiler, domain-specific language, code generation, parsing, compilers

Description: CellPhoneDB is a publicly available repository of curated receptors, ligands, and interactions between immune and stromal cells.
core features: 1. Curated database of receptors, ligands, and interactions in immune and stromal cells. 2. Provides information on cell-cell communication in biological systems. 3. Enables the analysis of ligand-receptor interactions and signaling networks. 4. Facilitates the study of cell communication in the context of complex tissues and organs.
tags: bioinformatics, HPC tools

Description: The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization used by thousands of researchers and developers around the world. VTK offers a wide range of functionality for tasks such as scientific visualization, medical imaging, computational fluid dynamics, and more.
core features: Core features of VTK include 3D rendering, volume rendering, surface and contour plotting, interactive manipulation of data, support for various input formats (such as DICOM for medical imaging), integration with Python for scripting, parallel processing capabilities, and support for OpenGL and DirectX rendering.
tags: 3D computer graphics, image processing, scientific visualization, medical imaging, computational fluid dynamics

Description: Qiskit is an open-source quantum computing software development framework with tools for circuit optimization, quantum algorithm design, quantum software development, and more. It allows users to create, simulate, and execute quantum computing programs on quantum computers.
core features: Quantum circuit design and optimization, Quantum algorithm development, Quantum software development tools, Quantum simulation capabilities
tags: quantum computing, software development, open-source, simulation

Description: GeneMark is a gene prediction software for prokaryotic and eukaryotic genomes. It uses state-of-the-art algorithms to accurately identify protein-coding genes.
core features:
1. Prediction of protein-coding genes in prokaryotic and eukaryotic genomes.
2. Utilizes advanced algorithms for accurate gene prediction.
3. Provides annotations for predicted genes.
tags: gene prediction, prokaryotic genomes, eukaryotic genomes

Description: LaTeX is a typesetting system commonly used for scientific and technical documentation preparation. It is widely used for the communication and publication of scientific documents in fields such as mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering, and more.
core features: High-quality typesetting for complex mathematical equations and symbols, Customization of document layout and styles, Automatic generation of table of contents, lists of figures/tables, and citations, Easy integration of graphics and images, Support for cross-referencing and bibliography management, Flexible and powerful system for creating professional-looking documents
tags: typesetting, scientific communication, document preparation
research field: Natural Sciences, Mathematics, Computer and Information Sciences, Engineering and Technology

Description: libvori is a library for calculating voronoi diagrams. It provides functions for generating voronoi diagrams from a set of points in the plane.
core features: 1. Generate voronoi diagrams from 2D points. 2. Support for both Euclidean and Manhattan distance metrics. 3. Efficient computation and data structure for voronoi diagrams.
tags: voronoi diagrams, computational geometry, library

Description: Hyperopt is a Python library for optimizing over arbitrary search spaces. The main goal of Hyperopt is to provide a flexible and expressive architecture for an optimization workforce, including hyperparameter optimization, machine learning and statistics.
core features:
1. Distributed optimization: Hyperopt can distribute the optimization process across multiple compute nodes.
2. Parallel execution: Allows for parallel evaluation of the objective function.
3. Plug and play: Easily integrates with different Python libraries and frameworks, such as scikit-learn.
4. Support for various algorithms: Supports different optimization algorithms like TPE (Tree-structured Parzen Estimator) and random search.
5. Scalability: Can handle optimization problems with a large number of parameters efficiently.
tags: optimization, machine learning, statistics

Description: Forge is a computational software framework for developing high-performance code tools for scientific computing, offering a flexible environment for implementing efficient algorithms.
core features: Forge provides a framework for developing computational tools, supports high-performance computing, allows for efficient algorithm implementation, and offers a flexible environment for scientific computing.
tags: computational software, high-performance computing, scientific computing

Description: Intel Math Kernel Library (Intel MKL) is a set of highly optimized, extensively threaded mathematical functions for scientific, engineering, and financial applications that require maximum performance.
core features:
1. Highly optimized mathematical functions
2. Broad set of algorithms covering linear algebra, Fourier transforms, vector math, and more
3. Extensively threaded for parallel processing
4. Supported on multiple platforms and compilers
5. Integrates with popular programming languages and environments
tags: mathematics, scientific computing, optimization

Description: T-Coffee is a versatile multiple sequence alignment software tool that is widely used in bioinformatics. It provides a range of alignment methods and features for accurately aligning protein and nucleotide sequences.
core features: T-Coffee offers various alignment algorithms such as progressive alignment, consistency-based alignment, and pattern-driven strategies. It supports the integration of external information sources for alignment refinement and consensus alignment generation. T-Coffee also includes tools for assessing alignment quality and visualizing the results.
tags: bioinformatics, multiple sequence alignment, protein alignment, nucleotide alignment

Description: JasPer (JPEG-2000 Part-1 Suite) is an open-source software implementation of the JPEG-2000 Part-1 standard. It provides a complete set of tools for encoding and decoding JPEG-2000 streams, including color space conversion, wavelet transforms, quantization, and entropy coding.
core features:
1. Support for encoding and decoding JPEG-2000 images
2. Color space conversion
3. Wavelet transforms
4. Quantization
5. Entropy coding
tags: image processing, open-source, JPEG-2000

Description: r-bit is a software library that provides a suite of functions for working with binary data and bit manipulation in the R programming language.
core features: r-bit offers functions for setting, clearing, toggling, checking, and querying specific bits within binary data.
