Description: The Intel OneAPI Base Toolkit for OpenCL FPGA is a comprehensive suite of development tools for accelerating workloads on Intel FPGA devices. It provides a unified programming model for CPU, GPU, and FPGA to simplify application development and deployment across diverse hardware architectures.
core features: Unified programming model for CPU, GPU, and FPGA, Optimized performance for Intel FPGA devices, Support for OpenCL programming language, Integration with Intel OneAPI Base Toolkit
tags: development tools, accelerating workloads, FPGA programming, hardware acceleration

Description: PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.
core features: PyTables allows users to store and manipulate large datasets in HDF5 format, query data using NumPy-like syntax, compress and filter data for efficient storage, and perform parallel I/O operations.

Description: The R-Blob package provides a method for saving and loading R objects to and from files. It allows users to serialize R objects to binary format, facilitating easier storage and retrieval of complex R objects.
core features:
1. Save R objects to files in binary format.
2. Load serialized R objects back into R environment.
3. Facilitates storage and retrieval of complex R objects.
tags: serialization, data storage, R programming

Description: SeqKit is a cross-platform, ultrafast, and handy sequenced data manipulation toolkit. It allows users to quickly manipulate sequences in fasta/fastq format, including filtering, splitting, removing duplicates, converting formats, and extracting sequences. SeqKit is designed to be efficient and user-friendly for handling large-scale sequencing data.
core features: Manipulate sequences in fasta/fastq format, Filtering, splitting, and removing duplicates, Format conversion and sequence extraction, Efficient handling of large-scale sequencing data
tags: sequence manipulation, fasta, fastq

Description: Default-S11 is a high-performance computational software designed for bioinformatics analysis and molecular dynamics simulations.
core features: The software offers advanced tools for sequence alignment, protein structure prediction, molecular docking, and molecular dynamics simulations. It provides multiple algorithms for analyzing biological sequences and predicting protein structures. Default-S11 also includes visualization capabilities for molecular dynamics simulations.

Description: UCSC Genome Toolkit is a set of tools developed by the University of California, Santa Cruz, for manipulating and analyzing genome data. It provides a collection of utilities and libraries for processing genomic data efficiently.
core features: - Manipulation and analysis of genome data, - Efficient processing of genomic data, - Provides a collection of utilities and libraries

Description: py-cached-property is a Python library that provides a decorator for caching properties in classes. It allows for the creation of cached properties that can compute their value once and store it for later use, avoiding redundant calculations.
core features: Decorator for caching properties in classes, Creates cached properties that compute their value once and store it for later use, Avoids redundant calculations
tags: Python library, Decorator, Caching properties

Description: CTI (Common Threat Intelligence) is an open source library designed to parse and manipulate structured threat intelligence information. It provides a set of APIs to work with different threat intelligence data formats and supports the serialization of data into various formats.
core features: Parsing structured threat intelligence data, Manipulating threat intelligence information, Support for various threat intelligence data formats, Serialization of data into different formats
tags: Threat Intelligence, Data Parsing, Open Source

Description: Reapr is a software tool for genome assembly evaluation and improvement, specifically designed to work with de novo assemblies. It provides evaluation metrics to identify errors in assemblies and offers tools to correct these errors for improved genome assembly quality.
core features:
1. Genome assembly evaluation using various metrics.
2. Error correction tools to improve assembly quality.
3. Visualization of assembly errors and corrections.
4. Compatible with various assembly formats.
5. Command-line interface for easy usage.
tags: Genome Assembly, Assembly Evaluation, Error Correction, Bioinformatics

Description: The r-base64enc package provides functions for encoding and decoding binary data using base64 encoding. Base64 encoding is commonly used for encoding binary data, such as images or files, to be transmitted over text-based protocols like HTTP.
core features: Base64 encoding and decoding functions, Support for encoding and decoding binary data, Integration with R environment
tags: Base64, Encoding, Decoding, Binary Data

Description: Intel Debugger is a powerful debugging tool for software developers working on Intel-based systems. It provides an interactive environment for debugging and analyzing code to identify and fix issues efficiently.
core features: Interactive debugging capabilities, Support for Intel architectures, Advanced analysis tools, Integration with popular IDEs, Memory and performance profiling, Multi-threaded debugging support
tags: Debugger, Software Development, Code Analysis, Performance Optimization

Description: SPAdes Overlap-Layout-Consensus (SPOA) is a C++ library and command-line tool for sequence alignment using a partial order graph (POG). It provides an efficient way to align long error-prone reads (such as Nanopore or PacBio) by constructing a graph based on input sequences and then finding the optimal alignment through a dynamic programming algorithm.
core features: Sequence alignment using partial order graph (POG), Efficient alignment of long error-prone reads, Dynamic programming algorithm for optimal alignment
tags: Sequence Alignment, Bioinformatics, Long Reads, Graph Based Alignment

Description: DeepTools is a suite of tools for the analysis of high-throughput sequencing data, with a focus on ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq data. It provides various functions for quality control, normalization, visualization, and downstream analysis of sequencing data.
core features: Quality control of sequencing data, Normalization of ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq data, Visualization of genomic data, Statistical analysis of high-throughput sequencing data
tags: Bioinformatics, HPC tools, Computational software

Description: Serf is a decentralized solution for cluster membership, failure detection, and orchestration. It is lightweight and highly available, providing a mechanism for event broadcasting and key/value storage.
core features: Decentralized cluster membership, Failure detection, Event broadcasting, Key/value storage, High availability
tags: cluster management, orchestration, decentralized system

Description: The RColorBrewer package is an R implementation of Cynthia Elaine Brewer's color schemes. These color schemes are designed to work well for choropleth maps and other data graphics.
core features:
1. Implementation of Cynthia Brewer's color schemes
2. Designed for creating visually appealing data graphics, specifically choropleth maps
3. Provides a variety of color palettes with different color combinations
tags: R package, Color schemes, Data visualization

Description: AdapterRemoval searches for and removes adapter sequences from High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data. AdapterRemoval can also identify paired sequences in which both reads overlap after adapter removal and generate a statistics file detailing the results.
core features: Adapter trimming and removal, Identification of overlapping paired-end reads, Statistics generation
tags: Bioinformatics, HTS data processing, Sequence analysis

Description: DeconSeq is a novel program specifically designed to automatically decontaminate sequences and detect possible contamination in sequence datasets. It efficiently detects and removes sequence contamination from high-throughput sequencing reads. The tool is particularly useful in metagenomics studies to ensure the quality and accuracy of the analysis results.
core features:
1. Removal of contaminating sequences from datasets
2. Detection of contamination based on user-defined criteria
3. Support for various sequence formats
4. Customizable parameters for tailored analysis
5. Efficient processing of high-throughput sequencing data
tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Metagenomics

Description: pdtoolkit is a Python library for exploratory data analysis and preprocessing of tabular data. It provides various tools and functions for data cleaning, transformation, feature selection, and visualization.
core features: Data cleaning and preprocessing, Tabular data analysis, Feature selection, Visualization tools
tags: Python library, Exploratory data analysis, Data preprocessing, Feature selection, Visualization

Description: ESM (Earth System Modeling) is a software tool designed for simulating and studying complex interactions within the Earth system, including the atmosphere, oceans, land surface, and cryosphere. It enables researchers to investigate climate variability, climate change, and environmental processes.
core features: Earth system modeling, Climate variability and change simulation, Environmental process analysis, Atmosphere-ocean-land interactions
tags: earth system modeling, climate simulation, environmental processes, Earth system interactions

Description: Circexplorer2 is a computational tool for identifying circular RNA (circRNA) from RNA-seq data. It supports the discovery, quantification, and visualization of circRNAs in a variety of biological samples.
core features:
1. Detection of circular RNA events from RNA-seq data.
2. Quantification of circRNA expression levels.
3. Visualization of circRNA back-splicing junctions and expression profiles.
4. Differential expression analysis of circRNAs between conditions.
5. Integration with other analysis tools for comprehensive circRNA studies.
tags: Circular RNA, RNA-seq, Bioinformatics

Description: Anaconda is a free and open-source distribution of Python programming language for scientific computing that aims to simplify package management and deployment. It includes over 250 popular data science packages and their dependencies, making it a one-stop solution for Python programming in data science, machine learning, deep learning, and other related fields.
core features: Comprehensive Python distribution for scientific computing, Package management with conda package manager, Includes popular data science packages like NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, etc., Cross-platform support, Ability to create isolated environments for different projects

Description: Pirate is a software tool for analyzing complex networks, specifically focusing on network motifs and graphlet structures. It is widely used in computational biology, bioinformatics, and social network analysis.
core features: Pirate allows users to deconstruct complex networks into smaller motifs and graphlet structures, providing insights into network properties such as connectivity, clustering, and centrality. It offers various algorithms for motif detection and analysis, as well as visualization tools to aid in the interpretation of network structures.
tags: network analysis, complex networks, motif detection, graphlet structures

Description: BAT (Bioinformatics Analysis Tool) is a bioinformatics software suite designed for the analysis of biological sequence data.
core features: - Sequence alignment, - Phylogenetic analysis, - Motif discovery, - Sequence annotation

Description: Mccortex is a software tool for assembling genomes quickly and efficiently by leveraging the compacted de Bruijn graph data structure.
core features: Genome assembly, De Bruijn graph data structure, Efficient algorithms, Sequence analysis
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis

Description: MACS3 (Model-based analysis of ChIP-Seq) is a software tool specifically designed for identifying genome-wide protein-DNA interaction sites from ChIP-Seq data. It uses a dynamic Poisson distribution to model the background noise and captures the spatial correlation of the ChIP-Seq data to improve peak detection accuracy.
core features: Identification of protein-DNA interaction sites, Analysis of ChIP-Seq data, Dynamic Poisson distribution modeling, Spatial correlation capture for peak detection
tags: Bioinformatics, ChIP-Seq, Genomics, Computational Biology, Data Analysis

Description: OpenBLAS is an open-source implementation of the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) library with optimized functions for matrix operations and linear algebra computations. It provides fast and efficient routines for common linear algebra operations.
core features: Optimized BLAS functions, Support for various mathematical operations on matrices, High performance and efficiency, Multi-threading support for parallel processing
tags: Linear Algebra, BLAS Library, Optimized Functions, Open Source

Description: Mauve is a computational tool used for multiple genome alignment. It is specifically designed for aligning and analyzing genomes with an emphasis on rearrangements.

Description: EasyBuild is a software build and installation framework for (scientific) software. The ACES Scratch environment provides a framework for installing scientific software, including HPC libraries and tools, on a cluster system.
core features: Automated building and installation of scientific software, support for different HPC systems and environments, module management system for easy loading of software packages, version control and reproducibility for scientific workflows.

Description: HDF-EOS (Hierarchical Data Format - Earth Observing System) is a software library developed by NASA for managing and processing Earth science data in the HDF (Hierarchical Data Format) format.
core features:
1. Provides tools for managing and processing Earth science data.
2. Supports a wide range of data formats and metadata.
3. Includes libraries for data visualization, extraction, and manipulation.
4. Optimized for handling large volumes of geospatial data.

Description: XGBoost is an open-source software library which provides a gradient boosting framework for efficient and high-performance machine learning.
core features: Some core features of XGBoost include regularized learning objectives for regression, classification, and ranking problems, parallel and distributed computing for faster training, support for custom optimization objectives and evaluation criteria, and cross-validation to help prevent overfitting.

research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems

Description: libmd is a library for molecular dynamics simulations that allows for the integration of equations of motion for particles interacting with different potentials.
core features:
1. Integration of equations of motion for particles
2. Support for different interaction potentials
3. Molecular dynamics simulations capability

Description: clang-aomp is a compiler based on Clang that integrates the AMD Optimizing Compiler (AOCC) and OpenMP runtime. It is designed for accelerating applications on AMD GPUs.

Description: Map is a software tool used for creating, visualizing, and analyzing geographical maps. It is commonly used in cartography and geographic information systems (GIS).

Description: R-gtable is a layout engine for the 'grid' graphics system in R. It is designed to assist in creating complex table-like layouts with rows and columns of varying sizes.

1. Allows for the creation of complex table-like layouts in R.
2. Supports rows and columns of varying sizes.
3. Provides control over alignment and sizing of elements within the layout.

Description: SOAPdenovo2 is a standalone de novo assembler specifically designed to assemble short reads generated on the Illumina platform. It is an updated version of SOAPdenovo which includes improvements in scalability, adaptability to different data sizes, and provides high-quality assemblies for complex genomes.

1. De novo assembly of short reads
2. Improved scalability and adaptability
3. High-quality assemblies for complex genomes
4. Handles large amounts of data efficiently
5. Capable of detecting various types of variations

Description: The Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) determines the functional consequences of genetic variants. It annotates and predicts the effects of variants such as amino acid changes, regulatory region disruptions, and protein-truncating variants on genes, transcripts, and protein sequences.
core features:
1. Annotation of genetic variants
2. Prediction of variant consequences on genes, transcripts, and proteins
3. Identification of regulatory region disruptions
4. Assessment of protein-truncating variants

Description: OpenMPI is an open-source Message Passing Interface (MPI) library that allows for parallel computing on a distributed memory system. CUDA (Compute Unified Device Architecture) is a parallel computing platform and programming model developed by NVIDIA for their GPUs. When used together, OpenMPI and CUDA enable high-performance parallel computing on GPU-accelerated clusters.
core features: Message Passing Interface (MPI) for distributed memory systems, Parallel computing on GPU-accelerated clusters, Integration of CUDA for GPU programming, Support for high-performance and scalable computing
tags: parallel computing, distributed computing, GPU acceleration, high-performance computing

Description: The py-pillow-simd library is a faster and optimized fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL) with SIMD support. It provides a powerful image processing library, allowing users to open, manipulate, and save many different image file formats.
core features: Support for various image file formats, Optimized for speed using SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data), Image manipulation capabilities, Color space conversions, Image enhancement and filtering functions
tags: Image Processing, Python Library, Optimized Performance

Description: popt is a C library for parsing command line options.
core features: popt provides a simple interface for parsing command line options in C programs, including support for long and short options, automatic generation of help messages, and error reporting.

Description: libreadline is a GNU library that provides line-editing capabilities for interactive programs with a command-line interface. It allows users to edit text as they type commands, providing features such as history, editing, and completion of input.
core features: History: Keeps track of previously entered commands, allowing users to navigate and reuse them easily., Editing: Supports editing functionalities like cursor movement, deletion, and insertion within the input line., Completion: Offers tab-completion for commands, variables, and file paths to assist users with input., Customization: Allows for customization of key bindings, behavior, and appearance of the editing interface.
tags: Command-Line Interface, Text Editing, GNU Library, Interactive Programs

Description: py-xlrd is a Python library for reading data and formatting information from Excel files (xls and xlsx). It helps in extracting data from Excel spreadsheets for various data manipulation and analysis tasks.
core features: Read data from Excel files, Support for both older (xls) and newer (xlsx) Excel file formats, Extract cell data, formatting, formulas, and more, Handle large Excel files efficiently, Easy integration with Python data analysis libraries like pandas

Description: Free Lossless Audio Codec (FLAC) is an open-source audio coding format for lossless compression of digital audio. It offers high audio quality and smaller file sizes without losing any information during compression and decompression.
core features: Lossless compression of audio files, preservation of original audio quality, support for metadata tagging, seeking, and error detection
tags: Audio Codec, Open-Source, Lossless Compression

Description: MCScanX is a toolkit specifically designed for detecting collinear gene pairs within multiple genomes or subgenomes and inferring the syntenic relationships among them. It allows for the analysis of gene synteny and evolutionary relationships, aiding in understanding gene duplication and divergence events.
core features:
1. Detection of collinear gene pairs in multiple genomes or subgenomes
2. Inference of syntenic relationships among genes
3. Visualization of gene synteny and evolutionary relationships
4. Identification of gene duplication and divergence events
tags: gene synteny, genomic analysis, syntenic relationships

Description: Zarr is a Python package providing an implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays which can be stored in memory, on disk, or on cloud storage. It is designed to efficiently store and retrieve large arrays of data while minimizing the use of computational resources.
core features: 1. Chunked storage to access smaller parts of large arrays efficiently. 2. Support for different compression codecs to reduce the storage space required. 3. Ability to store arrays in memory, on disk, or on cloud storage. 4. Compatible with a wide range of Python libraries and tools for data analysis and scientific computing.
tags: Python library, Data storage, Data management

Description: A compiler is a special program that processes statements written in a particular programming language and turns them into machine language or "code" that a computer's processor uses. It typically acts as a translator that converts high-level programming languages into machine language.
core features: Translation of high-level programming languages into machine language, Optimization of code for better performance, Error checking and debugging capabilities, Generation of executable files
tags: Compiler, Software Development, Programming

Description: LHSMDU (Latin Hypercube Sampling Multivariate Data Uncertainty) is a Python library for generating Latin hypercube samples with multivariate data uncertainty. Latin hypercube sampling is a statistical method for generating a sample of plausible scenarios by dividing the input variables into equally probable intervals and sampling once from each interval. LHSMDU extends this concept to incorporate uncertainty in the multivariate data.
core features: Latin hypercube sampling, Multivariate data uncertainty, Python library
tags: Latin hypercube sampling, Multivariate data, Uncertainty quantification, Statistical sampling, Python library

Description: Skewer is a fast and accurate adapter trimmer for next-generation sequencing paired-end reads. It analyzes the patterns of quality scores at the ends of reads and identifies the beginning of the adapter sequences with high sensitivity and specificity.
core features: Adapter trimming, Paired-end reads processing, Quality score analysis, High sensitivity and specificity
tags: NGS analysis, Bioinformatics, Sequence data processing, Adapter trimming

Description: MVAPICH (MPI for MVAPICH2) is an open-source MPI implementation that delivers high performance, scalability, and fault tolerance for parallel computing on large HPC systems. It is specifically designed for InfiniBand and Omni-Path architectures.
core features: High performance MPI implementation, Scalability for large parallel computing, Fault tolerance, Support for InfiniBand and Omni-Path architectures
tags: HPC, MPI, Parallel Computing, High Performance Computing

Description: Py-Cython is a compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language. It allows for combining Python and C code seamlessly to improve performance and efficiency.
core features:
1. Enables writing C extensions for Python.
2. Provides a simple and efficient way to combine Python and C code.
3. Helps in optimizing Python code for better performance.
4. Allows for creating standalone executables from Python scripts.
tags: compiler, Python library, performance optimization

Description: OpenCensus is a set of libraries for various programming languages that helps developers collect performance and tracing data from their applications. The opencensus-python library specifically provides support for Python applications to enable monitoring and distributed tracing.
core features: Distributed tracing, Metrics collection, Performance monitoring, Integration with various backends and frameworks
tags: monitoring, distributed tracing, performance, python

Description: tmux is a terminal multiplexer that allows users to access multiple separate terminal sessions inside a single terminal window or remote shell. It enables users to switch easily between several programs in one terminal, detach them (leave them running in the background), and reattach them to a different terminal.
core features: Terminal multiplexing, Session management, Multiple windows and panes, Customization options, Scriptable configuration
tags: Terminal, Multiplexer, Session Management, Productivity

Description: libzip is a C library for reading, creating, and modifying zip archives. It provides a simple programming interface for managing zip files.
core features: Key features of libzip include reading, creating, and modifying zip archives, adding, extracting, and deleting files within zip archives, and stream-based I/O for accessing zip archive contents.
tags: C library, zip archives, file management

Description: VirtualGL is an open-source toolkit that enables the 3D acceleration of applications that are running on a remote server. It redirects the 3D rendering commands from a Unix/Linux OpenGL application onto a server-side GPU and converts the rendered 3D images into a video stream that is sent to the client-side for display using a high-speed network connection.
core features: Enables 3D acceleration of applications on remote servers, Supports OpenGL applications on Unix/Linux systems, Utilizes server-side GPU for rendering, Transmits rendered 3D images to the client-side for display
tags: remote rendering, GPU acceleration, OpenGL applications, network streaming

Description: Aspera Connect is a high-speed file transfer software that enables users to securely and reliably transfer large files and data sets over the internet.
core features: High-speed data transfer, Secure file transfer, Reliable delivery, Cross-platform compatibility
tags: File transfer, Data transfer, Internet transfer, Secure transfer

Description: The r-hdf5array package provides HDF5-based storage for array-like objects in R. It allows for efficient storage and manipulation of large arrays, with support for data compression and chunking.
core features:
1. Storage of large array-like objects in HDF5 format
2. Efficient manipulation of array data
3. Support for data compression and chunking
4. Integration with R programming language for data analysis and visualization
tags: data storage, manipulation, data compression, R programming, HDF5 format

Description: eztrace is a tool that provides a set of library calls that can be used to trace the evolution of applications during their execution. It helps in performance analysis by collecting information about function calls, communication patterns, and execution characteristics.
core features:
1. Tracing function calls and communication patterns
2. Performance analysis
3. Execution characteristics monitoring
4. Profiling applications

Description: GNU is an extensive collection of free software, including an operating system kernel, utilities, programming languages, compilers, and more, designed to provide users with the freedom to run, study, share, and modify the software.
core features:
1. Free software philosophy 2. Extensive collection of tools and utilities 3. Operating system kernel 4. Programming languages and compilers
5. Community-driven development
tags: software, development, operating system, free software

Description: fastp is a tool designed for pre-processing high throughput sequencing data faster and more efficiently.
core features: The core features of fastp include adapter trimming, quality filtering, quality control, and error correction of sequencing data.

Description: Schrodinger is a leading provider of advanced molecular simulations and quantum chemistry software for Life Sciences and Materials Research. The software suite offers a wide range of tools for drug discovery and materials science applications.
core features: Schrodinger software includes molecular docking, molecular dynamics simulations, quantum mechanics calculations, virtual screening, protein-ligand interaction analysis, and property prediction for small molecules and biomolecules.

Description: tetranscripts is a Python package for transcriptomics analysis. It provides functionalities for processing and analyzing RNA-Seq data to uncover insights into gene expression patterns and regulatory mechanisms.
core features:
1. Preprocessing of RNA-Seq data
2. Differential gene expression analysis
3. Visualization of gene expression patterns
4. Gene ontology enrichment analysis
5. Pathway analysis
tags: transcriptomics, RNA-Seq, gene expression, bioinformatics

Description: r-mime is an R package that provides tools for parsing and creating MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) messages. It allows users to easily manage and manipulate MIME messages for tasks like sending emails and processing attachments.

tags: R package, MIME messages, Email processing

Description: Pydendropy is a flexible and customizable phylogenetic computing library implemented in Python. It provides tools and utilities for the simulation, transformation, analysis, and comparison of phylogenetic trees and associated data.

Description: An R package for efficient graph-based ad-hoc labeling of nodes and edges in the context of network visualizations.
core features:
1. Ad-hoc labeling of nodes and edges.
2. Graph-based labeling for network visualizations.
3. Supports custom labeling options.
4. Efficient labeling algorithms.
tags: R package, Graph-based labeling, Network visualization, Graph algorithms

Description: SingularityPro is a container platform that allows users to create, deploy, and manage containers for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. It is designed to provide users with a flexible and scalable solution for running applications in isolated environments.
core features: Creation and management of containers, Support for HPC environments, Isolated application environments, Flexible and scalable solution
tags: container platform, HPC, high-performance computing

Description: Samtools is a suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data generated in sequence alignment/map (SAM) format, such as those produced by the Short Read Mapping (SHRiMP) or Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) aligners. It allows various operations on SAM/BAM files, including indexing, sorting, merging, and manipulating sequence alignments.
core features:
1. Efficient manipulation of SAM/BAM files
2. Sorting and indexing of sequence alignments
3. Merging, filtering, and converting between different file formats
4. Detection of and working with various flags in the alignment data
5. Calculation of various statistics, such as depth, alignment quality, and mapping coverage

Description: PV (PVS-Studio) is a static code analysis tool that performs comprehensive code inspection to detect bugs and potential vulnerabilities in C, C++, C#, and Java code.
core features: PV uses abstract syntax tree and data flow analysis to identify errors like null pointer dereferencing, buffer overflows, memory leaks, and other common programming mistakes. It provides a detailed report with suggestions for fixing the issues found.

Description: Cell Ranger is a set of analysis pipelines that process Chromium Single Cell 3 RNA-seq data. It includes software for demultiplexing, mapping, filtering, and counting single-cell RNA-Seq data.

Description: PyVCF is a Python library for parsing Variant Call Format (VCF) files. PyVCF can be used to extract and manipulate variant information and genotypes stored in VCF files.

1. Parsing VCF files
2. Extracting variant information
3. Manipulating genotypes
4. Accessing metadata in VCF files

Description: CCL (Cpp Command Line Library) is a C++ library targeting Unix platform that makes it easy to define and parse command line arguments. It provides a simple and intuitive way to define and parse command-line arguments for C++ programs.

Description: Anaconda is a free, open-source distribution of Python and R programming languages for scientific computing, that aims to simplify package management and deployment. It includes hundreds of popular data science, machine learning, and scientific computing packages.

Enables easy creation of virtual environments for different projects. 4. Jupyter notebook integration for interactive coding and data visualization. 5. Supports Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms.

Description: Pythia is a software package for event generation for high-energy collisions, implementing a number of hard scattering models for hadron collisions. It is commonly used in theoretical physics and high-energy physics research.

Description: pytest-xdist is a plugin for pytest that extends it with distributed testing capabilities. It allows for parallel execution of tests across multiple CPUs on the same machine or multiple machines, potentially reducing the overall test suite execution time.

tags: pytest, testing, distributed computing, parallel execution

Description: OrthoFinder is a fast and accurate tool for phylogenomic orthology and gene set inference.
core features:
1. Phylogenomic orthology inference
2. Gene set inference
3. Fast and accurate results
4. User-friendly interface

Description: StarFusion is a computational tool designed for the detection of fusion genes from RNA-Seq data. It employs a multi-step process involving alignment, filtering, and scoring to accurately identify fusion events in transcriptomic data. StarFusion incorporates advanced algorithms to enhance sensitivity and specificity in fusion gene detection.

1. Alignment of RNA-Seq reads
2. Fusion event filtering
3. Scoring and classification of fusion events
4. Visualization of fusion gene candidates
5. Integration with other bioinformatics pipelines

Description: Perftools Lite (PTL) provides a framework for lightweight performance analysis of parallel applications. It allows users to collect and analyze performance data to identify bottlenecks and optimize code performance. PTL focuses on event-based performance analysis to monitor and measure the execution behavior of parallel applications.
core features:
1. Event-based performance analysis
2. Lightweight and efficient performance data collection
3. Identification of performance bottlenecks
4. Optimization of code performance
5. Monitoring and measuring parallel application execution behavior

Description: m4 is a general-purpose macro processor designed to be used with any programming language or data file format. It is commonly used to generate source code or text files and is often used as part of the build process for software development.
core features: Macro processing capabilities, Text manipulation and generation, Support for defining and calling macros, Conditional processing, Loop constructs
tags: macro processor, text processing, software development, build process

Description: Netlib LAPACK (Linear Algebra PACKage) is a widely-used library for numerical linear algebra. It provides routines for solving systems of simultaneous linear equations, least-squares solutions of linear systems of equations, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems.
core features:
1. Linear equation solving
2. Least-squares solutions
3. Eigenvalue problems
4. Singular value problems
tags: numerical computing, linear algebra, library, numerical analysis

Description: JDFTx is a computational package for joint density-functional theory (JDFT) calculations. It enables electronic structure calculations for materials using the JDFT formalism, offering a versatile tool for a wide range of research applications.
core features: Performs density-functional theory calculations, Supports joint density-functional theory (JDFT), Allows for electronic structure analysis of materials, Includes features for simulating various physical properties
tags: Computational software, Electronic structure calculations, Materials science

Description: The r-assertthat package is designed to make testing code easier by providing a set of predicates to perform assertions. It aims to simplify the process of writing tests and improve code quality.
core features:
1. Simplifies testing code by providing a wide range of predicates for assertions.
2. Allows users to easily write tests for R code.
3. Improves code quality by ensuring that functions return the expected results.
4. Provides informative error messages when assertions fail.
tags: unit testing, software testing, quality assurance

Description: Intel Math Kernel Library (Intel MKL) is a set of highly optimized, extensively threaded math routines for science, engineering, and financial applications that require maximum performance. MKL provides highly optimized, thread-safe mathematical functions that include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier transforms, and vector math functions.
core features:
1. Highly optimized math routines
2. Extensively threaded for parallel processing
3. Supports BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, FFTs, and vector math functions
4. Compatible with Intel and non-Intel processors
5. Easy-to-use API
tags: mathematics, performance optimization, scientific computing

Description: n50 is a metric commonly used in genomics to assess the assembly quality of a set of contigs or scaffolds. It represents the contig or scaffold length where at least 50% of the total genome size is contained in contigs or scaffolds of equal or greater length.
core features: Calculates N50 value for genome assemblies, Quality assessment of genome assembly, Evaluation of contig or scaffold lengths in genomics
tags: Genomics, Assembly Quality, Bioinformatics

Description: GTK4 is a multi-platform toolkit for creating graphical user interfaces. It is used for developing applications with a consistent look and feel across different operating systems.
core features: Cross-platform support, Customizable themes and styling, Support for various programming languages, Integration with popular programming languages and development environments
tags: GUI toolkit, Cross-platform development, User interface design
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: Relion is a stand-alone computer program that employs an empirical Bayesian approach to refinement of (multiple) 3D reconstructions or 2D class averages in electron cryo-microscopy (cryo-EM).
core features: Key features of Relion include particle extraction, 2D and 3D classification, image processing, refinement, and reconstruction. It is widely used for high-resolution structure determination of macromolecular complexes.
tags: cryo-EM, image processing, 3D reconstruction, macromolecular complexes

Description: py-virtualenv is a tool to create isolated Python environments. It creates a unique directory for a new Python project and installs dependencies in that directory, rather than globally.
core features: Creation of isolated Python environments, Installation of project-specific dependencies, Avoiding conflicts between project dependencies
tags: Python, Virtual Environment, Dependency Management

Description: SCAFACOS (Single-Cell Analysis Framework for Assessing Clonal Outcomes of Signaling) is a computational tool designed for analyzing single-cell signaling data and inferring clonal outcomes in cellular systems. It is specifically tailored for studying cellular heterogeneity and clonal dynamics in response to signaling pathways.
core features: Key features of SCAFACOS include analyzing and visualizing single-cell signaling data, identifying clonal subpopulations within a cell population, assessing clonal diversity and evolution over time, and elucidating the impact of signaling pathways on clonal outcomes.
tags: computational tool, single-cell analysis, signaling pathways, clonal dynamics

Description: OpenMPI is an open-source Message Passing Interface (MPI) library that allows parallel computing on a distributed memory system. It enables high performance computing (HPC) by facilitating communication and coordination between processes running on multiple nodes.
core features:
1. Support for parallel computing using the MPI standard.
2. Scalability and performance optimization for HPC applications.
3. Fault tolerance and resilience features for handling node failures.
4. Interoperability with different programming languages like C, C++, and Fortran.
5. Dynamic process management and load balancing capabilities.
tags: MPI library, Parallel computing, High performance computing, Distributed memory system

Description: Whatshap is a software tool for phasing genomic variants, which refers to the process of determining the parental origin of alleles in an individual's genome. It focuses on handling variants such as single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and indels.
core features:
1. Phasing of genomic variants for diploid and polyploid organisms.
2. Integration with existing variant calling pipelines.
3. Support for multiple input file formats such as VCF and BCF.
4. Efficient algorithms for accurate phasing.
tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Variant Phasing

Description: CLP (Cbc, Lapack, and ParallelCbc) is an open-source linear programming solver that provides both a standalone solver and a framework for building custom optimization algorithms. It is designed to solve large-scale linear programming problems efficiently and offers a range of features for linear optimization.
core features: Standalone linear programming solver, Framework for building custom optimization algorithms, Efficient solution of large-scale linear programming problems
tags: linear programming, optimization, large-scale problems, open-source

Description: SDSC (San Diego Supercomputer Center) is an organized research unit of the University of California, San Diego that provides cyberinfrastructure resources and services to researchers in the fields of computational science, data analytics, bioinformatics, and more. SDSC supports a wide range of scientific disciplines by offering high-performance computing resources, data storage solutions, software tools, consulting services, and training programs.
core features: High-performance computing resources, Data storage solutions, Software tools, Consulting services, Training programs
tags: supercomputing, research support, data analytics, cyberinfrastructure
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Other Computer and Information Sciences, Engineering and Technology, Other Engineering and Technologies, Training, Infrastructure and Instrumentation

Description: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool that provides a consistent interface for interacting with various Amazon Web Services (AWS) through the command line. It allows users to manage AWS services and resources directly from the terminal.
core features: Interact with various AWS services, Control multiple AWS resources, Automate AWS tasks, Access and manage AWS CLI configuration
tags: Cloud Computing, Command Line Interface, AWS Services

Description: pbmm2 is a long read aligner designed for PacBio single molecule sequencing reads, utilizing a graph-guided mapping approach to accurately and efficiently align long reads to a reference genome.
core features: Optimized for PacBio long reads, Graph-guided mapping approach, Highly accurate alignments, Efficient mapping to reference genomes
tags: Long read aligner, Graph-guided mapping, Reference genome mapping, Bioinformatics

Description: Circos is a software package for visualizing data in a circular layout. It is widely used in genomics and other biological sciences to create visual representations of complex datasets.
core features: Circular layout visualization, Highly customizable graphics, Support for large datasets, Integration of multiple data types, Publication-quality images
tags: Data visualization, Genomics, Biological Sciences, Circular layout

Description: Pepper is a variant calling tool built on top of Google's DeepVariant that utilizes deep learning models to accurately call single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and indels from high-throughput sequencing data. It provides improved accuracy and scalability for identifying genetic variants.
core features:
1. Utilizes deep learning models for variant calling
2. Accurately identifies SNPs and indels from sequencing data
3. Built on top of Google's DeepVariant technology
4. Offers improved accuracy compared to traditional variant calling methods
5. Scalable for large-scale genomic analyses
tags: variant calling, deep learning, genetic variants

Description: Trinotate is a comprehensive annotation suite designed for functional annotation of de novo assembled transcriptomes, particularly for non-model organisms. It provides tools for sequence homology searches, protein domain predictions, functional annotation, and visualization of annotation results.
core features: Sequence homology searches (BLAST), Protein domain predictions (HMMER), Functional annotation, Visualization of annotation results
tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Transcriptomics, Functional Annotation

Description: FastQC is a quality control tool for high throughput sequence data. It provides a detailed overview of the quality and potential issues in sequencing data generated by high throughput sequencing pipelines.
core features: Generate quality control reports for sequencing data, Identify potential sequencing errors and biases, Visualize sequence quality scores, per base sequence content, GC content, sequence duplication levels, and more, Supports various sequencing platforms and data formats
tags: Quality Control, High Throughput Sequencing, Sequence Analysis, Bioinformatics

Description: RISING (Rapidly Installed Systems Engineering) is an open-source systems engineering tool that focuses on automating the system development process. It provides a framework for designing, integrating, and verifying complex systems with an emphasis on modularity, reusability, and maintainability.
core features: Key features of RISING include system modeling, requirement management, architecture design, simulation and analysis, verification and validation, and documentation generation. It offers a set of tools and libraries to support the entire systems engineering lifecycle.
tags: systems engineering, automation, modularity, reusability, maintainability

Description: FreeImage is an open-source graphics library that supports popular image formats and features image loading, saving, conversion, manipulation, and processing capabilities.
core features: Support for various image formats including BMP, GIF, PNG, JPEG, TIFF, and more, Image loading and saving functionality, Image conversion and manipulation tools, High-quality image processing algorithms, Suitable for use in graphics, digital photography, medical imaging, and other applications
tags: graphics library, image processing, open-source

Description: g2clib is a library for the manipulation of geophysical data in the GEMPAK format. It provides routines for reading, writing, and manipulating meteorological and geophysical data.
core features:
1. Reading and writing GEMPAK files
2. Geophysical data manipulation
3. Support for meteorological data
4. Data analysis and visualization functions
tags: geophysics, meteorology, data manipulation, data analysis

Description: BEAST2 is a cross-platform program for Bayesian evolutionary analysis of molecular sequences. It is widely used for estimating species trees, gene trees, divergence times, substitution rates, and demographic parameters using various models of sequence evolution.
core features:
1. Bayesian inference for molecular sequences analysis
2. Estimation of species trees, gene trees, divergence times, substitution rates, and demographic parameters
3. Wide range of substitution models and clock models
4. Incorporation of fossil constraints and birth-death models
5. Advanced Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms
6. Integration with other tools like BEAGLE library for high-performance computing
tags: phylogenetics, evolutionary analysis, molecular sequences, Bayesian inference

Description: The Intel Compiler is a set of high-performance compilers for Intel processors that allows developers to optimize and tune their code for Intel architecture. It supports C, C++, and Fortran languages.
core features: The Intel Compiler provides advanced optimization techniques, parallel programming support with OpenMP and MPI, vectorization capabilities, and debugging tools for efficient software development. It generates code optimized for Intel processors to achieve superior performance.
tags: Compiler, Performance Optimization, Parallel Programming, Intel Processor

Description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source relational database management system known for its reliability, robustness, and performance. It offers advanced features such as multi-version concurrency control, point-in-time recovery, and full ACID compliance.
core features: Relational database management system, Open-source, ACID compliance, MVCC (Multi-Version Concurrency Control), Point-in-time recovery, Extensible, Support for JSON, XML, and other non-structured data types
tags: Database Management, Relational Database, Open Source, Data Management

Description: Ananse is a software tool used for analyzing and visualizing network structures, including complex biological networks.
core features: Ananse offers functionalities for network visualization, analysis, and manipulation. It supports various network types, such as protein-protein interaction networks, gene regulatory networks, and metabolic networks. Users can apply different algorithms for network analysis, clustering, and identifying important network nodes. The tool also provides interactive visualization options for exploring network properties.
tags: network analysis, visualization, biological networks

Description: The Biostrings package in R provides efficient manipulation of biological strings, including DNA and RNA sequences. It offers a wide range of functions for string matching, reverse complement, translation, and many other biological sequence-related operations.
core features: Efficient manipulation of biological strings, String matching and searching, Reverse complement generation, Translation of sequences, Support for DNA and RNA sequences
tags: Bioinformatics, Biological Sequences, Sequence Analysis, Computational Biology

Description: GC is a compiler for the Go programming language.
core features: GC provides garbage collection, concurrency support, memory safety, and a standard library.
tags: compiler, Go, garbage collection, concurrency
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Computer Science

Description: Links is a text-based web browser with support for rendering tables and frames, background downloading, font styles, colors, and SSL connections. It is customizable and highly configurable for browsing the web in a terminal or console environment.
core features: Text-based browsing, rendering tables and frames, background downloading, SSL connections, customization options
tags: web browser, text-based, console-based, terminal-based

Description: The 'latticeExtra' package provides extra graphical displays based on lattice. It is a set of extensions to the 'lattice' package to improve its functionality and make it easier to use.
core features: Some core features include additional graph types such as levelplots, using custom panel functions and options, and easier plotting of subgroups within a dataset.
tags: R package, Data Visualization, Graphical Displays

Description: NetCDF-COMBINED is a package that combines multiple NetCDF files together to create a single output file. It is specifically designed for manipulating large datasets stored in the NetCDF format.
core features: Combines multiple NetCDF files into a single output file, Supports large datasets, Facilitates data manipulation and organization, Compatible with NetCDF format
tags: Data manipulation, NetCDF files, Large datasets, File organization

Description: EasyBuild is a software build and installation framework for high-performance computing (HPC) systems. The aces-tmp tool is a temporary directory management tool that is part of the EasyBuild framework.
core features:
1. Manages temporary directories for the EasyBuild software build and installation framework.
2. Helps in organizing and cleaning up temporary build directories for optimized performance.
3. Streamlines the build process by efficiently managing temporary storage.
tags: software build, installation framework, HPC systems, temporary directory management

Description: Breseq is a computational tool for identifying mutations in bacteria that have evolved in a microbial population. It can detect single nucleotide variants, insertions, deletions, inversions, and complex polymorphisms in bacterial genomes.
core features:
1. Identification of mutations in bacterial genomes
2. Detection of single nucleotide variants, insertions, deletions, inversions, and complex polymorphisms
3. Visualization of identified mutations
4. Analysis of microbial evolution within a population
tags: computational biology, bioinformatics, genomics

Description: CPU (Central Processing Unit) is a hardware component of a computer that executes instructions and performs calculations. It is considered the brain of the computer and is responsible for carrying out tasks and running applications.
core features:
1. Executes instructions from computer programs
2. Performs arithmetic and logic operations
3. Manages data and input/output operations
4. Controls other hardware components
5. Supports multitasking and multiprocessing
tags: hardware, computing, technology

Description: Panaroo is a pangenome visualization tool that allows users to compare and analyze pangenomes from microbial species. It provides an interactive and intuitive interface for exploring gene presence and absence within pangenomes.
core features: Visualization of pangenomes, Interactive exploration of gene presence and absence, Comparison of multiple microbial species, Identification of core and accessory genes, Detection of genomic variations
tags: pangenome analysis, microbial genomics, bioinformatics, genome visualization

Description: Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) is a river basin scale model developed to quantify impact of land management practices on water, sediment, and agricultural chemical yields in large complex watersheds with varying soils, land use, and management conditions.
core features:
1. Simulation of daily or hourly water balance components such as evapotranspiration, percolation, runoff, and groundwater recharge.
2. Representation of routing of water, sediments, nutrients, and agricultural chemicals in river catchments.
3. Assessment of management practices like land use change, terracing, nutrient management, and irrigation management on water quality and quantity.
tags: Hydrology, Water Management, Watershed Modeling

Description: POV-Ray (Persistence of Vision Raytracer) is a high-quality three-dimensional graphics tool that creates stunning photorealistic images using ray tracing techniques. It is a free, open-source software package that allows users to design detailed scenes using a specialized scripting language.
core features: Produces visually realistic images with ray tracing, Supports a wide range of elegant textures, lighting effects, and reflections, Includes a sophisticated scene description language for creating complex scenes, Highly customizable and extensible through user-created scripts and modules, Enables the creation of animations and interactive 3D scenes
tags: 3D Graphics, Ray Tracing, Open-Source, Visualization

Description: PRANK is a probabilistic multiple sequence alignment program for DNA, codon and amino-acid sequences. It constructs multiple alignments by aligning sequences pairwise based on local alignment and phylogenetic information.
core features: Probabilistic multiple sequence alignment, DNA, codon, and amino-acid sequence alignment, Incorporates phylogenetic information, User-friendly interface
tags: Sequence Alignment, Bioinformatics, Genomics, Phylogenetics

Description: HISAT2 is a fast and sensitive alignment program for mapping next-generation sequencing reads (both DNA and RNA) against the general human population (as well as against a single reference genome). It builds on HISAT and Bowtie, allowing for significantly improved performance and new capabilities.
core features: Fast and sensitive alignment of NGS reads, Mapping of DNA and RNA reads, Alignment against general human population or a single reference genome, Improved performance and new capabilities compared to HISAT and Bowtie
tags: Alignment, NGS, Genomics, Transcriptomics

Description: MFEM is a lightweight, general, scalable C++ library for finite element methods. Its features include a wide range of finite element spaces, high-order and variable-order discretizations, parallel computing support, and multiple examples and applications.
core features:
1. Wide range of finite element spaces
2. High-order and variable-order discretizations
3. Parallel computing support
4. Many examples and applications
tags: finite element method, C++ library, parallel computing

Description: 7-Zip is a file archiver with a high compression ratio. It supports several archive formats and can be used to compress and decompress files efficiently.
core features: 7-Zip provides a high compression ratio, supports various archive formats including 7z, XZ, BZIP2, GZIP, TAR, ZIP, and WIM, has a powerful file manager and command-line version, offers AES-256 encryption, and is open-source software.
tags: file archiver, compression, encryption

Description: pplacer is a phylogenetic placement tool that places query sequences on a fixed reference phylogenetic tree while simultaneously estimating their likelihoods. It is particularly useful for analyzing large collections of short reads, such as those generated from next-generation sequencing technologies.
core features: Phylogenetic placement of query sequences, Estimation of likelihoods for query sequence placements, Analysis of large collections of short reads, Compatibility with next-generation sequencing data
tags: phylogenetic analysis, sequence placement, phylogenetic tree, likelihood estimation

Description: Tkinter is the standard GUI (Graphical User Interface) toolkit for Python. It provides a fast and easy way to create desktop applications with a collection of standard GUI elements.
core features: Simple and easy-to-use interface design, Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux), Support for a wide range of GUI elements such as buttons, menus, text boxes, etc., Integration with Python's built-in modules like tkinter, platform-specific modules
tags: GUI, Toolkit, Python Library

Description: libaio is a library that provides a Linux-native asynchronous I/O facility to applications. It allows applications to perform I/O operations without being blocked, thus improving performance by enabling concurrent I/O operations.
core features: Linux-native asynchronous I/O support, Enables non-blocking I/O operations, Improves performance by allowing concurrent I/O operations
tags: I/O library, Linux library, Asynchronous I/O

Description: Orca is a flexible, efficient, and powerful quantum chemistry software written by Frank Neese and co-workers. It provides accurate and reliable computational simulations of molecular structures and properties based on quantum mechanical methods.
core features: Orca offers a wide range of quantum chemical methods, including Density Functional Theory (DFT), ab initio Hartree-Fock, and many post-Hartree-Fock methods. It can perform geometry optimizations, transition state searches, and molecular dynamics simulations. Orca also supports a variety of spectroscopic properties calculations, such as NMR chemical shifts, electronic circular dichroism (ECD) spectra, and UV/Vis spectra.
tags: quantum chemistry, computational chemistry, quantum mechanics

Description: MuJoCo is a physics engine for detailed, efficient and accurate simulation of complex dynamical systems. It is designed for high-fidelity modeling and simulation of computational and robotic systems in various domains.
core features:
1. Fast and efficient physics simulation
2. Support for complex dynamical systems
3. High-fidelity modeling capabilities
4. Integration with various domains such as robotics and computational systems
5. Advanced control algorithms
6. Real-time simulation capabilities
tags: physics engine, simulation, robotics

Description: gfastats is a Python library for statistical functions and data analysis, providing a wide range of functions for descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.
core features: Descriptive statistics, Hypothesis testing, Regression analysis, Data analysis
tags: Python library, Statistical functions, Data analysis

RP Name: aces, anvil, darwin, delta, faster, kyric, ookami
Description: libfabric is a high-performance library for fabric interfaces, designed to abstract fabric communication resources to applications while providing flexibility to applications that need to bypass the fabric interfaces. It provides fabric-agnostic interfaces for communication in high-performance computing (HPC) environments.
core features:
1. Abstraction of fabric interfaces for applications
2. Flexibility for applications to bypass fabric interfaces
3. Fabric-agnostic interfaces for HPC communication
4. High-performance communication resources
tags: fabric interfaces, high-performance computing, communication resources

Description: scikit-fda is a Python library designed for Functional Data Analysis (FDA) in the context of Scikit-learn. It provides tools for data representation, visualization, preprocessing, and modeling with functional data.
core features: - Functional data representation, - Functional data visualization, - Preprocessing techniques for functional data, - Modeling tools for functional data analysis
tags: Functional Data Analysis, Python Library, Data Analysis, Machine Learning

Description: The Intel AI Toolkit is a comprehensive suite of software tools designed to accelerate the development and deployment of AI applications. It includes libraries, frameworks, and development tools optimized for Intel architecture to help developers leverage the power of AI at scale.
core features: Optimized for Intel architecture, Includes popular deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and MXNet, Efficient parallel processing capabilities, Support for advanced neural network optimization techniques, Performance profiling and tuning tools, Integration with Intel hardware accelerators like Intel Xeon CPUs and Intel FPGA devices
tags: AI Development, Deep Learning, Optimization, Performance Tuning, Framework Integration
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems

Description: Control-FREEC is a tool for detection of copy-number alterations and loss of heterozygosity in whole-genome sequencing data.
core features: Control-FREEC is able to detect copy-number alterations, loss of heterozygosity, and estimate purity, ploidy, and infer normal contamination in tumor samples. It can handle both paired and single tumor samples, and applies SNP calling using the Samtools-Bcftools package.

Description: fastq-scan is a tool for batch scanning and processing FASTQ files to extract quality control metrics for Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data.
core features: Batch scanning of FASTQ files, Quality control metrics extraction for NGS data, Efficient processing of large datasets

Description: The r-ellipsis package provides tools for working with the "...", which can be used to enforce lazy-load package dependency and avoid unnecessary loading. It is particularly useful for optimizing the loading of packages within R scripts and functions.
core features: Enables lazy-loading of package dependencies, Avoids unnecessary loading of packages, Optimizes loading of packages within R scripts and functions
tags: R package, Package Management, Optimization

Description: ImageMagick is a free and open-source software suite for creating, editing, composing, or converting bitmap images.
core features: Supports a wide range of image formats, Batch processing, Image editing and manipulation, Conversion between different image formats, Command-line interface
tags: Image Processing, Graphics Editing, Conversion Tool

Description: CoordGenLibs is a set of computational chemistry libraries and tools for generating 3D coordinates for small molecules. It provides functions for assigning coordinates to atoms based on connectivity information and geometric constraints.
core features:
1. Generation of 3D coordinates for small molecules
2. Connectivity-based atom coordination
3. Geometric constraints for accurate coordinate assignment
4. Integration with various computational chemistry workflows
tags: computational chemistry, 3D coordinate generation, small molecules

Description: The globus-cli is a command-line interface tool that provides users with a way to interact with the Globus file transfer service directly from the terminal. It allows for managing transfers, accessing endpoints, and monitoring tasks efficiently through the command line interface.
core features: Manage file transfers, Access endpoints, Monitor tasks, Interact with Globus service

Description: wpebackend-fdo is a software project that provides a backend implementation for WebKit's WPE WebKit using a Flatpak distributed runtime for sandboxing.

Description: x264 is a free and open-source software library and a command-line utility for encoding video streams into the H.264/MPEG-4 AVC format.
core features: High-quality and efficient H.264 video encoding, Support for a wide range of input sources and parameters, Advanced encoding settings and optimizations for compression, Multi-threading support for faster processing
tags: video encoding, H.264/MPEG-4 AVC, open-source

Description: VisiData is a fast, interactive multitool for tabular data. It combines the clarity of a spreadsheet, the efficiency of the terminal, and the power of Python, into a lightweight utility which can handle millions of rows with ease.
core features: 1. Fast and efficient data manipulation. 2. Customizable visualizations. 3. Integration with Python for scripting and automation. 4. Support for various data formats.
tags: data manipulation, visualization, Python, data analysis

Description: nvbio is a GPU-accelerated library of high-performance bioinformatics algorithms designed to leverage the parallel processing power of NVIDIA GPUs. It offers various tools for DNA sequence analysis and manipulation, allowing for faster and more efficient processing of large-scale genomic data.
core features: GPU-accelerated bioinformatics algorithms, High-performance DNA sequence analysis, Parallel processing with NVIDIA GPUs, Support for large-scale genomic data, Efficient manipulation of DNA sequences
tags: Bioinformatics, GPU Acceleration, Genomic Data Processing, DNA Sequence Analysis

Description: Unzip is a popular open-source file extraction utility for extracting compressed files in various formats. It is commonly used to extract files from ZIP archives, but it also supports other archive formats.
core features: Extract files from ZIP archives, Support for various archive formats, Open-source and freely available, Cross-platform compatibility
tags: file extraction, compression, utility

Description: r-htmlwidgets package allows users to create interactive web-based visualizations using R. It provides a framework for easily creating interactive HTML widgets from R. These widgets can be used in R Markdown documents, Shiny applications, and RStudio. The package supports a wide range of JavaScript visualization libraries that enable the creation of interactive plots and visualizations.
core features:
1. Creation of interactive web visualizations from R.
2. Integration with R Markdown documents, Shiny applications, and RStudio.
3. Supports various JavaScript visualization libraries.
4. Enables users to create dynamic and interactive plots and visualizations.

Description: RNAQuast is a quality assessment tool for de novo transcriptome assembly pipelines. It evaluates the quality of transcriptome assemblies by comparing them to a reference genome and measures various metrics to assess the completeness, correctness, and compatibility of the assembly.
core features: Quality assessment of de novo transcriptome assemblies, Comparison to a reference genome, Evaluation of completeness, correctness, and compatibility, Generation of detailed quality reports
tags: Bioinformatics, Transcriptome Analysis, Quality Assessment, Genomics

Description: The Intel C++ Compiler (Intel CCL) is a high-performance optimizing compiler for C and C++ programming languages. It is designed to produce highly optimized code for Intel processors, including Intel Xeon Scalable processors and Intel Xeon Phi processors. Intel CCL supports the latest C++ language standards and provides advanced vectorization and parallelization capabilities.
core features: High-performance optimizing compiler for C and C++, Optimizes code for Intel processors, Support for latest C++ language standards, Advanced vectorization and parallelization, Improved code performance and efficiency
tags: Compiler, C++, Performance Optimization, Intel Processors

Description: r-methylumi is an R package for methylation data analysis. It provides functions for preprocessing, quality control, normalization, and visualization of methylation array data.
core features: Preprocessing of methylation array data, Quality control, Normalization techniques, Visualization tools
tags: Methylation data analysis, R package, Bioinformatics

Description: bali-phy is a software package for Bayesian inference of phylogenies, evolutionary rates, and divergence times. It is particularly designed for large-scale comparative genomic studies.
core features: Some core features of bali-phy include Bayesian inference of phylogenetic trees, estimation of evolutionary rates and divergence times, handling large-scale datasets efficiently, and conducting rigorous statistical analyses.

Description: MPICH is a high-performance and widely portable implementation of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard. It enables parallel computing on a wide variety of platforms and architectures.
core features: Implements the MPI standard for message passing interface, High-performance parallel computing capabilities, Portability across diverse platforms and architectures, Support for large-scale parallel applications

Description: GenMap is a software tool designed for genetic mapping studies, particularly in the context of linkage analysis. It is used to map genetic loci to specific regions of chromosomes by analyzing the inheritance patterns of genetic markers within families.
core features:
1. Genetic mapping for linkage analysis
2. Analysis of inheritance patterns of genetic markers
3. Mapping genetic loci to chromosomal regions
4. Family-based genetic studies support
5. Visualization of linkage results
tags: genetic mapping, linkage analysis, genetic loci mapping, family-based studies

Description: protobuf-python is a Python library for Protocol Buffers, Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral extensible mechanism for serializing structured data.
core features:
1. Efficient serialization of structured data
2. Language and platform neutral
3. Extensibility
4. Binary encoding for data transmission
5. Data validation
tags: data serialization, binary encoding, data validation, structured data, extensible

Description: pytest-flakefinder is a Pytest plugin that helps in detecting flaky tests by running them multiple times and analyzing the results. It identifies tests that fail intermittently due to non-deterministic behavior.
core features: Detection of flaky tests, Running tests multiple times, Analysis of test results
tags: pytest plugin, test automation, flaky test detection

Description: PlasmidFinder is a tool for in silico detection of plasmids in bacterial genomes. It identifies plasmid replicon sequences by comparing input DNA sequences to a predefined database of known plasmids.
core features: In silico detection of plasmids, Identification of plasmid replicon sequences, Comparison to a database of known plasmids
tags: bioinformatics, genomics, microbiology, bacterial genomics, plasmid detection

Description: py-openpyxl is a Python library to read/write Excel 2010 xlsx/xlsm/xltx/xltm files.
core features: 1. Supports the xlsx/xlsm/xltx/xltm formats. 2. Allows reading and writing Excel files. 3. Can create new Excel files, edit existing ones, and extract data. 4. Supports formatting options like styles, fonts, colors, etc. 5. Provides support for charts and images within Excel files.
tags: Python library, Excel manipulation, Data processing

Description: Make is a build automation tool that automatically builds executable programs and libraries from source code by reading files called Makefiles which specifies how to derive the target program.
core features: Dependency management, Automation, Build process management
tags: build automation, software development, programming

Description: Bazel is a build tool that helps to build and test software of any size, quickly and reliably.
