It is designed to identify and quantify post-mortem DNA damage patterns, such as nucleotide misincorporations and DNA fragmentation, to aid in distinguishing authentic ancient DNA sequences from modern contamination.
core features: Assessment of DNA damage patterns, Identification of post-mortem nucleotide misincorporations, Quantification of DNA fragmentation, Differentiation between ancient DNA and modern contamination
tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Ancient DNA, DNA Damage

Description: libspatialite is an open-source library that extends the core SQLite database engine with spatial SQL capabilities. It allows users to create, manage, and query spatial data in a SQLite database, providing support for spatial functions and geometric data types.
core features:
1. Spatial SQL capabilities within SQLite database engine
2. Support for spatial functions and geometric data types
3. Enables creation, management, and querying of spatial data
4. Open-source and actively maintained
tags: spatialite, geospatial, database, spatial data

Description: Parallel-NetCDF is a library providing high-performance I/O in parallel environments for big data applications with large scientific datasets. It offers parallel I/O capabilities for NetCDF files, which are commonly used in climate modeling, weather forecasting, and other scientific disciplines.
core features: Parallel I/O for NetCDF files, High-performance I/O in parallel environments, Optimized for big data applications with large datasets, Supports parallel reads and writes, Scalable and efficient storage and retrieval of data
tags: High-performance I/O, Big Data, Parallel Computing

Description: PyPy is a fast, compliant alternative implementation of the Python programming language. It aims to provide a high-performance, flexible, and efficient interpreter for Python, while maintaining compatibility with the CPython reference implementation.
core features:
1. Just-in-time compilation for improved speed
2. Reduced memory usage compared to CPython
3. Compatibility with existing Python code and libraries
4. Support for multiple Python versions
5. Built-in garbage collection
6. Cross-platform support
tags: Python interpreter, Alternative implementation, Just-in-time compilation, High performance

Description: TeX Live is a comprehensive distribution of the TeX typesetting system that includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages, and fonts. It is designed to be cross-platform and provides a complete TeX environment for users working with typesetting and document preparation.
core features: Cross-platform support for Windows, macOS, and Linux, Includes all essential TeX programs, macro packages, and fonts, Rich set of tools for typesetting mathematical formulas, complex documents, and academic papers, Extensive package manager for easy installation and updates of additional TeX components
tags: typesetting, document preparation, TeX distribution, cross-platform

Description: Nextalign is a software tool for viral genome alignment and analysis, focusing on SARS-CoV-2 and other related viruses. It is designed to help researchers and clinicians analyze the mutations and genetic variations in viral genomes.
core features:
1. Rapid and accurate alignment of viral genomes
2. Identification of mutations and genetic variations
3. Annotation of important features such as amino acid changes
4. Visualization of aligned sequences and mutations
5. Support for analyzing SARS-CoV-2 and related viruses
tags: viral genome analysis, sequence alignment, mutation analysis

Description: SUNDIALS (Suite of Nonlinear and Differential/Algebraic Equation Solvers) is a software package for the solution of large-scale, time-dependent nonlinear differential/algebraic systems.
core features:
1. Provides a variety of numerical integration techniques.
2. Supports both explicit and implicit time-stepping methods.
3. Includes solvers for stiff and non-stiff systems of equations.
4. Offers flexibility in choosing solvers based on problem characteristics.
5. Supports a wide range of applications in scientific computing.
tags: software, numerical integration, differential equations, algebraic equations, scientific computing

RP Name: aces, anvil, bridges, darwin, delta, expanse, faster, kyric, stampede3
Description: Intel is a multinational corporation that designs and manufactures semiconductor chips and other technology products. The company is a leading provider of microprocessors for personal computers, servers, and other computing devices.
core features: Intel offers a wide range of products including processors, integrated graphics solutions, system-on-chip products, and more. Their technology powers a variety of devices and applications across different industries.
tags: semiconductor, technology, microprocessors

Description: The CFD General Notation System (CGNS) provides a standard for recording and recovering computer data associated with the numerical solution of the equations of fluid dynamics. It is designed to facilitate the exchange of data between sites and applications, as well as to help stabilize the archiving of fluid dynamics data.
core features:
1. Supports the hierarchical structure of CFD computations.
2. Allows data to be written to a file so that it is portable across different machines and operating systems.
3. Provides mechanisms for modifying data as technologies advance, ensuring long-term viability of CFD data.
4. Offers a range of tools and conventions to support data interoperability.
tags: Computational Software

Description: PASA (Program to Assemble Spliced Alignments) is a eukaryotic genome annotation tool that uses multiple sources of experimental evidence to identify and improve gene structures. PASA Pipeline is a comprehensive software tool that automates and streamlines the process of gene structure annotation and improvement.
core features:
1. Integration of various sources of evidence such as RNA-Seq reads, ESTs, and protein alignments to annotate gene structures. 
2. Automated identification of alternatively spliced isoforms. 
3. Improvement of gene structures through iterative alignment and assembly steps. 
4. Built-in support for visualization of gene structures and associated evidence.
tags: genome annotation, gene structure, RNA-Seq, eukaryotic genomes

Description: Cell Ranger DNA is a software package from 10x Genomics that enables the analysis of single-cell DNA sequencing data. It is specifically designed to process single-cell data from linked-read sequencing technologies, such as the 10x Genomics Chromium platform, to identify structural variants, copy number variations, and clonality in individual cells.
core features: Analysis of single-cell DNA sequencing data, Identification of structural variants, Detection of copy number variations, Estimation of clonality in individual cells, Support for linked-read sequencing technologies
tags: Single-cell DNA sequencing, Structural variants, Copy number variations, Clonality analysis, Linked-read sequencing

Description: redis-py is a Python client library for Redis, a popular in-memory data store. It allows Python developers to easily interact with a Redis database to store and retrieve data.
core features: Provides a Python interface to interact with Redis databases, Supports key-value operations such as set, get, delete, and increment, Allows for working with Redis data structures like lists, sets, sorted sets, and hashes, Offers pipeline support for executing multiple commands in a single round trip to the server, Provides pub/sub functionality for implementing messaging patterns
tags: Python Library, Database Interaction, In-Memory Data Store, Data Persistence

Description: CPE (Common Platform Enumeration) is a standardized method to describe and identify classes of applications, operating systems, and hardware devices in a consistent format. It provides unique identifiers for these entities to facilitate accurate and efficient information exchange between different security tools and databases.
core features:
1. Standardized identification and description of software and hardware entities.
2. Facilitates interoperability between security tools and databases.
3. Assigns unique identifiers to each software, operating system, and hardware device.
4. Supports accurate and efficient information exchange in the cybersecurity domain.
tags: software identification, cybersecurity, information exchange

Description: debreak is a tool for analyzing and visualizing the output generated by the debarcoder software. Debarcoder is used for decoding high-throughput sequencing data from combinatorial CRISPR screens.
core features: debreak allows users to easily interpret the results of debarcoder by providing visualization and statistical analysis tools. It helps in understanding the performance of the CRISPR screen and identifying significant hits.
tags: bioinformatics, HPC tools

Description: IPython is a powerful interactive command shell that provides a robust and flexible environment for interactive computing. It offers features such as easy-to-use, high-performance tools for parallel computing, data visualization, and data analysis.
core features: Interactive Python shell with enhancements, Support for data visualization and data analysis, Parallel computing capabilities, Rich media integration, Integration with other programming languages
tags: Command Shell, Interactive Computing, Data Visualization, Parallel Computing, Data Analysis

Description: dbcsr (distributed block compressed sparse row) is a library for creating distributed block-sparse matrix data structures and performing operations on them efficiently. It is designed for high-performance computing (HPC) applications that involve large, sparse matrices.
core features:
1. Creation of distributed block-sparse matrix data structures
2. Efficient operations on block-sparse matrices
3. Designed for high-performance computing (HPC) applications
4. Supports parallel computation
5. Optimized for large, sparse matrices
tags: HPC, Sparse Matrices, Parallel Computing

Description: Wannier90 is a tool used for the computation of maximally-localized Wannier functions, which are spatially compact and localized functions that provide a natural description of the electronic structure of a solid. These functions are often used in condensed matter physics calculations to study the electronic properties of materials.
core features:
1. Computation of maximally-localized Wannier functions
2. Calculation of Wannier centers and spreads
3. Generation of Wannier interpolation grids
4. Interface with various electronic structure codes
5. Post-processing and analysis functionalities
tags: computational chemistry, solid state physics, electronic structure, materials science

Description: ruamel.yaml is a YAML 1.2 loader/dumper package for Python. It is a superset of the PyYAML library and it includes round-trip parsing (which allows for preserving comments and formatting when loading and then emitting the YAML data).
core features: 1. Supports YAML 1.2 2. Round-trip parsing to preserve comments and formatting 3. Compatibility with PyYAML 4. Comprehensive documentation
tags: yaml, parser, dumper, python

Description: DeepConsensus is a tool for variant calling in MinION nanopore sequencing data. It uses deep learning to increase accuracy and sensitivity in detecting single nucleotide variants (SNVs) and insertion/deletion (indel) mutations.
core features:
1. Variant calling in MinION nanopore sequencing data
2. Utilizes deep learning for improved accuracy and sensitivity
3. Detection of single nucleotide variants (SNVs) and insertion/deletion (indel) mutations
tags: variant calling, MinION nanopore sequencing, deep learning

Description: Logical Volume Manager 2 (LVM2) is a system tool for managing logical volumes. It is typically used to manage disk storage space in a more flexible manner than traditional partitioning.
core features: Create and manage logical volumes, Resize logical volumes on the fly, Support for snapshots and thin provisioning, Manage multiple physical storage devices as a single shared pool
tags: system tool, storage management, disk management

Description: The Arcade Learning Environment (ALE) is an evaluation platform that combines various classic video games in a consistent framework for the purpose of AI research and reinforcement learning. It provides a standardized environment for testing and comparing the performance of different AI agents.
core features: 1. Offers a variety of classic video games integrated into a single framework. 2. Allows researchers to develop and test reinforcement learning algorithms. 3. Provides a standardized platform for benchmarking AI agents. 4. Enables the evaluation of AI performance across different game environments.
tags: AI research, reinforcement learning, video games

Description: Latest is a software tool designed for staying up-to-date with the latest news, trends, developments, and information in various fields. It curates and aggregates content from multiple sources to provide users with real-time updates.
core features:
1. Real-time news updates
2. Aggregation of information from multiple sources
3. Customizable content preferences
4. Notifications for important updates
5. Trend analysis and data visualization
tags: news, updates, information, aggregation

Description: pytest-rerunfailures is a plugin for the pytest testing framework that automatically reruns failed test cases to improve test reliability.
core features: Automatic rerun of failed test cases, Enhanced test reliability, Customizable rerun settings
tags: Software Testing, Python Libraries, Programming Tools

Description: The futile logger package in R provides a simple, flexible and effective logging utility for R developers. It allows users to easily log messages, warnings, and errors while customizing log output formatting and destination.
core features: Logging messages, warnings, and errors, Customizable log output formatting, Configurable log destination
tags: logging, R package, utility

Description: JAX is an open-source software library for high-performance machine learning research, particularly for automatic differentiation, and numerical and scientific computing.
core features: JAX provides a functional framework that extends NumPy and enables GPU/TPU acceleration, automatic differentiation for Python and NumPy functions, custom vectorizable NumPy functions, composable transformations, and efficient gradient computation.
tags: machine learning, numerical computing, scientific computing

Description: r-lambda-r is a software package used for analyzing and modeling RNA-protein binding sites by considering the complex relationships between sequence, structure, and binding affinity. It employs machine learning algorithms to predict binding affinities and can help in understanding the molecular basis of RNA-protein interactions.
core features: Analysis of RNA-protein binding sites, Incorporation of sequence, structure, and binding affinity data, Machine learning algorithms for affinity prediction, Insights into molecular basis of RNA-protein interactions
tags: RNA-protein interactions, Machine learning, Bioinformatics, Computational biology

Description: CNVkit is a software toolkit for copy number variation (CNV) detection and genotyping from targeted DNA sequencing data. It is designed to handle shallow coverage whole-exome and panel target sequencing from tumor-normal pairs.
core features: Detection and genotyping of copy number variations (CNVs), Handling shallow coverage whole-exome and panel target sequencing data, Analysis of tumor-normal pairs
tags: Bioinformatics, HPC tools, Computational software

Description: gst-plugins-bad is a collection of GStreamer plugins and elements that are not of high quality, experimental, or have not been tested well. These plugins are considered 'bad' due to various reasons such as being incomplete, breaking or lacking proper documentation.
core features:
1. Provides a variety of GStreamer plugins and elements.
2. Experimental plugins for testing new functionalities.
3. Plugins that are incomplete or lack proper testing.
4. Supplement to the GStreamer plugins base.
tags: multimedia, plugin, GStreamer

Description: Spython is a software tool that combines the functionalities of the Python programming language with specific features tailored for scientific computing, data analysis, and visualization tasks. It aims to streamline the workflow for researchers and scientists by providing an integrated environment for code development, data manipulation, and result visualization.
core features: Integration with popular Python libraries for scientific computing, such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib, Interactive data exploration and visualization capabilities, Support for parallel computing and distributed processing, Code profiling and optimization tools, Built-in tools for machine learning and statistical analysis, Integration with Jupyter notebooks for interactive computing
tags: scientific computing, data analysis, visualization, Python programming, research tools
research field: Computer and Information Sciences, Other Mathematics, Other Natural Sciences

Description: SqueezeMeta is a tool for the fast and accurate taxonomic classification of metagenomic sequences. It employs a novel filtering method to reduce the number of reference genomes for mapping, thus improving speed and accuracy in taxonomic assignment.
core features: Fast and accurate taxonomic classification of metagenomic sequences, Novel filtering method to reduce reference genomes for mapping, Improves speed and accuracy in taxonomic assignment
tags: metagenomics, taxonomic classification, bioinformatics, sequence analysis

Description: Py-GSD is a Python library for reading and writing General Simulation Data files. It provides a high-level, Pythonic interface to the GSD file format, making it easier for users to manipulate and analyze simulation data in Python.
core features:
1. Reading and writing General Simulation Data (GSD) files
2. High-level Pythonic interface
3. Simplifies manipulation and analysis of simulation data
tags: Python Library, Simulation Data, Data Analysis

Description: OpenMX is a software package for nano-scale material simulations based on density functional theories, norm-conserving pseudopotentials, and pseudo-atomic localized basis functions.
core features: Key features of OpenMX include electronic structure calculations, molecular dynamics simulations, and optimization algorithms for nano-scale materials. It can handle various materials including molecules, surfaces, and nanoscale structures.
tags: computational chemistry, materials science

Description: PLINK is a free, open-source whole genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner. The focus of PLINK is purely on analysis of genotype/phenotype data, so there is no support for steps prior to this (e.g. study design and planning, generating genotype or CNV calls from raw data).
core features:
1. Quality control of genotype data
2. Data management
3. Powerful association analysis methods
4. Population stratification analysis
5. LD-based clumping procedures
6. Support for quantitative phenotypes
7. Support for gene-gene interaction testing
tags: genomics, association analysis, genotype-phenotype data

Description: R package for Generalized Additive Models with GCV/AIC/REML smoothness estimation
core features: Fits generalized additive models with integrated smoothness estimation, Flexible modeling of nonlinear relationships, Automated selection of model complexity with GCV/AIC/REML, Supports various types of response variables, Allows for multiple smoothing methods like thin plate regression splines and cubic regression splines
tags: R package, Generalized Additive Models, Nonlinear modeling

Description: r-data-table is an R package that provides an enhanced data manipulation toolbox using the data.table package. It is designed for fast aggregation of large data sets, rolling joins, and dealing with ordered data.
core features:
1. Efficient aggregation and manipulation of large datasets
2. Fast and flexible sorting, grouping, and joining operations
3. Optimized for dealing with ordered data
4. Support for in-memory calculations on large datasets
5. Integration with R programming language for data analysis and visualization tasks
tags: R package, Data manipulation, Data analysis, Data visualization

Description: JupyterLab is a web-based interactive development environment for Jupyter notebooks, code, and data. It offers a flexible and powerful user interface to work with data, code, and visualization in a seamless manner.
core features: Web-based interface for interactive computing, Support for Jupyter notebooks, text editors, terminals, and custom components, Integration with data visualization libraries and tools, Ability to work with multiple programming languages like Python, R, and Julia, Customizable user interface with drag-and-drop features, Interactive widgets for data exploration and visualization
tags: interactive computing, data visualization, Jupyter notebooks, web-based interface, code editing
